story:
We reached our goal!  Thank you for your support. 

You can still sponsor this book or help out until the end of this month!  

Send me an e-mail to learn how! speakingOUT@rachelleleesmith.com

Any additional support will help get this work exhibited and allow for a larger marketing effort to get this book into the hands of those who need it!)

            Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus

                          

ABOUT:

Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus is a photographic essay that shares the experiences and stories of LGBTQ youth through handwritten text and imagery. Taking place over a span of a decade, the project that started on gallery walls is now becoming a book!

Help us to make it affordable and accessible for all!

Let’s get these voices seen and heard!

The collection of voices captured by Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus strives to raise awareness by reinforcing the idea that there is strength in numbers, power in words and freedom in art.  

The Work -www.rachelleleesmith.com/speakingOUT

The Publishers -www.PMpress.org and www.ReachAndTeach.com

The Praise -www.rachelleleesmith.com/speaking-out/accolades

The Press -www.rachelleleesmith.com/press

Exhibitions -www.rachelleleesmith.com/shows


Check OUT this video for an extended Q&A:

Interviews


CONTRIBUTORS:

Photography and project creation by Rachelle Lee Smith - an award-winning and internationally shown photographer based in Philadelphia whose work in Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus combines her passions for activism and photography.

A foreword by Gandace Gingrich - an LGBT rights activist at the Human Rights Campaign focusing on youth. Her involvement in the movement for queer equality began when her brother, Rep. Newt Gingrich, R-GA., was elected House speaker.

An afterword by Graeme Taylor- At age 14, Graeme skyrocketed to international attention when he confronted a school board for not defending gay rights in it’s schools. In the process, Graeme became one of the youngest and most widely known openly gay teens in America. He was interviewed on MSNBC’s Jansing & Co. and the Ellen Degeneres Show and is now the subject of a short film, Shrug


STATEMENT:

Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus is a photographic essay that explores a wide spectrum of experiences told from the perspective of a diverse group of young people, ages fourteen to twenty-four, identifying as queer (i.e., lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, or questioning). Portraits are presented without judgment or stereotype by eliminating environmental influence with a stark white backdrop.

This backdrop acts as a blank canvas, where each subject’s personal thoughts are handwritten onto the final photographic print. With more than sixty-five portraits photographed over a period of ten years, Speaking OUT provides rare insight into the passions, confusions, prejudices, joys, and sorrows felt by queer youth.

Speaking OUT gives a voice to an under-served group of people that are seldom heard and often silenced. The collaboration of image and first-person narrative serves to provide an outlet, show support, create dialogue, and help those who struggle. It not only shows unity within the LGBTQ community, but also commonalities regardless of age, race, gender, and sexual orientation. With recent media attention and the success of initiatives such as the It Gets Better Project, resources for queer youth have grown. Still, a void exists which Speaking OUT directly addresses: this book is for youth, by youth.

Speaking OUT is an award-winning, nationally and internationally shown and published body of work. These images have been published in magazines such as the Advocate, School Library Journal, Curve, Girlfriends, and Out, and showcased by the Human Rights Campaign, National Public Radio, Public Television, and the U.S. Department of Education. The work continues to show in galleries, universities, youth centers, and churches around the world.

                              CLICK HERE FOR MORE SINGLE IMAGES


WHERE WE'VE BEEN:

EXHIBITIONS

Shippensburg University, Gender Reel Festival, West Hill United Church, US Department of Education Federal LGBT Youth Summit, Mazzoni Health Center Gala, Identity Youth Center, The Cube Gallery, Santa Clara University, The University of Maryland, William Way Community Center Art Gallery, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Headquarters, III Warsaw Festival of Photography, The University of the Arts,True Expression Center Gallery, Syracuse University, Equality Forum Art Show with Young Gay America, Photo Review Awards Show, Space 315, University of Florida, The Society for Photographic Education

MAGAZINES & ONLINE

Tikkun Daily, Zannegaar, Institute for War and Peace Reporting (IWPR) Iran Program, Philadelphia Gay News, Philadelphia Magazine – G Philly, Out in Jersey, CNS News, US Department of Education, SheWired.org, PhotoArt Mag and PhotoArt.cz, Philadelphia Inquirer, Leeway Foundation, Human Rights Campaign – Equality, Rutgers University – Answer, The Washington Blade, TheNewGay.net, III Warszawski Festiwal Fotigrafii Artystycznej, Arcadia University – Tower, Out and About, School Library Journal, Mane Aktuell, Out Magazine, NYC Gay City News, Girlfriends Magazine, Visions, Reaching Out- Law School Admission Council, WYBE: “Philly Live”,  Philadelphia Daily News, Temple News, YoungGayAmerica Magazine, Philly Weekly, Syracuse University Newspaper, Photo Review, The Advocate, Curve Magazine


WHERE WE WILL GO (with your help):

EVERYWHERE

Libraries, Schools, Universities, Dentist Offices, Youth Centers, Community Centers, Galleries, Book Stores, Counseling Centers, Your Parent’s House, Your Brother's Coffee Table, Your Sister's Desk, A Teen’s Book Shelf, Homes Around the World…

YOUR HANDS!


WHERE THE FUNDS WILL GO:

Producing a book costs a lot.  Printing a full color photo book costs quite a bit more.

A lot of the work (traveling, camera equipment, lighting gear, film, processing, paper, image printing costs) is behind us, but, in order to get this book to be affordable to a wide reaching audience, we need money for:

Designing

Editing

Printing

Shipping

Storing

Marketing

Advertising

But ultimately the money is going to THE VISIBILITY OF QUEER YOUTH

Anything over the goal will allow us to travel with a show of the work!

Showing

Traveling

PERKS:

ACCOLADES:

Perez Hilton – Blogger and Television Personality

Rachelle Lee Smith has created a book that is not only visually stunning but also gripping with powerful words and even more inspiring young people! This is an important work of art! I highly recommend buying it and sharing it!

Kevin Jennings, Executive Director of the Arcus Foundation, former Assistant Deputy Secretary of Education, leader of the Obama Administration’s anti-bullying initiative and founder of Gay, Lesbian, and Straight Education Network (GLSEN)

Rachelle Lee Smith's innovative photographs allow us to see LGBT youth in authentic ways where they give voice to and name their own experiences.  A truly eye-opening set of work!

Sean Buffington – President, The University of the Arts

Rachelle Lee Smith's photographic project presents us with the face and the voice of this generation of LGBT youth: they are passionate, angry, funny, and committed. As an openly gay educational leader, I think this project is critical - not only for young queer people, but for their teachers, parents, mentors, and friends. We need to put this project in libraries and schools across the country!

The Advocate  –  Magazine

Portraits of a Revolution: Photographer Rachelle Lee Smith gives lesbian and gay youth an outlet to speak for themselves.

Simple, yet powerful photos of queer youth speak reams.

Candace Gingrich – HRC's Associate Director for Youth & Campus Engagement

Queer youth have a powerful story to tell and Rachelle Lee Smith has given voice to them through her stark, gorgeous photography. Speaking OUT captures the essence of LGBTQ young people - proud, visible and with something important to say. Smith's collection offers a glimpse of Generation Equality you won't easily forget.

Malcolm Lazin – Executive Director, Equality Forum

Rachelle Lee Smith’s photographs take us one step closer and provide an inside, emotionally bare look at some of the unheard voices of young queer people. Smith offers a suggestion of the vast numbers of diversity of gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender youth and encourages her subjects to express their own powerful ideas and thoughts. The work is especially impressive in its presentation of image and written narrative of GLBTQ youth.

I have followed Rachelle's work for over ten years. Her work has made a unique contribution to GLBT civil rights.

Angela D. Giampolo, Esquire  – LGBT Advocate, Lawyer and Media Personality

I highly recommend that everyone hurry up and buy Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus now!  My friend, colleague and esteemed award-winning photographer, Rachelle Lee Smith, has spent over a decade photographing and memorializing queer youth in a way that showcases the struggle we have ALL faced while coming of age and coming to terms with who we are.  This book is so powerful that you even see the present struggles the kids are facing through one look captured from a certain angle.  As you turn the pages, you’re hit at your core and brought back to a memory of something you have or are currently dealing with.  It’s truly a transformative book published during a time in our collective LGBTQ history when we should be focusing on our queer youth as our future as well as acknowledging and accepting our own personal struggles.

David Graham – Photographer, author Taking Liberties, Almost Paradise

The perfectly executed photographs, the passionate handwritten text, the insights, secrets and revelations all combine to make this a powerful body of work. Ms. Smith has shown a light on a group of young people and illuminated the world in which they live.

Liz Moore – Author, Heft, The Words of Every Song  

Rachelle Lee Smith's art captures something essential about each of her subjects; it transcends the static nature of photography and makes each person come to vivid life on the page. Their written words amplify this sensation. Smith is an artist to watch.

Dr. Warren J. Blumenfeld, Ed.D. – Professor, Iowa State, University of Massachusetts

The young people profiled in this remarkable book represent the tip of the volcano of a new generation transforming and revolutionizing the society and its institutions by challenging overall power inequities related not only to sexuality and gender identity categorizations and hierarchies, but they are also making links in the various types of oppression, and are forming coalitions with other marginalized groups. Their stories, experiences, and activism have great potential to bring us to a future where people across gender and sexuality spectrums will live freely, unencumbered by social taboos and cultural norms of gender and sexuality.

Ryan Sallans –  Transgender Speaker and Author of Second Son: Transitioning Toward My Destiny, Love and Life

The power of a look, a pose, and a story can be seen through Rachelle Lee Smith’s photography and the youth who opened up their raw emotions, insecurities and celebrations to us all. Sharing stories saves lives, but also reminds us that there can be continual struggle in finding identity and acceptance.

Innosanto Nagara –  Author, A is for Activist, Cofounder, Design Action Collective, Oakland

This is a STUNNING book. And it's important. It's important that the next generation is SEEN the way it sees itself. We rightfully put a lot of emphasis on being heard—on words. But a picture is worth a thousand words, and this book's striking focus on the AESTHETICS of this group of queer youth is thoroughly refreshing. Bravo!

Ed Hermance – Owner Giovanni’s Room, the oldest LGBT book store in America

It's wonderful to see so many happy kids. You wouldn't have seen such a crowd fifty years ago.  Sometimes things do get better.

Mark Segal – Publisher, Philadelphia Gay News and the nations most awarded LGBT journalist

It's often said that our youth are our future.  In the LGBT community before they become the future we must help them survive today.  This book showcases the diversity of creative imagination it takes to get us to tomorrow.  

Gretta Vosper – Minister and author With or Without God: Why the Way We Live is More Important than What We Believe

Photography, as its most basic, is a juxtaposition of light and darkness. Capturing an image with the perfect blend of these two things is an art. Rachelle Lee Smith achieves that high standing and raises the bar by bringing not only the light and darkness of the image into focus but also the light and darkness of her subjects. In this profoundly moving and important collection, the art of photography is beautifully pressed beyond its printed product and into the real world where sexuality, love, and identity, and the damage that can be wreaked upon each of them, is exposed. A brilliant light elegantly shone. Thank you, Rachelle.

Carrie Jacobs, PhD – Executive Director, Attic Youth Center (PA)  

Rachelle’s work speaks volumes - telling stories that need be told and giving voice to those whose lives need to be heard.  She has created an opportunity for LGBTQ youth to express their power and voice. I believe that every young person who witnesses this work will feel a part of that power.

Tom Wilson Weinberg – Founder of Giovanni’s Room, America’s first LGBT Book Store

Rachelle's photos are full of life and thrilling in their originality. The marriage of photos and text results in mini-biographies of these vibrant young LGBTers.

Human Rights Campaign

Rachelle Lee Smith has created a powerful (art exhibit) sharing the stories of gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender youth. Youth from across the country were photographed and asked to offer their voice, opinions, and comments about their experience as GLBT. In their own words and handwriting, these youth have shared their stories creating a very intimate and personal view on what it is like to be a GLBT person today.

B. Proud – Photographer, Professor, Author First Comes Love  

The use of the square format with visible film edges further confines the subjects to a limited environment.  They are boxed in.  Yet they leap and dance and laugh; they brood or they stare us directly in the eye, their spirits transcending the boundaries of the frame and daring us to be free enough to love, honor and live together in harmony. These are photographs that not only need to be seen, they need to be heard.

Erin Gotthardt – Coordinator, Identity Center (NY)

Being able to display several pieces from this project in our youth center gave Identity Youth the opportunity to see that they are not alone; there are other young people who have experienced the same joy, frustration, sorrow, hatred, love, confusion, peace, ostracism and belonging.  Through this project, the youth were able to find the rare accurate mirror of themselves, and to contribute their own faces and voices to the positive self-view of other queer youth.

Thank you for making it this far!  

You are dedicated. 

Thank you for your support!

Taking place over a span of a decade, the project that started on gallery walls is now becoming a book!Help us to make it affordable and accessible for all!Let’s get these voices seen and heard!The collection of voices captured by Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus strives to raise awareness by reinforcing the idea that there is strength in numbers, power in words and freedom in art.  The Work -www.rachelleleesmith.com/speakingOUTThe Publishers -www.PMpress.org  and www.ReachAndTeach.comThe Praise -www.rachelleleesmith.com/speaking-out/accoladesThe Press -www.rachelleleesmith.com/pressExhibitions -www.rachelleleesmith.com/showsCheck OUT this video for an extended Q&A:InterviewsCONTRIBUTORS:Photography and project creation by Rachelle Lee Smith - an award-winning and internationally shown photographer based in Philadelphia whose work in Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus combines her passions for activism and photography.A foreword by Gandace Gingrich - an LGBT rights activist at the Human Rights Campaign focusing on youth. Her involvement in the movement for queer equality began when her brother, Rep. Newt Gingrich, R-GA., was elected House speaker.An afterword by Graeme Taylor- At age 14, Graeme skyrocketed to international attention when he confronted a school board for not defending gay rights in it’s schools. In the process, Graeme became one of the youngest and most widely known openly gay teens in America. He was interviewed on MSNBC’s Jansing & Co. and the Ellen Degeneres Show and is now the subject of a short film, ShrugSTATEMENT:Speaking OUT: Queer Youth in Focus is a photographic essay that explores a wide spectrum of experiences told from the perspective of a diverse group of young people, ages fourteen to twenty-four, identifying as queer (i.e., lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, or questioning). Portraits are presented without judgment or stereotype by eliminating environmental influence with a stark white backdrop.This backdrop acts as a blank canvas, where each subject’s personal thoughts are handwritten onto the final photographic print. With more than sixty-five portraits photographed over a period of ten years, Speaking OUT provides rare insight into the passions, confusions, prejudices, joys, and sorrows felt by queer youth.Speaking OUT gives a voice to an under-served group of people that are seldom heard and often silenced. The collaboration of image and first-person narrative serves to provide an outlet, show support, create dialogue, and help those who struggle. It not only shows unity within the LGBTQ community, but also commonalities regardless of age, race, gender, and sexual orientation. With recent media attention and the success of initiatives such as the It Gets Better Project, resources for queer youth have grown. Still, a void exists which Speaking OUT directly addresses: this book is for youth, by youth.Speaking OUT is an award-winning, nationally and internationally shown and published body of work. These images have been published in magazines such as the Advocate, School Library Journal, Curve, Girlfriends, and Out, and showcased by the Human Rights Campaign, National Public Radio, Public Television, and the U.S. Department of Education. story:
Hi, I'm Jean Owen. Most of you know my sister Shanti, also known as Patty Owen to our family and friends from her super model days. Most of you also know that Shanti has been writing her memoirs about her sex/love addiction for the past three years. Well, Shanti needs your help right now. She has plowed through her savings and maxed out her credit cards to finance her writing. She is so very close to completion and needs your support!

I have never seen my sister more dedicated to anything as she has been to her memoirs and her sobriety. Shanti is clear that her revelations will be embarrassing, incriminating, and could prevent her from attaining future work. But she is whole heartedly committed to taking the shame out of sex addiction. It is an addiction, like any other, and quite debilitating.

I encouraged my sister to create a crowd funding campaign. Okay, that's a lie. I strong armed her into it! Shanti stopped working three years ago to write her memoirs. As her sister, I know ALL about this sexual roller coaster ride of hers. She had fun for some of it, not going to lie about that either. But she also suffered greatly with it, especially her years with her recent ex-husband. Swinger parties, orgies, and prostitution were second nature to her by then. But when our mother passed in July of 2011, Shanti finally woke up and decided to stop this sexual freight train. Our 52-year-old hooker. Go figure! But if there was ever a way to do something outlandish, my sister has always found a way.

By October of 2011, Shanti had no husband, no income, no mother, and her daughter moved out to begin college. With her empty nest and empty bank accounts, Shanti began the painful task of getting sober from this sex/love addiction. Her memoirs chronicle a life of sexual abuse that she never even told me about. That is how much shame she had. But my mother's death freed her, thanks Mom, and she wants to share her revelations and triumphs with the world.

Shanti has been sex sober for three years now and happier than ever. She wants to share with you her crazy ride and mostly, her journey into wholeness. PLEASE GIVE GENEROUSLY. I love my sister. Thank you.

Okay, below is what Shanti wants to tell you. Mine is better. Sister rivalry runs deep!

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Patty Owen is a former super model turned super slut. Reinventing herself as a nun in the 90's and changing her name to Shanti, which means peace and tranquility, Shanti reinvents herself again in the new millennium as a legal secretary and high-priced prostitute. She now writes about her fall from grace and her undiagnosed sex/love addiction.

Excerpt from preface to Memoirs of a Legal Courtesan.

“After my wild ride in the 80's as an international super model and a painful stint of sexual harassment in Hollywood, I left the life of glitz and glamour to heal my sexual abuse wounds on a deep spiritual journey spanning several years. But when I returned to NYC, all my old demons were still waiting. Not even the conservative corporate environment of law could stop me.

Born of extreme pain and fueled by the terror of coming close to that pain, a serial sex addict joined the path of promiscuity. My former path to enlightenment; meditation, prayer, and service, became the souvenirs of a time long past. If I can't be the perfect nun then let me be the perfect slut!”

When I crashed from my sex addiction three years ago, I was devastated. I had just buried my mother, my only child moved cross country to begin college, and I threw my husband out for his infidelities. But why would I care if my husband was sleeping around? I was making money as a 52-year-old prostitute. Initially I blamed my husband for what I became for he supported it. But I knew, after weeks of ranting at his sexual misconduct, that nothing comes to us by accident. What I saw in him was merely a reflection of my own shadow.

Though I didn't know how to survive without income from prostitution, I quit cold turkey. Living alone it was finally safe to look at this sexual beast in the eye. I went through intense therapy, 12-step programs, and recommitted to my spiritual journey. But when I researched information about women with sex addictions, I discovered that most of the literature was geared towards men. Though extremely embarrassed to be so exposed, I knew then that I needed to get this information out. I was not the only woman suffering with this addiction. I had met many lost souls along the journey with me.

I've gone through all of my savings and have exhausted my credit lines. Yet I have a few more months before the book is complete and then shopping for a literary agent, publisher, and onwards toward the big and small screens. Any and all of your SUPPORT is GREATLY APPRECIATED!

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

  • Brief description of campaign and why it's important to me.
My campaign is to raise money so that I can finish my memoirs, find a literary agent, publisher, then a film/TV producer. I am currently working with my developmental editor and we are only a couple of months away from completion. THREE YEARS of YAY!!!
It is beyond important that my memoirs get published for I know that many suffer in silence with sex/love addictions. If coming out with my dirty secrets will help millions, than I am ready to wash my ego.

  • Magnitude of what contributors will help me achieve.

Your contributors will totally support me in realizing my dream! I want to be the poster child for sex/love addictions so that others will also find the courage to come forward and heal. Helping others is why I am doing this. I am taking a huge risk by exposing my past but it will all be worth it when those that have stayed in the shadows finally come back out into the light.

What I Need 

  • 35k funding  (see breakdown below)
  • 12k living expenses for next 6 months (to finish memoirs and promote)
  • 10k developmental editor
  •   5k proof reader
  •   3k book design
  •   3k travel expenses to LA for book/film/TV promotion
  •   2k Indiegogo campaign fees  

 What If Entire Financial Goal Not Met?

I will spend only one more month writing full time then look for a job. Memoirs will take longer to complete but they will be complete!
  •   2k living expenses for next month  
  • 10k developmental editor
  •   5k proof reader
  •   3k book design
  •   2k Indiegogo campaign fees

What You Get - Unique Perks

  • Acknowledgment in memoirs! 
  • Signed copy of my 30-page modeling portfolio!!
  • 12 hours with Shanti!! (coaching if desired)
  • Producer credit for book tour!!!

The Impact

  • Sex addiction is directly related to sex trafficking. If we, as a global community, do not heal our intimacy issues, sex trafficking will continue to spiral out of control. Sex trafficking recently surpassed illegal arm sales and now poised to surpass illegal drug sales as the #1 illegal business in the world. Sex trafficking grossed over 32 billion dollars in 2013. Your contribution to my campaign will have a direct impact on the dissolution of sex trafficking rings. Less sexual demand, less sexual supply needed. It's that simple.
  • I have a history of success in every field I have ever endeavored; from championship track & field events in high school & college, super model career, acting (Miami Vice), executive legal secretary, and relationship coach (ABC reality show appearance). Finally, I am unveiling my writing talents that all my teachers from grade school through college have encouraged me to pursue. In 5th grade I received a congratulatory letter from the White House during the Nixon administration for my essay concerning the environment and my proposed protection plans. Not much has changed. The activist lives powerfully within me and I continue to write.

Risks & Challenges

Greatest challenge may be that I don't find a traditional publisher in the next six months. However, if that's the case, I will begin by self publishing so you can start reading Memoirs of a Legal Courtesan sooner! 

I may lose heart temporarily but I never give up. I am a born fighter. The greater the challenge the harder I fight!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not be able to contribute financially at this time. I totally understand this. Been in this spot for three years now. But you can still help!

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, Instagram, and Google +.
  • Forward the campaign via email and snail mail.
  • Call a friend in 12-step programs that understands the addiction struggle and may want to support my campaign to take the shame out of sex/love addictions.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

had no husband, no income, no mother, and her daughter moved out to begin college. With her empty nest and empty bank accounts, Shanti began
the painful task of getting sober from this sex/love addiction. Her
memoirs chronicle a life of sexual abuse that she never even told
me about. That is how much shame she had. But my mother's death freed
her, thanks Mom, and she wants to share her revelations and triumphs
with the world.


Shanti has been sex sober
for three years now and happier than ever. She wants to share with
you her crazy ride and mostly, her journey into wholeness.
PLEASE GIVE GENEROUSLY. I love my sister. Thank you.
Okay, below is what Shanti wants to tell you. Mine is better. Sister rivalry runs deep!
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Patty
Owen is a former super model turned super slut. Reinventing herself
as a nun in the 90's and changing her name to Shanti, which means
peace and tranquility, Shanti reinvents herself again in the new
millennium as a legal secretary and high-priced prostitute. She now
writes about her fall from grace and her undiagnosed sex/love
addiction.

Excerpt from preface to Memoirs of a Legal Courtesan.


“After
my wild ride in the 80's as an international super model and a
painful stint of sexual harassment in Hollywood, I left the life of
glitz and glamour to heal my sexual abuse wounds on a deep spiritual journey spanning several years. But when I returned to NYC, all my old demons were still
waiting. Not even the conservative corporate environment of law could
stop me.


Born
of extreme pain and fueled by the terror of coming close to that
pain, a serial sex addict joined the path of promiscuity. My former
path to enlightenment; meditation, prayer, and service,
became the souvenirs of a time long past. If I can't be the perfect
nun then let me be the perfect slut!”



When I crashed from my
sex addiction three years ago, I was devastated. I had just
buried my mother, my only child moved cross country to begin
college, and I threw my husband out for his infidelities. But why
would I care if my husband was sleeping around? I was making money as
a 52-year-old prostitute. Initially I blamed my husband for what I became for he supported it. But I knew, after weeks of ranting at his
sexual misconduct, that nothing comes to us by accident. What I saw
in him was merely a reflection of my own shadow.


Though I didn't know how
to survive without income from prostitution, I quit cold turkey.
Living alone it was finally safe to look at this sexual beast in the
eye. I went through intense therapy, 12-step programs, and
recommitted to my spiritual journey. But when I researched information about women with sex addictions, I discovered that most
of the literature was geared towards men. Though extremely embarrassed to be so
exposed, I knew then that I needed to get this information out. I was
not the only woman suffering with this addiction. I had met many lost
souls along the journey with me.


I've gone through all of
my savings and have exhausted my credit lines. Yet I have a few more
months before the book is complete and then shopping for a literary agent, publisher, and onwards toward the big
and small screens. Any and all of your SUPPORT is GREATLY
APPRECIATED!
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Brief description of campaign and why it's important to me.


My campaign is to raise money so that I can finish my memoirs, find a literary agent, publisher, then a film/TV producer. I am currently working with my developmental editor and we are only a couple of months away from completion. THREE YEARS of YAY!!!
It is beyond important that my memoirs get published for I know that many suffer in silence with sex/love addictions. If coming out with my dirty secrets will help millions, than I am ready to wash my ego.

 Magnitude of what contributors will help me achieve.  Your contributors will totally support me in realizing my dream! I want to be the poster child for sex/love addictions so that others will also find the courage to come forward and heal. Helping others is why I am doing this. I am taking a huge risk by exposing my past but it will all be worth it when those that have stayed in the shadows finally come back out into the light.   What I Need 

35k funding  (see breakdown below)
12k living expenses for next 6 months (to finish memoirs and promote)
10k developmental editor
  5k proof reader
  3k book design
  3k travel expenses to LA for book/film/TV promotion
  2k Indiegogo campaign fees  



 What If Entire Financial Goal Not Met?
I will spend only one more month writing full time then look for a job. Memoirs will take longer to complete but they will be complete!



  2k living expenses for next month  


10k developmental editor


  5k proof reader


  3k book design

  2k Indiegogo campaign fees

What You Get - Unique Perks





Acknowledgment in memoirs! 


Signed copy of my 30-page modeling portfolio!!


12 hours with Shanti!! (coaching if desired)

Producer credit for book tour!!!

   The Impact

Sex addiction is directly related to sex trafficking. If we, as a global community, do not heal our intimacy issues, sex trafficking will continue to spiral out of control. Sex trafficking recently surpassed illegal arm sales and now poised to surpass illegal drug sales as the #1 illegal business in the world. Sex trafficking grossed over 32 billion dollars in 2013. Your contribution to my campaign will have a direct impact on the dissolution of sex trafficking rings. Less sexual demand, less sexual supply needed. It's that simple.
I have a history of success in every field I have ever endeavored; from championship track & field events in high school & college, super model career, acting (Miami Vice), executive legal secretary, and relationship coach (ABC reality show appearance). Finally, I am unveiling my writing talents that all my teachers from grade school through college have encouraged me to pursue. In 5th grade I received a congratulatory letter from the White House during the Nixon administration for my essay concerning the environment and my proposed protection plans. Not much has changed. The activist lives powerfully within me and I continue to write.    Risks & Challenges
Greatest challenge may be that I don't find a traditional publisher in the next six months. However, if that's the case, I will begin by self publishing so you can start reading Memoirs of a Legal Courtesan sooner! 
I may lose heart temporarily but I never give up. I am a born fighter. The greater the challenge the harder I fight!   Other Ways You Can Help Some of you might not be able to contribute financially at this time. I totally understand this. Been in this spot for three years now. But you can still help!  You can get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
Share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, Instagram, and Google +.
Forward the campaign via email and snail mail.
Call a friend in 12-step programs that understands the addiction struggle and may want to support my campaign to take the shame out of sex/love addictions. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The author

My name is Jeff Slack.  I've spent the last 20+ years working with people in church ministry in the southern California area.  I'm a husband, a dad and a dog lover.  Throughout my years in ministry I have written many curriculum pieces which have been published; wrote and produced an award-winning multimedia curriculum on adoption; and wrote and self-published a book for families to grow closer together.
Why am I doing this?
I believe men today need to be challenged to look beyond their past failures.  Sand In My Teeth is a book to challenge men to think of their legacies rather then those failures from their journeys that drive so many of us men toward frustration and exhaustion.  Complete with biblical small group questions, Sand In My Teeth is a book which challenges men to understand God can use those past failures for His glory but the real place we should focus on is what's ahead.  Utilizing some of my own stories from my chaotic, embarrassing and dysfunctional upbringing, I hope to engage men in a very real and honest place to help them understand nothing is impossible with God.
Why Do I Need Your Help?
I understand that I cannot do this on my own.  Because I lack the bigger platform that publishers require to publish a book like this, I need to reach out to my friends to make this a reality.  With you partnering with me to produce this book, I believe we can provide a resource to good men that will help them become better men.
What will the money we raise be used for?
Publishing Costs :This includes layout and design, cover art, ISBN #, Library of Congress Control Number, E-book formatting and distribution.
Printing Costs : Basically, the more money we raise, the more books we print.  If we do not reach our goal, we will still utilize what we do raise to help with completing the project, just at a smaller level. It is our hope that we raise more than the $2500 in order to fund additional printing of the books.
Partnering Costs: a small portion of what we raise will be utilized to offset the costs of the items (perks) we are providing to those of you who partner with us.
We will be publishing through Westbow Press, which is the self-publishing wing of both Thomas Nelson and Zondervan Publishers.  Although there are less expensive routes to self-publish, this will allow us to utilize their great resources to both publish and market the book in the Christian marketplace.
How else might you help?
You can help with this project by getting the word out to your friends and family.  Facebook, email, instagram; however you might connect with your people would be both welcome and appreciated.
You can also use the indiegogo share tools to help get the word out as well.
What people who have read the book already are saying about it:

“The book is fantastic.  It is written in a way that allows you to enter into a real person’s life, to see inside the struggles of life without sugar coating the events.  Every person should be able to see themselves in one of the many stories.  It is a great read.”

Dr. Roger Tirabassi, author, counselor, pastor

 

“If you like Ragamuffin Gospel, you will love Sand in My Teeth.  Jeff Slack tells his story and at the same time, encourages men to be all God created them to be, not defining themselves by something they have done in the past.”

Dr. Jerry Huson, Executive Director of 7-Day Hero and former Men’s Pastor of Mariner’s Church, Irvine, Ca.

 

“In ‘Sand In My Teeth’, Jeff Slack has offered a real gift to both believers and those still searching.  But I must warn you that this is not your average ‘Christian Book’.  It’s contents are brutally candid and will challenge you to become more honest with yourself, with others and with God about embracing your own brokenness and allowing the Great Physician to heal you and lead you forward into a hope more amazing than you’ve ever thought possible…if you’re tired of pretending and are craving the unconditional embrace of a God who not only loves you-but likes you-exactly the way He created you, read this book!”

                                                                     Jeremy White, Pastor, Musician and Author

"Sand in My Teeth  --  it is impossible to read this book straight through; and if you can, why did you bother.  We are all unique and Jeff’s story is not your story, but it is hard to imagine not being able to relate even if you didn’t share the same experiences.  This book isn’t about understanding the trials and tribulations of one individual, but understanding how a faithful God can use any experience in our life to “eventually” glorify Him.    It is also a book about the courage it takes to face our own demons and live Truth rather than a feel good existence.  Besides being thought provoking, self-examining reading, it is a great tool for discussion – whether in a youth group, adult small group or other similar setting.  Be prepared to be challenged, as you figure out how your own story has affected your life."

                               Ron Stoddart,  Attorney, Retired Director of Nightlight Christian Adoptions

story:
Short Summary

Eyewear Publishing, founded in 2012, is already one of the best-known, and most respected, indie British poetry presses.  With over 21 books already published in stylish hardcover editions designed by Dutch artist-poet, Edwin Smet, we have created a very strong list and brand.  Our poets and authors are young and old, British and international, starting out and established, traditional and avant-garde.  We've published professors at Harvard and Cambridge; and a hitherto unknown lady from Hull in her 80s.  Our books have been listed for major prizes, and well-reviewed in the TLS and Times. One of our books has been adapted to appear on BBC Radio 4. We launch our books at shops like Foyle's, Blackwells and The LRB. Superbly edited, eclectic, adventurous, and committed to promoting new poets, Eyewear looks back to an age when hardcover poetry was de rigeur and forward to the digital future.


What We Need & What You Get

 

We want to publish ten poetry collections next year.  Each will cost us £3,000 to edit, design, proofread, and print, in our striking and handsome hardcover in-house design.

Our poets for 2015 include world-renowned singer-songwriter Keaton Henson, Melita Hume winner Amy Blakemore, American poet Andrew Shields, Yale-prize winner Sean Singer, and leading poets from Australia, Ireland, Sweden, and, of course, Great Britain.


What you get is, for a £20 donation, a signed first edition of one of the 2015 titles.

For £200, you get all ten of the 2015 poetry books we have planned.

For £500 you get dinner with one of our authors in London.

For £1,000 or more, your name is printed at the back of the collection, as a special patron of Eyewear publishing (if you so wish).

The Impact

 We feel supporting Eyewear matters, because we have an excellent track record already, and have shown that our list is truly democratic and also international in outlook. Publishing poetry books that will last, and have a chance of being seen and read and distributed well makes a huge difference to the poets, to their readers, and to the wider culture of our times, which, more than ever, needs to maintain respect and love of a good well-made book.

Risks & Challenges

 We are going to muddle through somehow - our books do sell - though because of our high quality design we mainly break even, and that includes the editor not taking a salary. But with your support, we will have established a long term sustainable model to keep a great new press going. There is no Risk, because you will get what you pay for.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our Story

Over the last four years, Dennis and Jill Corley have traveled to over 11 countries dedicating their time to the creative writing program they created and founded One World, Many Stories. Through this program they have taught youth to build longlasting relationships between their cultures as they exchanged and shared their life stories. While sharing thier stories over 100 youth have created a culture of diversity and respect for one another.

 Both Dennis and Jill are professional grantwriters who now spend part of their time writing grants for agencies world wide and presenting ‘Zen’ Grant Writing Workshops. 

 With their interest in the Mayans Dennis and Jill wish to complete and publish their next book----  'A Better Life, 2013, On a Higher Road’, a story of the Mayans in Belize, the Honduras, the Yucatan and Guatemala. Pl.ease find below the description of what the book will be about

And we don’t know what to believe anymore

A Better Life, 2013

A Higher Road

Read and listen to the stories of 2012 from the elderly Mayans of the Yucatan, Honduras, Belize and Guatemala. Explore the meaning of life as a Mayan and what the significance of December 21, 2012 is to them.   A Better Life, 2013, On a Higher Road, is a 100+ page, hardcover photography and traditional Mayan story book featuring elderly Mayans. With quotes, photographs traditional stories and beliefs about the end of the Mayan Calendar, December 21, 2012, from the eldest surviving Mayan population.

Additional quotes from Scholars, experts of eschatological beliefs of different religions will also be present throughout the book

A few of the people and agencies that we will approach to appear in the book:

Mayans and Mayanist’s and others

Mayans

Cornerstone Foundation – Belize – Mayan Elders

Maya Foundation in Laakeech A.C. – Yucatan – Mayan Elders

Dar a Luz Honduras – Honduras – Mayan Elders

La Asociacion Nuestros Ahijados – Guatemala – Mayan Elders

Mayanist’s

Mark Van Stone-Maya Expert

Others

Ron Price-Ba Hai i’ Expert

Terry Nazon-Astrologer

Arlie Petters- Mathematician from Belize

…and many more!

Each portrait will be paired with their own short story, the subject about —– some aspect of joy, the meaning, the passion, and the belief of the Mayan calendar and the date December 21, 2012. These stories could focus on the pleasure of a treasured tradition, the impact of a powerful experience, the level of consciousness of a Mayan Shaman in the year 2012 and beyond, or many other topics.

The finished product will be a 6″x10″, 100+ pages, and cloth-bound, hardcover, professionally printed photography book in full color on thick, #100 paper stock. Printed in the USA. We will be printing 5,000 copies of the book.

We are planning to travel to over 11 cities, 2 in the Yucatan, 1 in Belize, 1 in the Honduras, and 7 in Guatemala, photographing and gathering stories from the elderly Mayans in their own settings and villages reflecting the true life a Mayan. The whole project will take roughly nine months to complete. The book will then be published ending on January 21, 2013

2012

The 2012 phenomenon comprises a range of eschatological beliefs according to which cataclysmic or transformative events will occur on December 21, 2012. This date is regarded as the end-date of a 5,125-year-long cycle in the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar. Various astronomical alignments and numerological formulae have been proposed as pertaining to this date, though none have been accepted by mainstream scholarship.

A New Age interpretation of this transition is that this date marks the start of time in which Earth and its inhabitants may undergo a positive physical or spiritual transformation, and that 2012 may mark the beginning of a new era. Others suggest that the 2012 date marks the end of the world or a similar catastrophe. Scenarios suggested for the end of the world include the arrival of the next solar maximum, or Earth’s collision with a black hole, passing asteroid or a planet called “Nibiru.

Scholars from various disciplines have dismissed the idea of such cataclysmic events occurring in 2012. Professional Mayanist scholars state that predictions of impending doom are not found in any of the extant classic Maya accounts, and that the idea that the Long Count calendar “ends” in 2012 misrepresents Maya history and culture. Astronomers and other scientists have rejected the proposed events as pseudoscience, stating that they are contradicted by simple astronomical observations.

THE IMPACT

December 21st 2012 – a date that is well known globally. Several hundred years ago, the Ancient Mayans predicted the apocalypse on this very date. With their 5,125 year old calendar resetting itself to 0.0.0.0. on this date, many are preparing for the worst. However, how legit is the prophecy of the Mayans? 

The goal and impact of this book is to dispel the common misconception that the end of the world is near with hope that we can instill the belief that there is a new transcendental age coming according to the direct belief of the Mayans.  We hope this book can reach out and serve as an inspiration. Hopefully this project will show the world that the belief of the Mayans and the Mayan Calendar is a road to a better life, a life of unity among all people in the world.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

As of March 2012, We have:

  • Designed and began to write the preliminary manuscript
  • Researched and contacted all preliminary story-tellers and experts on the Mayan philosophy.
That's a good start, but it's a long way from a clean, polished final product. With the money we raise through this campaign, we will purchase:
  • Line-by-line editing by two different professional editors
  • Purchase of an additional professional camera
  • Professional photography editing and printing
  • Professional interior design (i.e. typesetting)
  • Professional cover design (physical book)
  • ISBN, copyright, and Library of Congress registration
  • Proof printing and the initial print run to send to IndieGoGo contributers
  • Additional copies of the book to send to alternative potential reviewers
  • Postage & supplies necessary to mail everything
 
These are the investments necessary to produce a beautiful photography storybook. By raising $7500 or more by April 23, 2012, we can secure the editorial, design, and printing services necessary to create a professional book that influential people will take seriously and then further spread its message.
 

We are independently publishing our book in order to retain full rights to the work. That way we can give away free copies to those who enjoy it most, offer special discounts, and run innovative fundraisers like this one! By supporting this campaign you're supporting a 100% indie publishing venture!

If we don't meet our $7500 goal, we will still move forward with the project and use whatever funds raised to publish and ship the best possible book. But more funds will equal a better book and an important message spread farther!
 

When Will You Receive the Book?

The planned release date for the book is January 21, 2013. As an IndieGoGo contributer, your books will ship one week early.

Other Ways You Can Participate

If you agree with this book's vision, We would love your help in spreading the word! Please use the "Share" tools at the top of this page to tell your online communities about the campaign.

Even if you can't contribute right now, telling just a few friends about this campaign will help immensely!

Here are four ways you can help let others know about this project:

 

  • Email your friends asking them to check out this Indiegogo page or visit the website at www.oneworldstories.org
  • Share this Indiegogo page or on your Facebook wall or Twitter:
  • You can also “like” us on Facebook www.facebook.com/oneworldmanystories

 

Any additional questions or comments, feel free to contact; Jill @ drmwjill@aol.com 

 

Follow us on twitter @oneworldstories

 

Thank you so much for your support!

 

If you would like to arrange a custom perk package that you don't see listed, please e-mail me and we'll work something out.

Join my private mailing list to receive e-mail updates on the book's progress and free goodies!

Finally, when you contribute, please click "Receive emails with updates from the campaign owner"—I'll be posting excerpts,  and more cool stuff through the IndieGoGo "Updates" feature.

 

Thanks for reading, and together we can share the beauty of the Mayan Culture.

Maya Foundation in Laakeech A.C. – Yucatan – Mayan Elders
Dar a Luz Honduras – Honduras – Mayan Elders
La Asociacion Nuestros Ahijados – Guatemala – Mayan Elders
Mayanist’s
Mark Van Stone-Maya Expert
Others
Ron Price-Ba Hai i’ Expert
Terry Nazon-Astrologer
Arlie Petters- Mathematician from Belize
…and many more!
Each portrait will be paired with their own short story, the subject about —– some aspect of joy, the meaning, the passion, and the belief of the Mayan calendar and the date December 21, 2012. These stories could focus on the pleasure of a treasured tradition, the impact of a powerful experience, the level of consciousness of a Mayan Shaman in the year 2012 and beyond, or many other topics.
The finished product will be a 6″x10″, 100+ pages, and cloth-bound, hardcover, professionally printed photography book in full color on thick, #100 paper stock. Printed in the USA. We will be printing 5,000 copies of the book.
We are planning to travel to over 11 cities, 2 in the Yucatan, 1 in Belize, 1 in the Honduras, and 7 in Guatemala, photographing and gathering stories from the elderly Mayans in their own settings and villages reflecting the true life a Mayan. The whole project will take roughly nine months to complete. The book will then be published ending on January 21, 2013
2012
The 2012 phenomenon comprises a range of eschatological beliefs according to which cataclysmic or transformative events will occur on December 21, 2012. This date is regarded as the end-date of a 5,125-year-long cycle in the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar. Various astronomical alignments and numerological formulae have been proposed as pertaining to this date, though none have been accepted by mainstream scholarship.
A New Age interpretation of this transition is that this date marks the start of time in which Earth and its inhabitants may undergo a positive physical or spiritual transformation, and that 2012 may mark the beginning of a new era. Others suggest that the 2012 date marks the end of the world or a similar catastrophe. Scenarios suggested for the end of the world include the arrival of the next solar maximum, or Earth’s collision with a black hole, passing asteroid or a planet called “Nibiru.
Scholars from various disciplines have dismissed the idea of such cataclysmic events occurring in 2012. Professional Mayanist scholars state that predictions of impending doom are not found in any of the extant classic Maya accounts, and that the idea that the Long Count calendar “ends” in 2012 misrepresents Maya history and culture. Astronomers and other scientists have rejected the proposed events as pseudoscience, stating that they are contradicted by simple astronomical observations.


THE IMPACT
December 21st 2012 – a date that is well known globally. Several hundred years ago, the Ancient Mayans predicted the apocalypse on this very date. With their 5,125 year old calendar resetting itself to 0.0.0.0. on this date, many are preparing for the worst. However, how legit is the prophecy of the Mayans? 
The goal and impact of this book is to dispel the common misconception that the end of the world is near with hope that we can instill the belief that there is a new transcendental age coming according to the direct belief of the Mayans.  We hope this book can reach out and serve as an inspiration. Hopefully this project will show the world that the belief of the Mayans and the Mayan Calendar is a road to a better life, a life of unity among all people in the world.
WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET


As of March 2012, We have:

Designed and began to write the preliminary manuscript
Researched and contacted all preliminary story-tellers and experts on the Mayan philosophy.

That's a good start, but it's a long way from a clean, polished final product. With the money we raise through this campaign, we will purchase:

Line-by-line editing by two different professional editors
Purchase of an additional professional camera
Professional photography editing and printing
Professional interior design (i.e. typesetting)
Professional cover design (physical book)
ISBN, copyright, and Library of Congress registration
Proof printing and the initial print run to send to IndieGoGo contributers
Additional copies of the book to send to alternative potential reviewers
Postage & supplies necessary to mail everything

 

These are the investments necessary to produce a beautiful photography storybook. By raising $7500 or more by April 23, 2012, we can secure the editorial, design, and printing services necessary to create a professional book that influential people will take seriously and then further spread its message.

 


We are independently publishing our book in order to retain full rights to the work. That way we can give away free copies to those who enjoy it most, offer special discounts, and run innovative fundraisers like this one! By supporting this campaign you're supporting a 100% indie publishing venture!


If we don't meet our $7500 goal, we will still move forward with the project and use whatever funds raised to publish and ship the best possible book. But more funds will equal a better book and an important message spread farther!
 


When Will You Receive the Book?
The planned release date for the book is January 21, 2013. As an IndieGoGo contributer, your books will ship one week early.



Other Ways You Can Participate
If you agree with this book's vision, We would love your help in spreading the word! Please use the "Share" tools at the top of this page to tell your online communities about the campaign.
Even if you can't contribute right now, telling just a few friends about this campaign will help immensely!
Here are four ways you can help let others know about this project:
 

Email your friends asking them to check out this Indiegogo page or visit the website at www.oneworldstories.org

Share this Indiegogo page or on your Facebook wall or Twitter:
You can also “like” us on Facebook www.facebook.com/oneworldmanystories


 
Any additional questions or comments, feel free to contact; Jill @ drmwjill@aol.com  
 
Follow us on twitter @oneworldstories
 
Thank you so much for your support!
 
If you would like to arrange a custom perk package that you don't see listed, please e-mail me and we'll work something out.
Join my private mailing list to receive e-mail updates on the book's progress and free goodies!
Finally, when you contribute, please click "Receive emails with updates from the campaign owner"—I'll be posting excerpts,  and more cool stuff through the IndieGoGo "Updates" feature.
 
Thanks for reading, and together we can share the beauty of the Mayan Culture.

story:
Hi, I'm Cynthia. The last couple of years I've been piecing together a story that began one evening while I was tucking in our two oldest boys.

Each night I would tell bedtime stories and have my sons choose the names of some of the characters, or the next twist in the adventure. Over time these stories took form and became bigger than bedtime stories...

They became "The Adventures of the Brothers Brave & Noble," a middle grade science fiction novel in which brothers Brave and Noble Hewlett are transported to another realm of the Universe, The Existence, where all the places and Friends of our imaginations dwell. The Existence is in peril with their caretakers missing and the mysterious, deceitful Quedro on a mission to take advantage of using the imaginations of humans to create within the Existence everything he's ever desired. It's up to Brave and Noble and the other Friends in the Existence to make sure that doesn't happen, all the while dealing with their own doubts on the reality of this adventure and the difficulties typical adolescents brings.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order for a publishing house to take my manuscript seriously I need it to be professionally edited. This process has already begun, but it comes with a cost!

We need $1500 to cover remaining costs of editing and the perks for donating.

You can check out the editor here! She is a fantastic, award-winning editor, one of her projects was even on the New York Times Bestsellers List! 

For contributing you get some fun and exclusive perks... 

  • a thank you from the bottom of my heart! (via email) and a free iTunes song
  • a PDF of the manuscript
  • a basic printed out hard copy of the manuscript with a handwritten thank you letter from me

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate now, you could still help out by spreading the news to your friends that love Middle Grade and Young Adult literature! 

Also, stay tuned to this page, I will be updating exclusive excerpts, images, and limited-time-only perks!

Thank you so much for your consideration, I can't wait for you to read The Adventures of the Brothers Brave & Noble!

story:
Hi there! My name is Debbi Mack, and I'm the New York Times ebook bestselling author of the Sam McRae mystery series.

I’ve started this campaign in order to make my series entirely self-published, and provide print copies of my bestselling ebooks to readers as perks for contributions.

Through this campaign, my goal is to release a new edition of my first novel under my own publishing imprint. Once I’ve done this, I’ll set a higher goal amount for the campaign, to fund the creation of upcoming books in the series.

About the Series

Stephanie Ann “Sam” McRae is a tough-talking, lawyer-sleuth, and champion for the underdog. The series is set in the Maryland suburbs, between Baltimore and Washington.

While Sam doesn’t seek out danger, it occasionally finds her. Having been orphaned while young, Sam is willing to go the distance for her clients, because she knows the system from both sides. As a result, she feels an intense loyalty and sense of duty to those in need.

The book trailer embedded above will give you a sense of Sam’s character, as well as the tone and setting of the stories.

In 2011, the first Sam McRae novel, Identity Crisis, made the New York Times ebook bestseller list. That book and the sequel, Least Wanted both became Kindle Top 100 bestsellers. Both novels also went on to reach the Top 100 on Amazon UK, with Least Wanted hitting the Top 10 and reaching at least as high as #6 on the charts. In 2012, I published Riptide, the third novel in the series.

Feel free to take a look at the gallery to see the book trailers for the first two books in the series, plus excerpts and covers for each book.

This is the latest novel.

Series Endorsements and Reviews

"I absolutely loved reading RIPTIDE! ... Sam McRae is the best attorney sleuth ever." --Jada Temple, reviewer, Thriller Ink Spot

"IDENTITY CRISIS and LEAST WANTED are tough acts to follow, but Debbi Mack meets her own high standards in RIPTIDE, attorney Sam McRae's third outing. Sam's attempt to help a friend who's been charged with murder leads her into an insular world where the secrets are so thick they create their own 'riptide.' A great read." -- Timothy Hallinan, Edgar-nominated author of the Poke Rafferty and Junior Bender thrillers

"A fast-paced, compelling crime novel that leaves the reader as buzzed and breathless as the Running of the Bulls." -- Benjamin Sobieck, author of CLEANSING EDEN

"Full of tension and suspense from cover-to-cover, RIPTIDE is a cracking good read." -- Leighton Gage, author of A VINE IN THE BLOOD

 "In LEAST WANTED, Debbi Mack serves up a solid mystery plot wired together with high octane suspense. Washington, DC attorney Sam McRae is smart, tough and dedicated, but her latest cases in LEAST WANTED push her to her limits. Defending two clients accused of murder, she finds herself dealing with girl gangs, pornography and crazed killers. For mystery and suspense, it’s Laura Lippman’s Tess Monaghan in Baltimore and Robert B. Parker’s Spenser in Boston, but Sam McRae is the woman to have at your back in Washington." -- Austin S. Camacho, author of the Hannibal Jones mystery series

"Sam McRae is back and as brash as ever, with a colorful cast, a relentless plot, and enough twists to leave you breathless. Debbi Mack has carved her own niche in the mystery pantheon."   -- Scott Nicholson, author of DISINTEGRATION

"LEAST WANTED hooks you from the start and never lets go. A fascinating and absorbing mystery." -- Simon Wood, author of LOWLIFES

 “Of suspense, Alfred Hitchcock once said, ‘There is no terror in the bang, only in the anticipation of it.’ Author Debbi Mack nails that statement in this tightly written tale about a flawed Maryland attorney, ‘Sam’ McRae, and her relentless search for a killer when the domestic abuse case she has been handling kicks itself up a notch: The accused is found dead and his wife has taken off. Not good. Add to that the FBI, the Mob, identity theft, and a vulnerable main character involved with a married prosecutor and you have a darn good page-turner. Debbi Mack crafts a taut narrative with crackling dialogue.” – Aimee Zuccarini, The Maryland Women’s Journal, Oct./Nov. 2009.

About this Project

The goal amount of this campaign is $5,000. At this level, I can distribute between 100 to 300 copies of my currently published print books, and produce and distribute a new edition of my first novel, Identity Crisis, to be released under my own publishing imprint, Renegade Press.

If this campaign succeeds, I’ll not only be able to more effectively distribute books, but I'll be doing so in a way that actually promotes literacy.

If this campaign exceeds the goal, I’ll use the excess funds to distribute even more books, as well as apply the remaining funds toward creating and distributing the fourth novel (in both electronic and print formats) in the series. At that point, I’ll stretch the goal and use the funds to publish and distribute the fourth book in the series. I’ll do this for each successive book in the series and keep contributors updated on my progress, thus extending the series for as long as I can find funding or until I close down the project.

Why I’m Doing This

As a writer, my job is to tell stories. It’s my desire to reach as many readers as possible. However, this project is about more than just me.

By using the Internet, I can not only reach individual readers, but I can efficiently distribute my work to bookstores, libraries, and literary groups or organizations. In this way, I believe all contributors, authors and readers can benefit.

This distribution method is not only more cost-effective and efficient for myself, but it's cheaper for individual readers, when contribution amounts are compared with retail prices plus shipping costs.

Each bookstore, library or group that supports the project will receive books as rewards. From there, they can decide whether to order the book through Ingram or seek more copies (digital or print), which I will gladly arrange to sell, donate or place on consignment, by request. Such arrangements are separate from this project, which primarily aims to distribute books to readers and other interested contributors.

By seeking contributors who make small donations, in exchange for fulfillment of rewards, my work will be distributed, in a way that will cover my costs, provide compensation for the creative and other work that went into this project, and will advance literacy in a meaningful way.

What You Can Do

Contributions are wonderful, of course. But if you can’t contribute money, you can help by spreading the word, through blogging, social media, email lists and personal contacts. Any and all help here is greatly appreciated, because publicity counts for so much. People can’t contribute to an effort they don’t know about.

So anything you can do to tell others about this helps immensely. Things like tweeting and retweeting about it, posting the information on blogs, Facebook, LinkedIn and other social media sites, emailing it to group lists on which you participate and sharing the information with anyone you know, who might be likewise supportive are all extremely helpful.

You can also make use of Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this.

More About Me

I'm currently writing the fourth novel in the series. My short stories have been featured in various anthologies, including Five Uneasy Pieces, Shaken: Stories for Japan, Chesapeake Crimes and Chesapeake Crimes: They Had It Comin’.

In September 2011, I appeared on a Sisters in Crime panel called “Brazen Hussies Speak Out: A Colloquium on Marketing”. The participants included Libby Jordan, Publicity Director of Open Road Media, Gina Panettieri, President of Talcott Notch Literary, and myself. Click on the YouTube video below to see the presentation.

In December 2012, I spoke about self-publishing to the Sisters in Crime, Richmond Chapter.

I'm a contributor to the book Making Story: Twenty-One Writers on How They Plot, edited by Timothy Hallinan.

I’ve also written one feature film script, The Enemy Within, which made the quarter-finals cut in the 2012 Scriptapalooza screenwriting contest.

I’m a member of Sisters in Crime, Mystery Writers of America, Private Eye Writers of America, American Independent Writers, Women in Film and Video, National Writers Union, and Maryland Writers Association.

I’ve appeared on panels at various writers’ conferences, including Malice Domestic, Bouchercon, and AIW’s annual writers’ conference. I’ve also given presentations on self-publishing at the Library of Congress and before the Howard County Chapter of the American Association of University Women.

In November 2004, I suffered a stroke. As a result, I developed dystonia (a rare movement disorder that currently has no cure) in my left hand and foot several months afterward. In May 2009, I held a first-time fundraiser for the Dystonia Medical Research Foundation, called the Freedom Ride for Dystonia.

I was a practicing attorney for nine years, before becoming a full-time freelance writer. After I quit practicing law, I earned a Master of Library Science, wrote several novels (some as yet unpublished), and held various part-time jobs while working on freelance assignments.

I’m married to a retired fireman, who also happens to be my best friend. We live in Maryland, with our cats in a house full of books and cat hair.

story:
We are still accepting contributions at:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=6B5H6YGMDRY88

Please give today. Thank you!

Our Why

We believe we can create a world where there is no more suffering, where we all create peace within and the world reflects our inner peace back to us. We believe today’s generation of children and teens have the potential to become an entire generation of peace leaders, like the Great Peace Leaders of history. Some kids already know they want this.

Our goal is to inspire, guide, and direct the entire generation of today’s youth to become great Peace Leaders.

We see that nearly all children today are suffering in some way. Whether the cause is obesity, autism, bullying, learning difficulties, divorce, peer pressure, or financial worries, nearly every child today suffers. And even those who don’t suffer from any of these things still suffer because they see suffering in the world and they just know the world isn’t as it could and should be. Despite and even because of all this suffering, we know these children can become great peace leaders.

Our How

To achieve our goal, we’ve created a Peace Leader training program that will eventually be available to every child, regardless of income, race, cultural or religious background for youth age 8-23 and their parents. Participants in this program through high school and college will have gained extensive experience manifesting their dreams and revealing more Light in the world.

We’re starting in a small and easily achievable way, with a summer Peace Leader Boot Camp near Sedona, Arizona for kids age 8-12. The curriculum and all the business details are already established and negotiated, including rental of classrooms at Desert Star Community School in Cornville, AZ, van rental, salaries, and all necessary insurance. We have a list of kids who want to do the camp and their parents can’t afford tuition. Once we have received enough funding to cover the camp expenses, 24 kids will begin making peace in their own lives and receive effective, experiential Peace Leader training.

  • Camp takes place at Desert Star Community School in Cornville AZ.
  • The MkP kids recieve special t-shirts and Super Agent identifaction badges.
  • Each Super Agent will take home a 8x10 camp photo and a hand bound camp scrap book reminding them of their empowering journey and all the lives they've touched!
  • We provide supportive mentoring at a maximum ratio of 1 adult leader to 8 kids and we've also arranged for Waldorf and Montessori certified teachers and local artists to assist with some projects.
  • The kids are required to bring their own lunches - we provide snacks, beverages and all other supplies.

Phase two is to launch an expanded extracurricular program in Los Angeles in Fall 2012. The program will continue to be refined and expanded while collaborating with other organizations. Our goal is to help every child to live in their heart, and it will take working with countless established organizations to achieve this goal.

We believe we can absolutely inspire, guide, and direct the entire generation of today’s youth to become great Peace Leaders. When we all work together, anything is possible.

Who We Are

We are co-founders Scott McMahan and Jim Allen and together we have over 35 years’ experience improving thousands of kids’ lives. Together, we also have over 30 years’ experience as entrepreneurs owning a great diversity of small and medium businesses. Mission:kidPossible represents for us our greatest goal and we are committed and excited to do whatever it takes.

Your Support

Your financial contribution today directly helps to create an incredibly bright future for all of us, including your children, grandchildren, nieces and nephews. Please help fund the next generation of great peace leaders.  Thank you.

Our Mission

"Our mission is to build kids character by teaching leadership skills, self responsibility, self value, self empowerment and self respect through taking positive action, volunteering, and doing good deeds and acts of kindness within communities to experience the oneness of humanity.”

MAIL CHECKS TO:

MISSION KID POSSIBLE

PO BOX 324 Cornville, AZ. 86325

 

Other Ways You Can Help

ASK your friends and family to get the word out and MAKE SOME BEAUTIFUL NOISE about our campaign.

TALK to your friends and let your friends know their support is needed.

SHARE this campaign on facebook and other forms of social media!
