Please give today. Thank you!
Our Why
We believe we can create a world where there is no more suffering, where we all create peace within and the world reflects our inner peace back to us. We believe today’s generation of children and teens have the potential to become an entire generation of peace leaders, like the Great Peace Leaders of history. Some kids already know they want this.
Our goal is to inspire, guide, and direct the entire generation of today’s youth to become great Peace Leaders.
We see that nearly all children today are suffering in some way. Whether the cause is obesity, autism, bullying, learning difficulties, divorce, peer pressure, or financial worries, nearly every child today suffers. And even those who don’t suffer from any of these things still suffer because they see suffering in the world and they just know the world isn’t as it could and should be. Despite and even because of all this suffering, we know these children can become great peace leaders.
Our How
To achieve our goal, we’ve created a Peace Leader training program that will eventually be available to every child, regardless of income, race, cultural or religious background for youth age 8-23 and their parents. Participants in this program through high school and college will have gained extensive experience manifesting their dreams and revealing more Light in the world.
We’re starting in a small and easily achievable way, with a summer Peace Leader Boot Camp near Sedona, Arizona for kids age 8-12. The curriculum and all the business details are already established and negotiated, including rental of classrooms at Desert Star Community School in Cornville, AZ, van rental, salaries, and all necessary insurance. We have a list of kids who want to do the camp and their parents can’t afford tuition. Once we have received enough funding to cover the camp expenses, 24 kids will begin making peace in their own lives and receive effective, experiential Peace Leader training.

Camp takes place at Desert Star Community School in Cornville AZ.
The MkP kids recieve special t-shirts and Super Agent identifaction badges.
Each Super Agent will take home a 8x10 camp photo and a hand bound camp scrap book reminding them of their empowering journey and all the lives they've touched!
We provide supportive mentoring at a maximum ratio of 1 adult leader to 8 kids and we've also arranged for Waldorf and Montessori certified teachers and local artists to assist with some projects.
The kids are required to bring their own lunches - we provide snacks, beverages and all other supplies.
Phase two is to launch an expanded extracurricular program in Los Angeles in Fall 2012. The program will continue to be refined and expanded while collaborating with other organizations. Our goal is to help every child to live in their heart, and it will take working with countless established organizations to achieve this goal.
We believe we can absolutely inspire, guide, and direct the entire generation of today’s youth to become great Peace Leaders. When we all work together, anything is possible.
Who We Are
We are co-founders Scott McMahan and Jim Allen and together we have over 35 years’ experience improving thousands of kids’ lives. Together, we also have over 30 years’ experience as entrepreneurs owning a great diversity of small and medium businesses. Mission:kidPossible represents for us our greatest goal and we are committed and excited to do whatever it takes.
Your Support
Your financial contribution today directly helps to create an incredibly bright future for all of us, including your children, grandchildren, nieces and nephews. Please help fund the next generation of great peace leaders.  Thank you.
Our Mission
"Our mission is to build kids character by teaching leadership skills, self responsibility, self value, self empowerment and self respect through taking positive action, volunteering, and doing good deeds and acts of kindness within communities to experience the oneness of humanity.”
MAIL CHECKS TO:
MISSION KID POSSIBLE
PO BOX 324 Cornville, AZ. 86325
 
Other Ways You Can Help
ASK your friends and family to get the word out and MAKE SOME BEAUTIFUL NOISE about our campaign.
TALK to your friends and let your friends know their support is needed.
SHARE this campaign on facebook and other forms of social media!

story:
Children's book with fantastic illustrations! 

Hi, My name is Iztok and I'm a father of three boys. I love reading books and I absolutely love reading books to my kids. But the problem is that most of the tales that I read to my boys are just not interesting enough. 

So I started making up the stories. I created a beautiful kingdom of Armegil and of course strong characters - and my boys wanted more! Now every night before we go to bed another tale of Armegil kingdom is being told.

  

Characters come to life ...

I went to the internet and started looking for an artist that would make me this characters and after some "bumps on the road" I hit a jackpot! All our heroes came to life - and my boys loved them! The illustrations are just fantastic!




We need your help

We will create a hard-copy version of the book. Inside there will be the best 5 tales - all "100% kids approved". :)

All funds from indiegogo will go to the artists and the print production costs.

We created a Facebook page where we interact with our fans and we want to keep you included.

If you are a parent - than don't miss our fantastic perks and make your kid a part of the beautiful Armegil kingdom.

If we don't get all the funds from this campaign - the project will still go on, because my boys will not let me quit - it will just take much, much longer to finish it...

Kingdom of Armegil

This is what a children's fairy tale should look like. Great illustrations, strong characters and story that will help our children develop their imagination and forget about TV.

The tales will focus:

  • on optimism
  • honesty
  • family values
  • persistance


This are the things that I want to learn my kids - not the material aspect of the world that is controling our lives as we speak. 

FAQ

When will the book come out?

The book is planned for March 2013.


How many high-quality illustrations will be in the book?

There will around 50 illustrations in the first book.


Armegil - where did you come up with that name?

Armegil became from a norse word: Har = Hair and elvish word: Megil = Sword.


Shipping cost (for perks where Shipping not included)

Shipping to EU = 25 USD
Shipping Worldwide = 50 USD




I have no money but I like the idea!

Spread the word, mention the campaign on twitter, facebook - use the sharing tool from indiegogo. Also visit our Facebook page where you can share your ideas and be a part of a beautiful kingdom of Armegil.

Thanks everyone!

story:
By the Obsidian Sea, a novel about culture and journeys.

"Author Gregory Paul Broadbent explores the rich culture of Australia and Lebanon in By the Obsidian Sea. This book tells the story of Jean Ray, an Australian who married into a Lebanese family. He observes all the pitfalls and beauties of marrying the Lebanese way. It is a tale about the realities facing the children of Lebanese immigrants who came to Australia to escape the problems of their homeland and settle in the sixties and seventies. His journey takes the reader through the birth of his children, the fights and loves of his adopted family from within Australia, and then on a journey through Lebanon itself." Xilibris Publishers

Hi, I'm Gregory Broadbent, and By the Obsidian Sea is my first novel. It took over 10 years to write and now I want to publish and distribute it. I have nearly completed the first part, publishing, through Xilbris publishers, but now I need funds to distribute the ebook and hardcopy through their marketing expertise and through Google etc, and by being able to get enough copies to market the book myself. 

If I can raise $5000 Australian dollars I will be able to show my novel to over 1 million people across the world, which would mean the difference between it getting a fair go on the market or it sitting in my garage gathering dust. 

I have written many books, mostly poetry and some texts on unrelated subjects, none of which I have managed to get further with than just the writing. This is my first attempt at going public with a manuscript and I am excited by the prospect.

If you enjoy unusual but polished writing that speaks to the soul and provides questions about life and people, then you will enjoy reading By the Obsidian Sea.

There are 5 Perks. For$10, The Literature Activist Perk shows you are gunning for freeing literature as an art form for yourself and others, you will get acknowledged i the front of the book as a contributor and be blown big kisses by the author and respect for your artistic gumption.For $25, this is the Perk for Literature lovers who read by Kindle light. You will be given one ebook copy of By the Obsidian Sea to read by the pale light of technology. You will also be mentioned in the front pages of the book as a contributor. 

NEW PERK (Late inclusion Perk)for $30 get a soft cover version of the book and your name in the book as a contributor.

For $50, if you prefer to read By the Obsidian Sea the traditional way, you will receive one bound soft cover copy to read by the light of day. You will also be mentioned in the front pages of the book as a contributor. For $100, if you don't mind which way you read good literature, this is the perk for you. One ebook copy and a soft cover copy of By the Obsidian Sea to read in whatever light you choose. You will also be mentioned in the front pages of the book as a contributor. The Literature Fanatic Perk is for $200. If you contribute this much you you will receive two books and one e/book copy and get a special mention in the book as a contributor.

I am looking for people who are interested in good literature and know how hard it is to get anything unusual or unsolicited into the market. Any contribution, even a non-cash one, would be appreciated by me, very appreciated.

Thank you all, Gregory Broadbent.

story:
Ever since I came back from the brink of death and turned my life around, people from all across the globe have been telling me that my story needs to be told. 

I think it's because after living deep in the trenches for so many years of my life, where I'm at now is nothing short of a miracle.

Eager to get my story out there, in late 2013 I started writing it all down. Three weeks and 75 pages later, it dawned on me I had written nearly half a book! 

Now, I've been a lot of things in my life: a wrestler, a bouncer, a heavy metal musician, heck even an air conditioning technician, but if there's one thing I never pictured myself as, it was an author. I mean, I barely finished high school!

It was time for a reality check. Ready to cut my losses, I sent my first 75 pages to James McWilliams, professor of history at Texas State University, contributor to the The Atlantic and The New York Times, and author of several highly acclaimed books, including Just Food. I had met James a year earlier, and after hearing my story, he told me I should write it down and send it to him for review. 

So there I was, a year later, nervously waiting for his feedback. A few days later my world was turned upside down when I got an email from James telling me that what I had written was not only good, but some of the most moving and powerful material he had ever read! 

James then went on to tell me that if I was willing to dig deep and finish the book, he was willing to work closely with me to get the book ready to be published! 

But as honored and pumped as I was, there was a pretty big glitch. 

You see, despite how incredible the last couple of years have been for me on a physical and emotional level, they sure haven't been good for me financially. Between work prospects drying up, cars breaking down, and a shit storm of plain old bad luck, I've often had trouble even keeping the utilities on for me and my family.

Desperate to stay afloat, I've gone back to working as a bouncer, a job that's not only kind of dangerous (how many other jobs get you stabbed in the neck?), but doesn't even pay well ($50-75/shift) -- which is why I recently had to work 15 days in a row.

Between working a ton of hours for really low pay, and stressing non-stop about overdue bills, I haven't been able to take advantage of James' amazing offer and get back to work on my book.

Which Is Why I Need Your Help

Thanks to the advice and support of some of my closest friends, I'm launching this campaign so I can focus 100% of my attention on making my book as powerful as possible. All of the funds raised here will:

1) Allow me to work on my book full-time, with James as my guide and editor, and

2) Ensure that everyone who contributes at least $25 gets a copy of my book!

The Perks

As you can see, I've got a lot of awesome, supportive friends who are offering some amazing incentives for people who want to help with my campaign. These friends include The Ultimate Fighter winner James Wilks, world-record-holding strongman Patrik Baboumian, firefighter/ triathlete/author Rip Esselstyn, hip hop artist Stic, researcher/author Dr. Michael Greger, actor/ comedian/author Pat Kilbane, and the folks at Vegan Health and Fitness. I couldn't have launched this campaign without them and hope you'll take advantage of their generosity!

A Little Goes A Long Way

I sure know what it's like to fall on hard times, so please don't feel bad if you can't contribute anything/much. Even sharing this page with friends would mean the world to me!

Thank you for believing in me, my story, and the power to change the world!

HELL YEAH!!!

story:
Selección Chilena De BikePolo Al mundial!

Hola, somos tres jóvenes Exequiel Valdés, Enzo Galaz y Luciano Diaz (En la foto de izquierda a derecha; Luciano, Enzo, Kelo) que amamos el Bike Polo y llevamos alrededor de 6 años practicando este hermoso deporte.

Cada integrante ha jugado 3 torneos Suramericanos, con excelentes resultados 2011 Santiago de Chile 1er lugar, 2012 Buenos Aires, Argentina 2do lugar y 2013 Sao Paulo, Brasil 1er lugar, como ven nos hemos ganado nuestro cupo al Torneo Mundial de BikePolo Montpellier, Francia 2014. 

Ahora con la ayuda de ustedes, este viaje podrá ser posible y de esta forma por primera vez un equipo chileno y surámericano jugará un mundial, necesitamos de tu aporte para lograr la tan anhelada integración, donde verdaderamente el Torneo más importante del mundo contemple equipos de todos los continentes.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Nuestra meta de recaudación es de $ 2.500 dolares americanos, Este dinero se utilizará para pagar el transporte aéreo (en forma de billetes) a Francia, Montpellier , también para nuestra cuota de inscripción del torneo, para el equipo y de reparación de bicicletas, y nuestros costos de vivienda.

    • • $ 1 y 49: Una mención de su ayuda con su nombre o su empresa en nuestras fotos, paginas de Facebook y Twitter hasta que lleguemos al mundial.

      • $ 50 y 99: Una camiseta de la selección Chilena de BikePolo, en tallas S, M, L y XL.

      • $ 100: El logo de tu marca en la manga izquierda o derecha de nuestra camiseta en un tamaño de 13 x 13 cms + una camiseta de la selección Chilena de BikePolo + una mención de tu aporte en nuestra Web y sus redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter e Instagram).

      • $ 150: El logo de tu marca en el centro delantero de nuestra camiseta en un tamaño de 20 x 15 cms. + una camiseta de la selección Chilena de BikePolo + una mención de tu aporte en nuestra Web y sus redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter e Instagram).

       • $180: El logo de tu marca en las 2 mangas de nuestra camiseta en un tamaño de 13 x 13 cms + una camiseta de la selección Chilena de BikePolo + una mención de tu aporte en nuestra Web y sus redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter e Instagram) + 1 Sticker de 15 x 15 cms en nuestras maletas.

       • $ 230: El logo de tu marca en el la espalda de nuestra camiseta (la zona que más se ve mientras estemos montando la bicicleta en un tamaño de 25 x 20 cms. + una camiseta de la selección Chilena de BikePolo + una mención de tu aporte en nuestra Web y sus redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter e Instagram) + 1 Sticker de 15 x 15 cms en nuestras maletas.

       • $350: El logo de tu marca en el centro delantero de nuestra camiseta con un tamaño de 20 x 15 cms + el logo de tu marca en el la espalda de nuestra camiseta ( la zona que más se ve mientras estemos montando la bicicleta en un tamaño de 25 x 20 cms. + una camiseta de la selección Chilena de BikePolo + una camiseta del equipo representante + una mención de tu aporte en nuestra Web y sus redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter e Instagram) + 1 Sticker de 15 x 15 cms en nuestras maletas.

      • $500: El logo de tu marca en las 2 mangas de nuestra camiseta en un tamaño de 13 x 13 cms + El logo de tu marca en el centro delantero de nuestra camiseta con un tamaño de 20 x 15 cms + el logo de tu marca en el la espalda de nuestra camiseta ( la zona que más se ve mientras estemos montando la bicicleta en un tamaño de 25 x 20 cms. + una camiseta de la selección Chilena de BikePolo + una camiseta del equipo representante + una mención de tu aporte en nuestra Web y sus redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter e Instagram) + 1 Sticker de 15 x 15 cms en nuestras maletas. 

Si no llegamos a nuestra meta total de 2.500 dólares, vamos a utilizar todo el dinero que recaudamos para cubrir nuestros gastos. Estamos muy agradecidos por cualquier ayuda que podamos conseguir, y nos comprometemos a utilizar sus donaciones sabiamente

El impacto

Este proyecto es muy importante en lo que pueda ocurrir en la historia de los mundiales de Bike polo, por integrar al primer equipo de Surámerica. 

• Este equipo tiene triunfos a nivel local (Chile) 1er lugar en el Torneo Nacional Temuco2013, primeros lugares a nivel Regional (Surámerica). 

• Nuestro jugador Enzo fue elegido como el mejor jugador del Torneo Suramericano Sao Paulo, Brasil 2014 (MVP)

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no puedes colaborar con dinero, No importa igual puedes ayudar

  • Difunde nuestra campaña en tus redes sociales.
  •  Usa las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

story:
What it's about

I'm Jason Webster, the author of the Max Cámara detective novels set in Valencia, Spain, which are published by St Martins Minotaur in US and Random House in UK.

For the next novel in the series (No. 4, working title: A Thousand Watery Fingers), my main character, Chief Inspector Max Cámara of the Spanish National Police, needs a motorbike - specifically a Honda Shadow (think poor-man's Harley Davidson).

In the interests of authenticity, it's only right that I get one myself to ride around the corrupt and crime-ridden neighbourhoods of Valencia city (OK, there are nice bits as well).

Where you come in

But I need help buying one. Second-hand, the bikes come pretty cheap (you can't get them new). $3,500 would cover the cost of the machine and the paperwork, and perhaps even a helmet!

I'm offering some great perks if you can help me - including an exclusive tour around Valencia for the trully generous. Please see the bar at the side.

 Finally

If you've read and liked my books (Duende, Andalus, Guerra, Sacred Sierra, Or the Bull Kills You, and soon to be published A Death in Valencia) please help me with this new venture for Max Cámara, "one of the most attractive figures to enter recent crime fiction" according to The Independent newspaper.

Even if you can't afford to donate anything, even letting others know about this campaign would be of great assistance.

You too can help Max in his fight against crime as he rides the streets of Valencia with Hilario, his marihuana-growing anarchist grandfather, riding behind on the pillion seat.

UPDATE (25/07/2012)

It gives me great pleasure to let you all know that The Shadow Lines screenplay development project has been shortlisted for NFDC's  Screenwriter's Lab 2012!

This is great news! Thank You all for your support!

Anupam

 

UPDATE (23/07/2012)

Hey all, 

I am very glad to let you know that the sixth draft of The Shadow Lines is now officially registered with the Film Writer's Association of India. 

More news soon..

 

UPDATE (15/06/2012)

Great News!

My good friend Alexander Thomas, screenwriter and film director, joins The Shadow Lines team as co-writer!

 

UPDATE (13/05/2012)

Hey all,

First draft just out of the oven! Excited, scared, relieved, exhausted. I am loving this!

Now to let a few people read it and wait for them reflect on it.

More to follow!

 

 

UPDATE (April 2012)

Hello all!

Just to let you know that we are on the verge of completion of the first draft of the screenplay. We are aiming to have it ready by the end of this month or thereabouts. This will enable us to circulate it amongst close colleagues and get it critiqued by them, and hence devise a plan for further development!

 

More soon....

 

 

I am very glad to announce that we have an option on The Shadow Lines, a novel by critically acclaimed and multiple award winning writer Amitav Ghosh. This option entails that we would have the claim for cinematic adaptation of the book over next one year. In the course of this one year (ending September 2012), we will be working on writing a screenplay based on the novel. This screenplay would then allow us to buy the film rights for the novel at the end of the year.

 

The Shadow Lines by Amitav Ghosh

 

The Shadow Lines (1988), by Indian writer Amitav Ghosh, is a book that captures perspective of time and events, of lines that bring people together and hold them apart, lines that are clearly visible on one perspective and nonexistent on another, lines that exist in the memory of one, and therefore in another's imagination. It is a narrative built out of an intricate, constantly crisscrossing web of memories of many people. The book never pretends to tell a story. Rather it invites the reader to invent one, out of the memories of those involved. It is set against the backdrop of historical events like Swadeshi movement, Second World War , Partition of India and Communal riots of 1963-64 in Dhaka and Calcutta.

 

The Project

 

"....a place doesn't merely exist...it has to be invented in one's imagination...."

 

This line from Amitav Ghosh's Sahitya Akademi award winning novel The Shadow Lines sums up the story of our film project. This film project shall be an exploration of how spaces, memories, imagination connect people across times. It will be a cinematic interpretation and retelling of Ghosh's The Shadow Lines where the protagonist, a young film maker coming to London in 2010 from India, deeply fascinated by Ghosh's book, longs to visit the places vividly described in the book, the places which he has 'invented' in his imagination long before he sets out to look for them. As our protagonist goes deeper in to his search for the spaces from the novel the boundaries between his present, his imagination and Ghosh's fiction start blurring.  

 

Excerpt from my letter to Amitav

 

"..(The Shadow Lines) has been a great literary influence on me and I myself having travelled to London recently for education and work, can identify with the protagonist on so many different levels. The way the book talks about memories, travelling ï¿½ physical as well as imaginary, the way it blends family history with that of a nationï¿½s, and most importantly the ease with which it weaves across the decades, is mesmerising. Being a filmmaker, I have always dreamt of one day getting to adapt this for screen..."

 

Excerpts from Amitav Ghosh's blog

 

"...I went to London for the release of River of Smoke. I met with Anupam during my stay and was enormously impressed by his enthusiasm his encyclopaedic knowledge of film-making. I am glad to announce that we recently signed a contract giving him an option on The Shadow Lines..."

 

More on: http://amitavghosh.com/blog/?p=1380

 

About us

Anupam Barvï¿½is a film maker from Pune, India currently based in London. After a brief detour to science college, he opted to complete a graduation in Performing Arts(Dramatics). Before moving to London to pursue a career in Film Direction, he also spent a few years doing drama, making documentaries and running an environmental organisation. He is currently teaching on the University of Westminsterï¿½s MA in Directing: Film and TV course in London. His most recent Short Film- ï¿½Fresh Suicideï¿½ has been very successful at various festivals and competitions all over, including a nomination for the ï¿½Golden Palm Tree Awardï¿½ at the 42nd International Film Festival of India and a special screening at the 13th London Asian Film Festival 2011, among others. Anupam is currently in development of future film projects. 

 

 

Vaibhav Abnave is a playwright and film maker from Pune, India currently based in New Delhi, pursuing his doctoral research in International relations from JNU. His published one act plays 'Black Swan' and 'S...E....X..shhh' have been staged on Marathi experimental stage and have been honoured with several awards. His critically acclaimed docu-fiction film Blur, about disclosures in the lives of HIV affected parents and children, has been screened at various international film festivals. He co-wrote the short film- 'Fresh Suicide' with Anupam Barvï¿½, which has won numerous awards at national and international film festivals. He is presently in pre-production of a full length fiction film, provisionally titled 'Monologue', funded by India Foundation for Arts (IFA), Bangalore, based on the life and the works of one of the most eminent playwrights of the post independence India- Mahesh Elkunchwar. 

 

The Impact

 

This project would be the first of its kind to render the literary, visual imagination in Amitav Ghosh's writing to Cinema. Mr. Ghosh has been extremely kind to us by lending audience to our ideas and very instrumental in making this one year option happen. We do not want to let him down in any way. We, as a team, have just one year to come up with a formidable screenplay. If we can't produce the screenplay, for the lack of resources or any other reason, we will unfortunately have to surrender our claim on the novel.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Given the exchange rate between USD/GBP and Indian Rupees, even a relatively reasonable figure of USD 1500 can help us go a long way over the next year in India. The story in the novel takes place at three locations - Kolkata, Dhaka and London. 

We have absolutely no other funding source for this project. Who will back this film after this first year will depend on how well accomplished the first draft of the screenplay is.

In case we do not reach the intended USD 1500 target, we shall prioritise the expenditure depending on how much we have managed to raise.

If during the course of this one year, the project does fall through for some reason, we promise to refund all donors/contributors. 

Also, during the entire process we promise complete transparency about use of the raised funds and all donors/contributors will receive timely updates on the development of the screenplay.

 

We hereby appeal everyone to please help us make this happen. This is a dream project for us and an unprecedented opportunity in our careers. Even a mere 5 USD donation will prove very instrumental to us.

 

Please take a look at the section on the right hand side of the page to see exciting perks!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Getting sponsorships is very important. But only money cannot make good screenplays!! We also need all your backing and goodwill to accomplish this!

 

You can help by spreading the word about this project and this fundraising campaign across all platforms- Facebook, Google+, Twitter, MySpace, LinkedIn, Blogs, E-Groups, Relevant Communities and emails. Help us create a buzz. Let other people who you think may be interested in helping this project know about this page.

 

You may know other Amitav Ghosh fans, literature folk, writers or even film buffs who would want to jump on board in some capacity or the other.

 

If you are from or know anyone in Kolkata or Dhaka who can put us up during our visit for no/low pay, let us know!

Short Summary

I am a Dutch-born Ghanaian political and social scientist with a great passion for history.  I have a BA French (European Studies) from Queen Mary and Westfield College, University of London and a MSc Political Science (International Relations) from the University of Amsterdam.  For the past 3 years I have been conducting genealogical research from which this project grew.

Each living being represents hundreds of accumulated stories through its own ancestry.  The privilege of being able to trace your roots far into history often brings forth remarkable stories that are often left untold.  

An African Story is a book about the history of the Gold Coast and Ghana from 1700-1979 from the perspective of a single family.  The approach to the history is according to the Akan oral tradition of PROSOPOGRAPHY.  Each chapter will recount the story of a direct ancestor in chronological order of year of birth and place it within the context of the wider histories occurring on the Coast, the Netherlands, Germany, Britain and the Americas at the time.

The history commences in Groningen, the Netherlands and covers the early interactions of the Europeans and the local populations on the Coast.  It considers the internal politics of the region taking the reader on a journey through the transatlantic slave trade, its abolishment, the rise of the intellectual elite, mercantilism, the development of law, the Wesleyan and Catholic missions and the struggle that eventually led to the independent state of Ghana in 1957.  It will end with the presidential elections of 1979.


This period in history commences when the transatlantic slave trade was already in full swing.  As such the principle aspect to this history is the impact and aftermath of this dark chapter in global history and the transformation that the Gold Coast underwent to become the proud nation of Ghana that it is today.  The trade had such a significant global impact that its effects are still felt across the world.  In a certain way this history is as much a history of the Gold Coast and Ghana as it is an early study into International Relations from an African perspective.

While the study of genealogy is only a criteria for subject matter in the book, this history also highlights the diversity that developed through unions between European men and African women.  For several centuries, these Euro-Africans intermarried accumulating in a complex web of ethnic roots that provide an indelible link between Europe, Africa, the United States and in a small part, Far East Asia.  This development also means that there were free Africans in Europe and the Americas who were highly educated and multilingual as well as very mobile.


For a researcher there is a limited pool of sources to get funding for such a project.  The easiest path would be to conduct the research as part of a PhD programme.  This path however would restrict the author's autonomy, while at the same time it would limit its audience to academics primarily.  Yet, this story is of interest to many more people.  Anybody interested in history, the slave trade in particular, genealogy, ethnic diversity, social and economic development and international relations will be able to find satisfaction in what this history has to offer.  As such, while the research will be conducted on a scientific basis, the language that will be used will aim to cater to a wider audience.

The greatest asset to a researcher is time.  Unfortunately, time equals money meaning that all costs incurred while conducting research are applicable.  This means that apart from travel costs and board to the many archives in Europe and Ghana that need to be covered, daily aspects like rent and sustenance are also important.  It is for these reasons that I am seeking crowd-funding as an additional contribution rather than as the only source.  I am currently also looking for contributions from an organisation in Ghana itself as well as a publishing house that will recognise the potential of this story enough to add to this.  I will also continue to add my own contributions.  What I am asking for here is a quarter of the total estimated funds I would require in order to complete the research and write the book over a period of 2 years.


So far my research has been funded personally over the past 3 years.  What I have managed to achieve is to identify for 80% the historical characters to research as well as exactly where this research needs to be conducted in order to find more information.  As explained here above, many of the characters included in this book were very mobile.  It means that apart from the national archives in the Netherlands, Ghana and the United Kingdom I will have to conduct research at more local archives in these countries as well as the Basel Mission Archives, the Societe de Missionaires Africaines Archives in Rome and a couple of Archives in Germany (Ulm and Soest in particular).  It is also very likely that archives in Surinam, the Dutch Antilles as well as the United States may have to be consulted.

There are several assets that I have that qualify me for this research.  First of all, all the characters included will be from my own direct ancestry.  As such it will be a history told from the perspective of a European-born African looking back at the history of his country of origin through the eyes of his own ancestors.  Furthermore, the primary sources from which the information will come from will be in English, Dutch and French.  These are all languages I am fluent in so no additional costs will be incurred there.  For those sources that will be in German - I estimate this to be less than 10% - I will require some assistance.  Finally, my academic background in the political and social sciences provide me with the right scientific skills.


It is difficult to estimate the impact of a book on the history of the Gold Coast and Ghana 1700-1979.  However, its history is not limited to its borders as it is the first sub-Saharan country where Europeans landed on the continent.  The transatlantic slavery angle also adds the Americas (the United States, Surinam, the Dutch Antilles and Brasil) to its history, while colonial expansion in the nineteenth century means that Far East Asia (Indonesia in particular) is also included in a small way.  For any resident or national of any of these countries, there will be aspects to their history included that they may not have learned before.  Furthermore, within the context of International Relations anybody will be able to benefit from the lessons that can be learned about ethnic diversity and the impact that the earliest form of capitalism had on the world (transatlantic slavery).

slavery angle also adds the Americas (the United States, Surinam, the Dutch Antilles and Brasil) to its history, while colonial expansion in the nineteenth century means that Far East Asia (Indonesia in particular) is also included in a small way.  For any resident or national of any of these countries, there will be aspects to their history included that they may not have learned before.  Furthermore, within the context of International Relations anybody will be able to benefit from the lessons that can be learned about ethnic diversity and the impact that the earliest form of capitalism had on the world (transatlantic slavery).

story:
Who are we?

What exactly is the book drive all about you ask? We at Bandiera Books wanted to give away our new children's book for a child who's parents may not have been able to afford it. To us it's not fair that one child gets to read and learn while others can't. We want every child to read our children's book. But let me step back..


Bandiera Books is a eBook developing and publishing company. We recently published a children's book inspired by a loved one. The title of the book was called "O". The story is about a young boy who grows up in a single parent home. Tragically he loses his mother at an early age. But overcoming hardship and fear, O becomes President of the United States of America. If this story sounds familiar it's because it's about our 44th President. But you probably guessed that from our picture.


We know everyone has their disagreements. But we felt inspired to want to write an inspiring story. Especially for someone we love. That is what this campaign is all about. To give inspiration to those around us and to those we love.

What We Need & What You Get

It's important to know what we need, where the money is going and what you can also get out of the campaign. The money will be used on the book drive of course. We need to purchase more books to insure that every child at the book drive gets a copy. We are honored that our first book drive will be for the Horton's Kids Organization (http://www.hortonskids.org/) in Washington D.C. We want to do other book drives as well and this money will insure it does just that.

We are also in the midst of writing a new children's book and part of the funding will go into finishing our next book titled "Dreamer". I wonder what famous person gave a speech about dreaming? 

Any extra money will be used to create more children books and we will also like to purchase more books to hand out to more children in the near future.

If our goal is not met, just know we are still writing the next book.. AND we are still doing the book drive.. But with your help we can get there faster with a lot less to worry about. And thanks to you and your generosity a child will be getting a book!

REWARD (This is the part about What You Get)

Know that every $10 get a child a book. Just $10! But anything will help on behalf of your contribution we at Bandiera Books would like to say thank you.

By just giving a $1, I'll be sending you our recipe book for FREE! The higher you go the more perks come with it...

$5 gets you a FREE digital copy of "O". 

$25 and you get your own personal book while also helping a child get there's :)

Did I also mention we have a COLORING BOOK! Our special perk gets you a coloring book edition of our story. And we have a HARD COVER edition as well. 

The Impact

The impact this campaign is valuable in several ways..

  1. A child will learn about the 44th President of the USA. And they will view it through their eyes. Amazing what you can see through the eyes of a child.
  2. It will engage them to want to read about someone who was once in their shoes. We all come from different backgrounds and everyone's story is different. But somewhere along the way there always seems to be someone who we have something in common with.
  3. Whether they read the book or if there having fun just coloring it, it's important for a child to engage in reading sparking their imagination to dream and DREAM BIG. 
  4. Some children are not fortunate as others so it's important for us not to forget those less fortunate then us. This campaign not only impacts the children it impacts you as well. It's our job to help the future of the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign I understand but I can still use your help!

  • MAKE SOME NOISE!! Share the campaign on your social media page (Facebook, Twitter, ect.)
  • Tell your family and friends!
  • Once the website is fully operational you can still contribute at a later date. 
  • If you live in the DC area give us a shout if you'd like to help. 

And that’s all there is to it. We appreciate your contribution in any way you choose to help.

story:
In the spirit of true, unbiased journalism, Bryan Metro and the Jesus Chainsaw Massacre have set up this unique opportunity for YOU, the citizens of the Detroit area to contribute to an unprecedented photo essay/writing project.

Next weekend is the "Blowout", what used to be a mainstay of the Hamtramck, Michigan community.  However, the organizers have split the event into three cities over 3.5 days effectively crippling the chances for some venues, venues that have supported this event from the start, to succeed.

As one of the only honest entities in the Metro Detroit area, the Jesus Chainsaw Massacre have realized that there are no media outlets that will cover "Blowout" with an unbiased eye.  Local musicians, some even playing the event, have spoken out against the logistics and organization but have done so anonymously out of fear of being blacklisted from future events by the event's sponsors and bookers.  We at the JCM want to cover this event with an unfiltered eye for YOU.  We will be the voice of the voiceless one more time.  However, out of principle, we refuse to contribute to an event that has splintered the city and line the pockets of the organizers.  Why do we say that?  Because we played it last year and received no financial compensation.  That is why we have created this page.  Indiegogo has a minimum of a $500 funding goal so we had to set it as that instead of the $25 price for a wristband.  However, we assure you that any funds acquired from this venture will be used to maintain and deliver the highest form of journalistic integrity, which immediately benefits those that will be suffering losses from the changes of this event.

With your help, we can make sure that the true story of the 2014 Blowout is told, in word and picture.  We are always honest with you.  There is no one left to trust.  There really is no other choice.

story:
Thank you so much for your all of your donations and support! Thanks to you, we'll be able to update our website, www.matermea.com, and begin to create daily content for the site.

If you didn't get a chance to donate, but would still like to support mater mea, you can send a PayPal donation to us -- our email address is info@matermea.com.

Thank you again -- together, we can change the conversation around black motherhood!


==

Hello! My name is Anthonia Akitunde, and I’m the founder of mater mea, a bimonthly online magazine that profiles the inspirational lives of working mothers of color.

2012 was the year of work-life balance and “Can women have it all?” think pieces, but women of color were largely absent from these conversations. mater mea launched on Mother’s Day of that year to fill a void in the portrayal of working motherhood, using gorgeous photography and engaging profiles to tell the stories of women the media so often ignores.

mater mea has featured the compelling stories of women such as poet Staceyann Chin, who went through IVF treatment to have the daughter she always wanted despite judgment for choosing single motherhood over a two-mother home, and performer Rhonda Ross, daughter of soul legend Diana Ross, who struggled to conceive for 10 years before giving birth to a son she's taught four languages to by age 3.



The response to the site has been huge. Since mater mea launched in May 2012, the site has had 52,000 visitors from around the world, and close to 1 million page views with readers spending a whopping 15 minutes on the site, engaging with mater mea the way they would a print magazine. We’ve been featured on the Huffington Post, New York Magazine’s The Cut, Babble.com, and we were finalists for “Best New Blog” in the 2012 BlackWeblog Awards.

mater mea has been funded entirely out of pocket since its debut, and the costs associated with creating such a high-quality site affect its ability to grow. In order to reach mater mea’s potential for major growth, I need your help.

What We Need 

To set the site up for even bigger success in 2014, and to continue giving a voice to mothers of color, mater mea needs to raise $55,000.

Right now mater mea’s biggest expense is the gorgeous photography taken by a number of talented photographers around the country. mater mea runs two times a month, not for a lack of amazing women to profile, but due to a lack of funds to pay these top-notch artists to capture each woman at home with her family more frequently.


Your donations will help pay for great photographers and writers who can help us go from two issues a month to four for an entire year. We’ll also be able to do more special issues, such as our well-received Father’s Day Issue.

The money you give mater mea will also go toward paying a web developer to relaunch the website with a responsive and mobile-friendly design and a back-end system to support a daily blog. Our new daily content will provide the type of stories our readers want to see: well-curated news pieces featuring families of color, great photography, and original pieces focusing on career, style, health and wellness, and parenting.

A breakdown of where your donations will go:

Photography: $15,000
Writers: $8,000
Mobile-friendly website redesign: $10,000
Taxes (per IRS' 2012 tax schedule): $13,705
Cushion for Indiegogo’s cut and Paypal fees: $8,200

Any additional funds raised by the campaign will go toward developing more content and promoting the brand (i.e. videos, special issues, social ads on Twitter and Facebook, etc.).

Perks

Since launching mater mea, I’ve been consistently blown away by the talent and hard work displayed by these women, all while managing their families. That's why many of the perks available on your right have been offered by some of the 35 women who have been profiled on the site. Scoop up a set of bangles from jewelry designer to the stars, Lorraine West (her past clients include Erykah Badu, Andre 3000, and Questlove), or a gourmet party consultation from food marketing maven Crystal Black Davis.

All donors above the $50 giving level will be listed as a donor and supporter on matermea.com.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and family -- it can mean the difference between mater mea’s continued growth or ultimate shutdown. If you’re unable to donate money at this time, you can become a supporter of mater mea by checking out our website, www.matermea.com, as well as liking and following us on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
This See-more before he got his glasses.

My name is June Phyllis Baker and I am the author of  The Adventures of See-more, a children's picture book about a young squirrel who is experiencing difficulties both in school and at play because he cannot see clearly.  When he learns that he must wear glasses, See-more feels afraid of being laughed at and losing friends.  

I feel See-more can be a positive role model for children who may feel stigmatized because of their need to wear eyeglasses. The whimsical adventures of See-more makes eyeglasses not only cool, but the whole world opens up to See-more as he discovers all the things he had been missing!

To achieve my dream of publishing this story about See-more, I need $7,000  to self-publish my book.  This will help pay for publishing, editing, an Illustrator & a web site about See-more.  My dream is to create a series of children's picture books about See-more's many adventures dealing with issues children are experiencing today.

A portion of this book sales are being donated to the Lions Club.  As part of their "Lion's Recycle for Site" programs, this organization partners with eye care professionals to carry out joint screening events for children.

I will be grateful for whatever you can contribute to support my campaign.  If you can't donate,  would you would you please get the word out by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Last August I took a train trip on Amtrak from Portland to Los Angeles. During the trip I found the people who travelled by the train so intriguing and interesting. As a result I started to photograph the strangers on the train. As an award winning portrait photographer I have always loved the idea of street photography...so before I boarded the train on my trip I made a promise to myself that I was going to speak to and photograph at least two strangers. For the first time during my 17 years of being a photographer I felt I was taking portraits that showed a real part of who these people were. I personally thought the portraits were impactful, but then I kept on having friends tell me they wanted to see more Strangers On A Train! After I returned from my trip Amtrak even contacted me and published the images on the Amtrak Blog. So my goal now is to take a cross country train trip and document strangers along the way so that I can eventually make a book. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • My minimum goal is $750, this covers a coach rail pass for 15 days and partial incidental costs to include food and lodging along the way. Anything over this cost will go towards upgrade to sleeping car for the longer portions of the trip and towards publishing and book distribution cost. 
  • For contributing I will offers perks to include postcards along the way, signed prints, and copies of the book upon completion. 
  • If I don't reach my goals I will still start the project, but the funds will go towards the expenses of the trip and book publishing.

The Impact

My goal is to take the train from Los Angeles to New Orleans, then from New Orleans to New York, and back across the country through Chicago the first week of September 2015. By covering the whole USA I will be able to show the diversity of train travelers across the US. 

  • The reason I want to continue photographing Strangers On A Train is to show the world the common bond of us all and the sense of adventure we all share.
  • Amtrak already published a blog on my previous experience photographing Strangers On A Train. Previous documentary projects I have completed have been in galleries throughout the US. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is that this project takes endurance to basically live on a train for 15 days. If I get the minimum funding this means not sleeping in a bed for over two weeks! Also on the train I must show discretion in who I photograph so that I am disturbing the experience the traveler is having.  Once the physical part of this journey is completed I will then I have to overcome the challenges of publishing and distributing the book. The entire trip would be documented on Instagram and other social media and once the book is completed hopefully I can display the images at galleries to help with the promotion of the book.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot donate money, please tell your friends, share this on social media and help me share the images while I am on the trip (September 2015)!

story:
Hello Everyone,

My name is Tinita. I grew up in Philadelphia and I have three children.  I am also a caterer. But when my health took a turn I stopped for awhile. I was diagnosed with Diabetes and Celiac Disease. So now I have become a Gluten Free Cook. I was inspired to write  a book about the lives of me and my children . This book took seven years to write because these particular years were very important and meaningful. During these seven years me and my children have been homeless and went through so many trials and tribulations But through it all God has been guiding us and  protecting us.

The reason I have written this book is to give people inspiration and hope. I have had many jobs trying to support my children but the jobs never paid enough to keep me in my home. If it had not been for the Lord, Faith and determination I would have given up along time ago.

Living in the shelters I have met a lot of women from all over the United States.. They all had different  stories on how they became homeless. Many of their stories touched my heart. Sometimes people judge someone by their situation and the way they look. But there is an amazing story behind some of those faces. A lot of these were single moms as myself and its hard raising children on your own.  But there is no time to have a pity party because we have to keep pushing ,striving, and surviving for our children.

There are many stories in my book concerning the lives of me and my children and the people that claimed they wanted to help us.  But through it all God gave us miracles. There was a time I was in the hospital and the doctors wanted to amputate my toe and before the night was over my toe was healed. The doctors are still baffled to this day. Whenever a doctor looks over my medical history they see the type of infection I had and they say usually Diabetics do not heal from that.

But all I can say is God is awesome.  During the time I was writing my book I saw a documentary about women in Africa that were infected by HIV and Aids. There was a particular part in the documentary that bought me to tears. It was  how they were getting this disease. They were being raped by men that were told if they had sex with a girl  that was a virgin that God  would heal them of HIV and Aids.

There were girls as young as one years old. This bought me to tears. The women that ran the shelters tried to talk to the religious organization and stop them from telling these men such things but she was shunned away. She went to the police and they weren't much help either. These shelters are in need of many supplies like sanitary napkins, underwear and toilet paper for the girls.

Many of the girls are absent from school for months at a time for lack of these supplies.  I want to help personally and deliver the supplies in person. I want to go to each village where these shelters are and speak to theses ladies and encourage them. Also to let them know there is a purpose for their life.

I want to share my story with them. I believe I have a lot in common with all these ladies because I also was a victim of rape, homeless,  lived in shelters and physically abused by my husband. But to God be the Glory I survived. I want to use a lot of the proceeds from my book to travel to Africa and to help these young women.

I will  videotape every village and shelter I go to . I want everyone to see the faces of these young ladies and hear there stories. Living here in America we are truly Blessed . We have the right to live without being violated and if we are violated, we have the right to seek justice. But these women and children have no justice, no voice and no rights.

All my life I struggled even as a child but I never complained . Even when I worked in security no one knew I was homeless. But one day they found out when a coworker gave me a ride after work. So when people  found out I was living in a shelter they couldn't believe it. They said you don't look like your homeless or  live in a shelter. I said to myself, " I wonder what should I look like?" I tried not to make excuses, nor complain, nor have  people feel sorry for me. I had to keep striving and pushing . I wanted my children to see that no matter how hard life may get shake it off and keep moving. because this race is not given to the strong, nor the swift but to those that endure to the end.

As of today my daughter is a teacher, my oldest son just graduated from college with a degree in Psychology and my youngest  son is starting his Sophomore year in college with  a major in Art and minor in Psychology. I know that I am only one person. But I believe one person can make a difference.

I hope that you will help support an inspiring project .

Be Blessed!

  The $5000.00 will go towards the printing of my book and my trip to Africa. Everyone who donates will receive a copy of my book and a when I return from Africa everyone will receive a video of these extraordinary women  If I don't meet my goal for the book. I will use the money raised to print some books and buy supplies for the young women and also buy a ticket to Africa, I want to visit at least four shelters in Johannesburg and Sierra Leone. I want to have at least a few books to give to the shelters when I visit.
story_txt: Hello Everyone,My name is Tinita. I grew up in Philadelphia and I have three children.  I am also a caterer. But when my health took a turn I stopped for awhile. I was diagnosed with Diabetes and Celiac Disease. So now I have become a Gluten Free Cook. I was inspired to write  a book about the lives of me and my children . This book took seven years to write because these particular years were very important and meaningful. During these seven years me and my children have been homeless and went through so many trials and tribulations But through it all God has been guiding us and  protecting us.The reason I have written this book is to give people inspiration and hope. I have had many jobs trying to support my children but the jobs never paid enough to keep me in my home. If it had not been for the Lord, Faith and determination I would have given up along time ago. Living in the shelters I have met a lot of women from all over the United States.. They all had different  stories on how they became homeless. Many of their stories touched my heart. Sometimes people judge someone by their situation and the way they look. But there is an amazing story behind some of those faces. A lot of these were single moms as myself and its hard raising children on your own.  But there is no time to have a pity party because we have to keep pushing ,striving, and surviving for our children.There are many stories in my book concerning the lives of me and my children and the people that claimed they wanted to help us.  But through it all God gave us miracles. There was a time I was in the hospital and the doctors wanted to amputate my toe and before the night was over my toe was healed. The doctors are still baffled to this day. Whenever a doctor looks over my medical history they see the type of infection I had and they say usually Diabetics do not heal from that.But all I can say is God is awesome.  During the time I was writing my book I saw a documentary about women in Africa that were infected by HIV and Aids. There was a particular part in the documentary that bought me to tears. It was  how they were getting this disease. They were being raped by men that were told if they had sex with a girl  that was a virgin that God  would heal them of HIV and Aids.There were girls as young as one years old. This bought me to tears. The women that ran the shelters tried to talk to the religious organization and stop them from telling these men such things but she was shunned away. She went to the police and they weren't much help either. These shelters are in need of many supplies like sanitary napkins, underwear and toilet paper for the girls.Many of the girls are absent from school for months at a time for lack of these supplies.  I want to help personally and deliver the supplies in person. I want to go to each village where these shelters are and speak to theses ladies and encourage them. Also to let them know there is a purpose for their life.I want to share my story with them. I believe I have a lot in common with all these ladies because I also was a victim of rape, homeless,  lived in shelters and physically abused by my husband. But to God be the Glory I survived. I want to use a lot of the proceeds from my book to travel to Africa and to help these young women. I will  videotape every village and shelter I go to . story:
WOODS - making stories is a new knitting book that we created fueled by our desire to share our passion for local, breed-specific European yarns and modern minimalistic knitwear design.

We've teamed up with amazing designers and European yarn companies as well as a team of wonderful makers on this journey to create a book that shines a spotlight on sustainable, local yarns, celebrates new and established designers, and shares tons of knitting knowledge.

We are Verena Cohrs, knitwear designer and nature lover, and Hanna Lisa Haferkamp, business coach and owner of two handmade labels. We met through the ever-elusive world of Instagram in the beginning of 2016, and immediately bonded over our shared love of natural fibers, supporting small businesses, and grey. 

Over the course of the last few months, this has shaped up to be a project beyond our wildest beliefs. We never dreamt of getting as much support, love and encouragement as we did in the last few months from every single one of you. We are thrilled that you are as excited about the book as we are - and we hope you are going to support this next step in making it happen as well! We're going to use the funds from our crowdfunding campaign to get the book printed and compensate everyone involved in the creation of the book fairly and transparently. 

We've put together a range of beautiful reward packages for you to help us make that happen. We hope you find something you like and we can't wait until you hold our book baby in your hands.

 

We're sure you're as excited as we are about the 11 modern, minimalistic knitwear patterns that we'll have in the book - but there's TONS more content for you! 

The 148 (at least) pages of the book will include

  • 11 modern, minimalistic knitwear patterns by new and established designers from all over the world
  • 11 designer profiles - one per pattern - because we want you to know who the people are that made our gorgeous designs happen! 
  •  11 yarn company profiles - also one per pattern - to share where the yarn that's been used in the pattern comes from and what makes it so special
  • 4 long form tutorials ranging from cast on to seaming 
  • 2 interviews with forces of nature from the knitting world about their specialty in design 
  • 2 long form articles about local, breed-specific yarns - one focusing on Europe, and one with a very special guest from overseas!
  • 2 spotlights of our making stories community - with a guest article we can't wait to share!

Let's talk details!

We're sure you are super curious to finally see which patterns are going to be included! We'll be sharing sneak peeks of the designs here and over on Instagram (@_makingstories) in the next few weeks, but here's a first overview:

3 sweaters:

  • A cozy cabled sweater with set in sleeves designed by Paula Pereira (@paulapkl) using Lana Rara (@lanararawool)
  • A Nordic-inspired colour work yoked sweater designed by Jenn Steingass (@knit.love.wool) using Isle Yarns (@isleyarns)
  • A gorgeous colour work raglan sweater designed by Orlane Sucche (@tete_beche) using Blacker Yarns (@blackeryarns)

1 vest:

  • A modern minimalist sleeveless vest designed by Ida Nielsen (@idafwl) using Hey Mama Wolf Yarns (@hey_mama_wolf_yarns)

1 cardigan:

  • A squishy fishermen's rib cardigan designed by Verena Cohrs (@thewoolclub) using De Rerum Natura (@dererumnatura)

1 tunic dress:

  • A tunic dress with two different fit options designed by Rhiannon Owens (@rhi.owens) using Sherwood Yarns (@sherwoodyarn)

2 pairs of mittens:

  • Woods-inspired colour work mittens designed by Claire Walls (@flossiknits) using South Downs Yarns (@louise_sdy)
  • Ombre mittens with a gorgeous stitch pattern designed by Ruth Werwai (@ruthwerwai) using Black Isle Yarns (@blackisleyarns)

Socks:

  • A pair of super comfy socks with instructions for 3 heel options - gusset and heel flap heel, a short row heel and an afterthought heel - designed by Linda Dubec (@lindadubec) using Tuku Wool (@tukuwool)

1 hat:

  • A beautiful textured hat designed by Becky Sørensen (@sopranoknits) using Ovis Et Cetera Yarns (@ovisetcetera)

​1 scarf:

  • A leave-inspired modern scarf designed by Nele Druyts (@apella.knits) using Moel View Yarns (@moel.view.yarn)

Every pattern will be accompanied by two profiles - one for the designer behind the pattern, and one for the yarn company providing the local European yarn used in the design. We want to celebrate the amazing makers that allow us to create beautiful garments and accessories with two sticks and a bit of twine - and what better way to do that than to let them tell their making story?


"Loving the things as no one has thought to love them" also means for us to learn how to make things you are going to love for a long, long time. Making garments that fit you perfectly, choosing the right techniques and being deliberate and careful in finishing your knitting works are all aspects of knitting that we cherish. Our four long form tutorials are going to help you do all of that!

  • Size Selection: We'll show you how to measure your body, what to look for in a pattern when you select the proper size for your knit, and how to adjust a pattern if you fall between two sizes. Yes, there's math involved, but don't worry, it's not scary at all!
  • Cast On & Bind Off: Selecting the right cast on and bind off method can be daunting - or, in Hanna Lisa's words, it looks a bit like magic sometimes. We'll show you how to decide which method to use so that you can be sure that you'll be happy with your finished knitting!
  • Heel Construction: Socks are one of our most beloved projects - but there are so many heel options out there that we are totally overwhelmed sometimes. We'll go into when to select which heel construction and show you how exactly to make a heel flap and gusset, a fishlips kiss heel and an afterthought heel so that you get perfect-fitting socks!
  • Seaming & Basting: You either love seaming or you hate it. We are firmly in the "love" corner - and we'd love to convert you, too! This is why we're sharing why and how to seam your finished garment, and go into some useful tips and tricks how to make your knits last longer. 

 

We are SO happy to finally spill the beans - we'll have two amazing makers from the knitting community in interviews in the book! 

Karen Templer, who is a force to reckon with in the knitting world since starting her company Fringe Supply Co. and her blog Fringe Association, is going to talk about sweater construction. Her 2016 #fringeandfriendsKAL inspired tons of knitters to improvise their own sweaters, and we were thrilled at the chance to pick her brain about her favourite ways to construct a sweater, why she fell in love with sweater knitting in the first place, and her biggest making failure to date. 

Clare Devine, the kick-ass woman behind knitsharelove, is by far one of our favourite sock designers, and given her passion for sharing knitting knowledge, it was a no brainer to ask her if she'd be up for an interview about sock construction. We dive deep into the advantages and disadvantages of different construction techniques, her favourite ways of knitting socks and learn about her ideal sock yarn.


Given that a main force of inspiration behind WOODS was the desire to share local, breed-specific, sustainable European yarns, the book wouldn't be complete without a long article about the history and significance of wool and yarn in Europe - written by yours truly, Verena and Hanna Lisa.

We didn't want to end there, but also share a glimpse outside the proverbial box and look at what local, breed-specific, sustainable yarn means outside of Europe. We're incredibly happy to have the wonderful Megan from Wool Days share her story of producing a new, all-Australian-made yarn and can't wait for you to read all about her journey to her second yarn!

 

Last, but very certainly not least - we couldn't have done all of this up to this point without you. This is why we want to celebrate all of you in the book as well! 

We'll start this with a very special maker and knitting business owner who shares her #makingstory - Francoise Danoy from Aroha Knits! 

And then it's over to you - we'll include at least a double page of the Instagram posts that made our hearts jump, our fingertips flutter, and put a big, big smile on our face. If you want to be included, share your making stories pictures using #woodsmakingstories or our weekly prompt hashtag #mymakingstory!

 

The book - as described in all its beauty above - is the core of most of our reward packages. But! There's lots more:

  • Every backer gets a free copy of the Picos de Europa Hat pattern, exclusively designed for the crowdfunding campaign by Verena Cohrs
  • If you want to have your full-on WOODS Crowdfunding accessory set, go for one of the packages that also includes the Gascogne Scarf, exclusively designed for the crowdfunding campaign by Solène Le Roux, using beautiful Spanish merino yarn from dlana
  • What would a crowdfunding campaign be without some serious SWAG? Select one of the packages that comes with four WOODS stickers, a beautiful postcard and a tote bag made from recycled cotton, printed in Germany, to up your mood board or knitting journal or project bag game!

All of these are available in various packages so that you can select your favourite combination!

And then there are three very special reward packages that allow you to get super close to WOODS:

  • PINE: Get the complete BIRCH PERSONAL package (signed copy of the book + personal note, both bonus patterns, WOODS swag) and access to one of our 30min webinars on heel or sweater construction.
  • FIR: Get the complete BIRCH PERSONAL package (signed copy of the book + personal note, both bonus patterns, WOODS swag) and an exclusive ticket to our book release party!
  • REDWOOD: Get the complete BIRCH PERSONAL package (signed copy of the book + personal note, both bonus patterns, WOODS swag), an exclusive ticket to our book release party and lots on 1on1 time with both of us with a full yarn day in Berlin! We'll organise a tour of our favourite yarn haunts, do a knitting workshop together and take you to all our favourite coffee and cake places. 

All rewards are shipped with insurance and a tracking number. International shipping is € 10, shipping to Germany is € 5.

 

We're going to use the funds that we raise to bring it to life with a beautiful printed edition, to fulfill all the rewards, and to fairly compensate everyone involved in the creation of this book!

Here's a breakdown of what we'll use the funds for:

12.000 EUR Fixed Cost:

  • Compensation for the designers
  • Professional photography for the book
  • Graphic design & layouting
  • Compensation for the crowdfunding videographers
  • Registering & publishing fees
  • Running costs of running a publisher like hosting costs, email provider etc. 

18.000 EUR Variable Cost:

  • Printing the book!
  • Producing additional rewards like the WOODS swag
  • Shipping - both material & postage
  • PayPal fees
  • Indiegogo fees

To address the elephant in the room - yes, there is no compensation for us in here. Everything up to 30.000 EUR will be used to cover our cost. If we raise more than 30.000 EUR, we might pay ourselves a bit of compensation for making the book happen, but until then, everything goes into compensating our amazing contributors, and getting the book into your hands.

So, what happens in case we don't hit the funding goal? Don't worry - no matter what, you'll get the book. We've come too far to stop now, so we'll work on a different way to finance the difference to the funding goal. That being said - we'd love to make it happen just with your help, so please support us in whatever way, shape or form you can!

 

We know this crowdfunding profile is probably wayyyy longer than good for us already, but as one of our core values is to be very transparent, we wanted to give you a quick overview of what's already happened and what our timeline is until the publication:

  • October 2016:
    • Concept Writing
    • Research
  • November 2016:
    • Call for Design Submissions
    • Yarn Company Outreach
    • Prep of design guidelines, stylesheets & contracts 
  • December 2016:  
    • Selection of yarn companies, bases & colour ways
    • Selection of final designs & matching with yarns
    • Care packages with yarn support & Christmas gifts for our designers
    • Selection of photographer - Jill, a wonderful woman-run photography agency
    • Selection of graphic designer - Vivian, a kick-ass branding expert & designer
    • Selection of videography team - Mimi & Dan, a perfect match for our vision
    • Call for Test Knitters with lots of wonderful applications!
  • January 2017:
    • Test Knitting of bonus patterns
    • Printer Research - we want to keep it environmentally friendly and local, so we'll work with a Berlin-based certified printer
    • Designing Progress - deadline for final designs was Jan 31
    • Branding & book design - first steps
    • Content Concept & Outreach
    • Crowdfunding Preparation incl. video filming
  • February 2017:
    • Tech Editing all patterns
    • Test Knitting all patterns - a huge THANK YOU to our almost 200 test knitters!
    • Branding & book design - next steps
    • Content production starts
  • March 2017:
    • Continued Test Knitting 
    • Continued Book Design
    • Continued Content Production
    • Sending out all bonus patterns after crowdfunding has ended
  • ​April 2017:
    • Test Knitting Ends!
    • Writing the final, final versions of the pattern
    • Continued Content Production
    • Continue Book Design
    • Preparation for photo shoot
  • May 2017:
    • Photo shoot!
    • Layouting & book design
  • June - October 2017:
    • Final layout & design
    • Proofreading
    • PRINTING!
    • Preparing to send out reward packages to backers 
  • November 2017:
    • PUBLICATION DAY!

 

We - Verena and Hanna Lisa, the team behind making stories and our first publication WOODS - see ourselves as an independent knitwear design publisher. Our mission is to promote knitwear designers from around the world and environmentally friendly yarn sources, mainly based in Europe.

We deeply believe in a slow living lifestyle and in nature as an emblem and a reminder for Mindfulness. We are, and love to support, small female run businesses who are trans-
parent in their operations. It's extremely important to us to take care of and bolster all members of our team - from the designers to the videographers, from the writers to the layouters. Honesty and kindness are the cornerstones of everything we do.

If you want to learn more about the two of us, head over to our Instagram feeds (@thewoolclub for Verena and @hannaontheroad for Hanna Lisa), Verena's Ravelry page and Hanna Lisa's website. We also share quite a lot about WOODS over on our website and our blog!

 

We've done most of the groundwork already - we have amazing designs, super supportive yarn partners, and wonderful makers contributing to the book. 

We've selected a photographer, graphic designer and printer that all believe in the project, are local to us in Berlin and excited to get started with their phase of the project. 

We've come equipped not only with endless enthusiasm and love for WOODS - making stories, but with a deep knowledge of knitwear design by way of Verena, business acumen by way of Hanna Lisa, and an understanding of the knitting market. 

That being said - there's always something that can go wrong. We see the main risks in

  • Unforeseen complications with designs. We're knocking on wood, but there might always be an unforeseen problem with a design. To prevent this and to make sure our patterns are at their very best, we're tech editing every single pattern intensely, and have it test knit (a huge thank you to our almost 200 test knitters here!). If changes in the design are necessary to make the pattern work better, we'll do so before the book goes into layout and print. 
  • Unforeseen complications with yarn companies. Again, crossing all our fingers here, but sometimes unexpected things happen - like a yarn company going out of business which would mean the yarn the pattern was designed wouldn't be available any more at the time of publication. All our patterns can be knit with other yarns, of course, and we've selected extremely reliable yarn partners that have been nothing but amazing so far. 
  • A delay in printing. As you can see in the timeline above, we've calculated a few months buffer time - the current estimate is that printing the book is going to take 2 to 3 weeks, so we have more than enough time factored in even if something goes wrong with the printer. 
  • Something happens to one of us. We would never quit the project voluntarily. If something happens to one of us (let's not even think about this, please!), we have contingency plans in place. 

 

If you are not a knitter and you're not interested in any of the rewards and we couldn't convince you to give it a try until now, there are still a few ways you can help us!

  • Donate! If you'd like to support us without claiming a reward, you can do that as well! Simply click on "Back it" and you can put in any amount you'd like to donate. 
  • Spread the love!! We're sure you know at least three people (maybe 4 or 5 or 124?) that you think would be interested in supporting the book. Forward them this website, tell them all about us and ask them to back the project! 
  • Post about us! On Instagram, on Facebook, on Snapchat, on your website, in the comments of your favourite knitting website, on Reddit - share this page and let people know we exist and we need help. 
  • Talk about us! If you have a knitting podcast, we'd LOVE it if you talked about the project and shared the love with your followers!
  • Stock our book. If you'd like to stock WOODS - making stories in your shop, we'd love to talk about it! Please send us an email at hello@making-stories.com. 
  • Share, share, share. If in doubt, share once more.
