And then it's over to you - we'll include at least a double page of the Instagram posts that made our hearts jump, our fingertips flutter, and put a big, big smile on our face. If you want to be included, share your making stories pictures using #woodsmakingstories or our weekly prompt hashtag #mymakingstory!
 

The book - as described in all its beauty above - is the core of most of our reward packages. But! There's lots more:

Every backer gets a free copy of the Picos de Europa Hat pattern, exclusively designed for the crowdfunding campaign by Verena Cohrs

If you want to have your full-on WOODS Crowdfunding accessory set, go for one of the packages that also includes the Gascogne Scarf, exclusively designed for the crowdfunding campaign by Solène Le Roux, using beautiful Spanish merino yarn from dlana

What would a crowdfunding campaign be without some serious SWAG? Select one of the packages that comes with four WOODS stickers, a beautiful postcard and a tote bag made from recycled cotton, printed in Germany, to up your mood board or knitting journal or project bag game!


All of these are available in various packages so that you can select your favourite combination!
And then there are three very special reward packages that allow you to get super close to WOODS:


PINE: Get the complete BIRCH PERSONAL package (signed copy of the book + personal note, both bonus patterns, WOODS swag) and access to one of our 30min webinars on heel or sweater construction.


FIR: Get the complete BIRCH PERSONAL package (signed copy of the book + personal note, both bonus patterns, WOODS swag) and an exclusive ticket to our book release party!

REDWOOD: Get the complete BIRCH PERSONAL package (signed copy of the book + personal note, both bonus patterns, WOODS swag), an exclusive ticket to our book release party and lots on 1on1 time with both of us with a full yarn day in Berlin! We'll organise a tour of our favourite yarn haunts, do a knitting workshop together and take you to all our favourite coffee and cake places. 

All rewards are shipped with insurance and a tracking number. International shipping is € 10, shipping to Germany is € 5.
 

We're going to use the funds that we raise to bring it to life with a beautiful printed edition, to fulfill all the rewards, and to fairly compensate everyone involved in the creation of this book!
Here's a breakdown of what we'll use the funds for:
12.000 EUR Fixed Cost:

Compensation for the designers
Professional photography for the book
Graphic design & layouting
Compensation for the crowdfunding videographers
Registering & publishing fees
Running costs of running a publisher like hosting costs, email provider etc. 

18.000 EUR Variable Cost:

Printing the book!
Producing additional rewards like the WOODS swag
Shipping - both material & postage
PayPal fees
Indiegogo fees

To address the elephant in the room - yes, there is no compensation for us in here. Everything up to 30.000 EUR will be used to cover our cost. If we raise more than 30.000 EUR, we might pay ourselves a bit of compensation for making the book happen, but until then, everything goes into compensating our amazing contributors, and getting the book into your hands.
So, what happens in case we don't hit the funding goal? Don't worry - no matter what, you'll get the book. We've come too far to stop now, so we'll work on a different way to finance the difference to the funding goal. That being said - we'd love to make it happen just with your help, so please support us in whatever way, shape or form you can!
 


We know this crowdfunding profile is probably wayyyy longer than good for us already, but as one of our core values is to be very transparent, we wanted to give you a quick overview of what's already happened and what our timeline is until the publication:


October 2016: 
Concept Writing
Research



November 2016: 
Call for Design Submissions
Yarn Company Outreach
Prep of design guidelines, stylesheets & contracts 



December 2016:  
Selection of yarn companies, bases & colour ways
Selection of final designs & matching with yarns
Care packages with yarn support & Christmas gifts for our designers
Selection of photographer - Jill, a wonderful woman-run photography agency
Selection of graphic designer - Vivian, a kick-ass branding expert & designer
Selection of videography team - Mimi & Dan, a perfect match for our vision
Call for Test Knitters with lots of wonderful applications!



January 2017:
Test Knitting of bonus patterns
Printer Research - we want to keep it environmentally friendly and local, so we'll work with a Berlin-based certified printer
Designing Progress - deadline for final designs was Jan 31
Branding & book design - first steps
Content Concept & Outreach
Crowdfunding Preparation incl. video filming



February 2017:
Tech Editing all patterns
Test Knitting all patterns - a huge THANK YOU to our almost 200 test knitters!
Branding & book design - next steps
Content production starts



March 2017:
Continued Test Knitting 
Continued Book Design
Continued Content Production
Sending out all bonus patterns after crowdfunding has ended


​April 2017:
Test Knitting Ends!
Writing the final, final versions of the pattern
Continued Content Production
Continue Book Design
Preparation for photo shoot



May 2017:
Photo shoot!
Layouting & book design



June - October 2017:
Final layout & design
Proofreading
PRINTING!
Preparing to send out reward packages to backers 




November 2017:PUBLICATION DAY!


 

We - Verena and Hanna Lisa, the team behind making stories and our first publication WOODS - see ourselves as an independent knitwear design publisher. Our mission is to promote knitwear designers from around the world and environmentally friendly yarn sources, mainly based in Europe.
We deeply believe in a slow living lifestyle and in nature as an emblem and a reminder for Mindfulness. We are, and love to support, small female run businesses who are trans-parent in their operations. It's extremely important to us to take care of and bolster all members of our team - from the designers to the videographers, from the writers to the layouters. Honesty and kindness are the cornerstones of everything we do.
If you want to learn more about the two of us, head over to our Instagram feeds (@thewoolclub for Verena and @hannaontheroad for Hanna Lisa), Verena's Ravelry page and Hanna Lisa's website. We also share quite a lot about WOODS over on our website and our blog!
 


We've done most of the groundwork already - we have amazing designs, super supportive yarn partners, and wonderful makers contributing to the book. 
We've selected a photographer, graphic designer and printer that all believe in the project, are local to us in Berlin and excited to get started with their phase of the project. 
We've come equipped not only with endless enthusiasm and love for WOODS - making stories, but with a deep knowledge of knitwear design by way of Verena, business acumen by way of Hanna Lisa, and an understanding of the knitting market. 
That being said - there's always something that can go wrong. We see the main risks in


Unforeseen complications with designs. We're knocking on wood, but there might always be an unforeseen problem with a design. To prevent this and to make sure our patterns are at their very best, we're tech editing every single pattern intensely, and have it test knit (a huge thank you to our almost 200 test knitters here!). If changes in the design are necessary to make the pattern work better, we'll do so before the book goes into layout and print. 

Unforeseen complications with yarn companies. Again, crossing all our fingers here, but sometimes unexpected things happen - like a yarn company going out of business which would mean the yarn the pattern was designed wouldn't be available any more at the time of publication. All our patterns can be knit with other yarns, of course, and we've selected extremely reliable yarn partners that have been nothing but amazing so far. 

A delay in printing. As you can see in the timeline above, we've calculated a few months buffer time - the current estimate is that printing the book is going to take 2 to 3 weeks, so we have more than enough time factored in even if something goes wrong with the printer. 

Something happens to one of us. We would never quit the project voluntarily. If something happens to one of us (let's not even think about this, please!), we have contingency plans in place. 


 

If you are not a knitter and you're not interested in any of the rewards and we couldn't convince you to give it a try until now, there are still a few ways you can help us!


Donate! If you'd like to support us without claiming a reward, you can do that as well! Simply click on "Back it" and you can put in any amount you'd like to donate. 

Spread the love!! We're sure you know at least three people (maybe 4 or 5 or 124?) that you think would be interested in supporting the book. Forward them this website, tell them all about us and ask them to back the project! 

Post about us! On Instagram, on Facebook, on Snapchat, on your website, in the comments of your favourite knitting website, on Reddit - share this page and let people know we exist and we need help. 

Talk about us! If you have a knitting podcast, we'd LOVE it if you talked about the project and shared the love with your followers!

Stock our book. If you'd like to stock WOODS - making stories in your shop, we'd love to talk about it! Please send us an email at hello@making-stories.com. 

Share, share, share. If in doubt, share once more.

story:
In the Shadow of the Forty-Foot Wall 

Book Pre-launch

"You shall love your neighbor as yourself." (Matthew 22:39)

 Who is my NEIGHBOR in the era of mass-incarceration?

When I was young, I remember riding past the walled fortress of the county jail in our home town.  Built around the time of the civil war, the castle-like structure intrigued me.  The iron bars that laced the huge cathedral style windows served as a reminder of the secure nature of the building. The foreboding presence of a huge wall capped with razor wire separated the captive world from the free world and compelled me to wonder what life was like for the people who temporarily resided there.  My young mind conjured up dark images from Hollywood of sinister looking people being chained to the walls of a dungeon. 

                               

My name is Patrick Tutella. Having spent thirty-five yers in jail ministry as a correctional chaplain, I am also known as Chaplain Patrick.  


When I entered the correctional chaplaincy as my profession, I discovered that people behind bars were just that - people.  Some were being held for committing horrible crimes; other's infractions were less injurious, yet they all were sentenced and defined as lawbreakers.  The people who ended up in jail and the people who didn’t surprised me. 


This is Jason Irwin, husband, father, friend and barber extradonaire.  After spending seventeen years in jails and prisons he has emerged from the shadow of the Forty-Foot Wall to a new life as a valued member of the community. His story is one of redemption and hope for people who become lost along the way and need a neighbor to walk with them out of the shadow into a new life.
 

For the last three decades the United States has locked up more of its citizens than any other nation, dubbing this as the era of mass-incarceration.  Little did I know thirty-five years ago when I began working in our county jail, that I would meet friends and neighbors on the inside who I knew in our community. 


This book is a compilation of  twenty four stories of some of the people who I met in jail and the way they impacted my life.  Some of the stories are tragic, others are triumphant;  all of them are true and they remind us of what it means to be human at the deepest plossible level. 


What Respected Leaders are Saying 

“Those behind the 40 foot wall represent some of the most marginalized of society today, and this little book of Chaplain Patrick Tutella so beautifully helps us see Christ’s image in these forgotten and often despised people.”   
Rev. Father Luke Veronis, Director, 
Missions Institute of Orthodox Christianity, 
Holy Cross Greek Orthodox School of Theology,  
Brookline, MA
“The changed lives in this book will give the reader a new vision of Divine compassion and renew hope for today’s society.”
Rev. Paul Johansson, Chairman, 
Elim Bible Institute and College, 
Lima, New York

"'In the Shadow of the Forty Foot Wall' brings us into the spiritual battleground that of a corrections institution, and shows us how Christ's power can triumph and change lives.  A very inspiring story."
Frederica Mathewes-Green
Author, Teacher, Church Leader, National Speaker
Baltimore, Maryland 


What We Need & What You Get

 The first draft of the book is finished!   

Several readers, including three authors have reviewed the book and encouraged me to continue to move forward toward getting it published. They also gave great suggestions for initial editing.  I am currently in the process of reviewing and enhancing the draft according to their suggestions.   

The  funds from this campaign will alow me: 

  • to give enough undivided attention to finish the second draft and final copy of the book; 
  • to pay for professional editing, layout, design, and publication of the book; 
  • to cover legal fees, marketing and promotion,  postage and handling.       

There is no plan B.  Barring any unforseen catastrophy, the project will be completed regardless of the outcome of the campaign.  


The Impact

  • This campaign allows YOU to become part of a national movement to bring positive change in our nation by helping to redefine the people who are returning to our communities from incarceration as our neighbors who need hope and redemption.  
  • Through your support of this book, those who have lost their way in the criminal justice system but are trying to return in a good way, will be encouraged that reintegration is possible.
  • Through your support of this book, we will help to address the need for our nation to move away from the callousness  of the punishment mentality to the correction mentality that helps people to make ammends for their wrong doing and return as respected citizens. 
  • Through your support of this book, we will encourage communities of faith to reach out to Love our Neighbors as Jesus commanded us.  


Risks & Challenges

The risk in this venture is limited to any unforseen catastrophic or lifechanging event that would render the author powerless to continue.  Otherwise we are moving forward full speed ahead according to the schedule. 

The greatest challenge is to get word out to as many people as possible to consider the millions of lives who will be touched through the message in this book. In this marketing effort everyone can be a team member by passing word on to all of your social media friends and family and asking them to also encourage their friends to get on board.  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to make it easy.

 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute yet you want to be part of the national movement to help our neighbors:

  • Please tell your friends on your social networks to check out this campaign.  
  • Let me know that you have done this and I will send you a sincere thank you. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Funded!

I am thrilled to announce that we've hit our goal, meaning the book is now fully-funded. And after less than a week, too! Thank you all so much for your support. I can't wait to share this story with you.

As further thanks, I'm starting to introduce some stretch goals:

€1,300: Bookmarks - Every Backer whose perk level includes print books will also receive a Lady Raven bookmark.

€1,600: Party! - I'll book a venue for a private reading of Blackened Wings, to which all backers will be invited.

€2,000: Cover Art - If we raise this much, I'll be able to have a professional artist do a revamp of the book covers.

Update: Designs!

Take a look at the tshirts and stretch goal bookmarks.

Tshirts

(Tshirt templates Designed by Freepik)

The tshirts will be available in a range of colours and sizes, and I'll be collecting preferences after the campaign is over, before I send the order to the printer.

Bookmarks

Front:

Back:

If we hit €1,300, every backer who has selected a perk that includes printed books will have a bookmark included in their reward.

Update: I've been asked what formats I can provide for the ebook copies. I'm able to provide Kindle, .pdf, and .epub.

----------------------------------------------------

Cora Ravenell has survived the loss of her family, her home, her name. Her enemies have tried to strip away everything she cares about, but still she fights.

Set against the backdrop of an oppressive Empire, the Lady Raven series is a rich coming-of-age fantasy, where the damsel in distress must become the hero of her own story. Swashbuckling adventure and flying pirate ships meet ancient magic and dark secrets.

It all begins in Lady Raven, the story of a young noblewoman forced to become a pirate and an outlaw after her mother is accused of treason. Cora Ravenell seeks out allies and forbidden magic, while her former fiancee is conscripted to lead the hunt against her.

In Red Skies, Cora leads her pirate crew to join the growing rebellion against the Empire, and must master her new powers before they consume her, while somehow helping to turn a scattered band of insurgents into an army.

Now, in Blackened Wings, the Empire shows its might and exacts merciless revenge upon the rebellion. Cora and her crew must embark on a desperate mission to find the last masters of the ancient magical arts, and discover a way to stop the Emperor's latest devastating weapon.

***

About:

Blackened Wings will be my sixth published novel. I have already written an urban fantasy trilogy, The Memory Wars, with WiDo Publishing, and I ventured into self-publishing with Lady Raven in 2014. Last year, I released the sequel, Red Skies, and Blackened Wings is the third installment of this four-part series.

On my website, the first thing visitors will see under my name is the phrase "Stories to show that monsters can be beaten." This is the core foundation of all my work. I believe stories, particularly adventure stories, are important for showing us that we can be better people. When we read an adventure story, we stop thinking and start feeling. We get swept up in the excitement and emotion, forgetting about the ordinary world. In essence, we join the hero on their journey through the world fantastic. When we return, as does the hero, we bring with us what we've learned. We can take lessons from stories and apply them to our own lives.

With the Lady Raven series, I explore themes of religion and myth, and how they can be used both to oppress and to educate. The Empire Cora has grown up in is fiercely patriarchal, and treats women as little better than property. It also subjugates other nations, assured of its divine right to rule over "lesser" peoples. 

During this campaign I'll be posting updates with excerpts from the first two books in the series, as well as tidbits from the new book.

Monsters can be beaten

I've seen real monsters in my life, and the first lesson in beating monsters is realising that most monsters are hard to see. Sometimes, they're not a single person. Sometimes they're even hidden inside us.

I was bullied as a child, all the way through school and even into college. I've watched people suffer abusive relationships. I've lived through emotional abuse from people I thought I could trust. I've lost a son. I've stared into the abyss and felt it stare right back.

They never tell you that sometimes, the abyss blinks.

"Heroes know that things must happen when it is time for them to happen. A quest may not simply be abandoned; unicorns may go unrescued for a long time, but not forever. A happy ending cannot come in the middle of the story." - Prince Lir, The Last Unicorn

Of all the stories I've loved, I probably owe the most to The Last Unicorn. It was the animated adaptation of Peter S. Begel's book which first taught me why things are the way they are in stories. It taught me why there are always villains to fight. Why there can be no easy way to avoid facing darkness. Why the hero has to suffer and endure hardship to finally win the day.

The problem is, in real life we don't always get to see our monsters defeated. We see good people die to disease. We see innocents suffer from hate and prejudice. We lose people we love. Sometimes the only victory is to keep going. But in stories? Now that's another matter.

In a story, the good guys can win. We can have hope that the dawn will follow night, no matter how dark it gets. So maybe it's fitting that it's now, in the darkest part of Cora's story, that I reach out to ask for help.

Blackened Wings is fully-written and with my editor. I need to raise just a little more money to help pay her and have the book formatted. This will be done in time for the book to be in your hands by early October, and I'm happy to sign all print copies. I've opted for the flexible funding option, which means regardless of the amount raised, I will publish this book and get copies to all backers. Your help will mean I can do it that much quicker.

"They made her a monster, so she became their worst nightmare." - Lady Raven tagline

All I'm asking is the chance to make Cora into the hero I know she can be.

story:
Hogy mi is ez az egész

Öt tanárkodással töltött év után írtam ezt a novella-gyűjteményt. Mivel az indiegogo oldal egy angol nyelvű oldal, ám szeretném, ha minden érdeklődő olvashatna a részletekről, létrehoztam egy blogot is, magyarul.

A megírás és a kampány történetét a következő linken olvashatod:

http://kevertkonyv.blogspot.hu/p/blog-page_16.html

A Műút portálon pedig az egyik novellát: http://www.muut.hu/?p=13825

Nagyon köszönöm, ha támogatsz, akár csak egy megosztással, vagy pedig valamilyen, a szívednek és a pénztárcádnak megfelelő összeggel. Kitaláltam kisebb-nagyobb ajándékokat is, viszonzásképpen. Ezeknek a listáját itt találod, itt, az indiegogo-n pedig perk címszó alatt:

http://kevertkonyv.blogspot.hu/p/mit-kapok-ha-a...


Short Summary

I have written this collection of short stories after spending five years at a secondary school in Budapest. The book contains eleven stories.

If you feel like continuing in Hungarian, you may follow this link: http://kevertkonyv.blogspot.hu/p/blog-page_16.html

Teaching and working with teenagers has always been very important to me, just as my own teenage years in a slightly different era. I have always loved to explore the vulnerability of this age, let it be mine or others. The stories are mostly fictional, although some of the characters might seem very familiar to the reader: I tried to stick to everyday life situations that could happen to anyone, to anyone's beloved ones.

I am trying to look into these young people's minds, to express their inner thoughts the right and simplest way, let it be about love, drugs, family, adulthood, homosexuality, death.

You will find a short description, readers' opinions and a longer interview (all of them in Hungarian) following the blog's link: http://kevertkonyv.blogspot.hu/

You can read one of the short stories, a Budapest Pride contest winner here: http://www.muut.hu/?p=13825

Unfortunately, as you may also know, it is not the easiest thing to get published nowadays. One can decide to wait till the moment they get noticed, or try to find other ways. I have chosen the latter. Not only for the success (of course I will be the happiest person on earth the second I can see the hard copy of my first published book), but also for the adventure of it. I do believe in contribution, that people around me are eager to help. I have also done it and would always do it for a great cause.

So if you feel like funding this book to get it published, I will be eternally grateful. All my life.


What We Need & What You Get

To get the book published with the company I have found, we would need $1500  approximately. This sum covers the costs of proof-reading and editing the text, then sending it to the press office. My illustrator who will be responsible for the cover design, also needs some compensation. As a final stage, the book has to arrive to the shops which is also the publisher's responsibility.

This amount would cover the publishing of 1000 hard copies. A reasonable number to start with!

Check out the perks I am offering and feel free to decide which one is suitable for you. I have tried to find out something personal to everybody so that you will surely get something memorable in return.


    Risks & Challenges

    A little help means already a lot. As this campaign is set 'flexible', I can promise that your contribution will be appreciated the right way. The publishers need a certain amount to do the editing, printing and get the book on the shelves. I hope to collect at least some part of the amount needed and in case of emergency, I will do my best to complete the sum by other sources. Actually, taking a loan would always be possible, but I somehow prefer to build the whole thing on trust and your loving heart.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you just can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help: making some noise about this campaign is already a great help.

    Share this link on Facebook, show it to your family, friends, teachers, old enemies, or share the blog: http://kevertkonyv.blogspot.hu/ .

story:
What do I want to do with the money?

As well as supporting the writing of the book I want to use this experience as a catalyst for professional development in other areas; up-scaling my whole operation.  By the end of the year I want it to be very apparent to my audience just how far their contributions have gone with much more professional looking content available for them to enjoy.

  • About £5000 will go towards living costs between August and January 2017 while I devote extra time to making the transition.  This amount will mean my rent and some bills are covered and stress levels at home are manageable.
  • Some money will be used to purchase new equipment such as a digital camera, software and voice recorder so I can learn to film, record and edit higher-quality media content on my Youtube channel.  I also want to get professional titles for my media content so it looks a bit less rough around the edges!  Having researched lots of successful blogs and YouTube channels I'm aware of what I need to do to step my game up.
  • Ideally I would like a new website to host all of my content.  This would mean all my stuff was in one place - music, journalism, comment etc - making it easier for me to track,  interact and build my audience.

Why not apply for a grant or bursary?

There are a few reasons why I have chosen not to try and access public funding.  Personally, I don't like the strings that sometimes come attached to it.  Having put out 17 self-funded musical releases since 2003 as well as founding and running a youth project between 2009 and 2014 - which raised around £20,000 through philanthropy networks - I've learned staying off the grid gives you more options.

I believe in freedom of expression and sometimes public funds come at a cost.

There are some other reasons:

 

  • Technically I could write this book without extra money (although it would be an awful lot harder, especially with the arrival of my son) 
  • As much as I believe the book will be useful it was still my choice to write it.  The public don't owe me anything.
  • Public funds are squeezed as it is.  If I can raise a bit of money some other way then I feel I have a duty to try.  

The Impact

Ultimately your support would help to set me up for the next 10 years and beyond:

  • I haven't had a traditional path through the industry or education so this gives me a big chance to focus on professional development as a writer, journalist and artist.
  • Since my teens I've been slowly building a following for my various forms of content.  This would give me a chance to consolidate that progress and bring it all together in one place before taking it to the next level professionally.
  • On a personal level your support would afford me a rare opportunity to focus completely on the work I am passionate about for just enough time to try and make something life-changing happen.

Risks & Challenges

Due to the chaotic nature of my life so far, recovering from alcoholism in 2013 after a decade of addiction, homelessness and poor mental health, I haven't had the luxury of finding out whether I am risk averse.  Now with some clean-time behind me I can see clearly the path I want to pursue.  It won't be easy but with your help I can steer this ship where it needs to be.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute just fire the link to the campaign up on social media and tag me in.  Or maybe you have a special skill like you're a slick web-designer or handy with a camera and could show me a thing or two?

Whatever you can do to support this I am eternally grateful.  Thanks for reading.

story:
rent par·ty

noun

  1. a party held to raise money to pay rent by charging guests for attendance (see also "boogie")

Rent parties began in Harlem in the 1920s when cash-strapped Uptown residents devised creative ways to pay discriminatory rental rates on low salaries. Party hosts opened their homes, and in exchange for a small cover charge, prepared food and provided live entertainment. Together, party goers defeated eviction, while eating, drinking, dancing and socializing for much less than what they’d pay for a night on the town. Everybody won!


JOIN OUR RENT PARTIES TO
KEEP CAVE CANEM IN THE HOUSE!

Cave Canem’s coast-to-coast Virtual & Actual Rent Parties revive the Harlem-style rent party with poetry at its core! Join the party and help us raise $20,000 to defray our $45,000 rent bill in 2014. When you donate to Cave Canem’s Rent Party, you help sustain the nation’s premier home for Black poetry. Your gift ensures that the many voices of African American poets will continue to be heard.


Every year, Cave Canem staff raises money from foundations and government sources for programs that are transforming the literary landscape and changing individual lives: an annual retreat for 54 emerging African American poets, community workshops that have served hundreds since 1999, the Cave Canem Poetry Prize, New Works readings, and many more events and opportunities. Unfortunately, the reality is that grants cover only a small percentage of overhead, including rent, the single most challenging line item in our budget.

While the spirit of Cave Canem is evident throughout New York City and beyond, maintaining a centralized hub is vital to the work we do. Our headquarters in DUMBO, Brooklyn has been blessed by the presence of poets at all career stages, and many a poem (perhaps one of yours) has been conceived within these walls.  Our airy loft overlooking the East River is a welcoming, safe space for workshops, readings, research and conversations, and serves as a gallery for exhibiting visual art. For staff, fellows, board members and volunteers, having a physical site to plan, fundraise and prepare programs is key. Like most rental space in New York City, however, it comes with a hefty price tag. 


Give a little, get a lot!

When you give, you will you have our deep gratitude, receive distinctive perks, and most importantly, have the satisfaction of knowing that you are making a positive difference to the future of American poetry. 

All donors are eligible to receive our gratitude by way of poems, books, movies, workshops, and private readings. We want you to experience the art that our family creates as our thanks. We think you'll enjoy what we've curated for you!

Who are we?

Cave Canem Foundation is a home for the many voices of African American poetry and is committed to cultivating the artistic and professional growth of African American poets. A 501(c)(3) non-profit service and presenting literary organization with administrative and programming headquarters in Brooklyn, NY, Cave Canem was founded in 1996 by Toi Derricotte and Cornelius to remedy the under-representation and isolation of African American poets in MFA programs and writing workshops.

Over the past 17 years, the organization has grown from an initial gathering of 26 poets to become an influential movement with a renowned faculty and a high-achieving national fellowship of 371. Cave Canem poets are influencing the literary landscape and inspiring the genesis of such organizations as Kundiman, a national organization dedicated to the creation and cultivation of Asian American poetry, and CantoMundo, which provides a space for the creation, documentation and critical analysis of Latina/o poetry.

With an annual week-long writing retreat, community based workshops, publications, nationally based readings and Poets on Craft conversations, Cave Canem programs bring previously marginalized voices to the center of cultural awareness and the popular imagination. Cave Canem annually engages approximately 250 writers with readings, panels and opportunities to lead community-based workshops in New York City and Pittsburgh, which have served 600 emerging poets of color since 1999. We partner with six prestigious presses to deliver a first-book prize (13 collections to date), a second-book prize and anthologies; together, our publications reach a national readership of thousands.

Cave Canem enjoys over 20 local, regional and national cultural partnerships, among them:

  • The Brooklyn Book Festival, where we are a Programming Partner;

  • The Association of Writers and Writing Programs Conference, where we are a Literary Partner; and 

  • Five collaborative residencies at such sites as the Millay Colony for the Arts, Vermont Studio Center and City of Asylum/Pittsburgh.

Our social media network includes over 7,440 Facebook fans and friends, 2,846 Twitter followers, 13,420–plus YouTube views and 51,000 annual website visits.

Awards garnered by fellows include, among many others, the Rona Jaffe Foundation Writers’ Award, Whiting Writers' Award, NAACP Image Award, the Academy of American Poets’ Laughlin Award, National Poetry Series Selection, Cave Canem Poetry Prize, and Guggenheim and Ruth Lilly Fellowships. Fellows have 180+ books in print and have gained significant footholds in academic positions around the country. Faculty member Elizabeth Alexander was named President Obama’s Inaugural Poet in 2008; faculty members Terrance Hayes and Nikky Finney won the National Book Award for Poetry in 2010 and 2011, respectively; 2002 Cave Canem Poetry Prize winner Tracy K. Smith received the 2012 Pulitzer Prize for Poetry; and Natasha Trethewey, faculty member and inaugural winner of the Cave Canem Poetry Prize, currently serves as U. S. Poet Laureate.


Thank you!

We appreciate all the ways you support this campaign, not limited to:

  • Making a tax-deductible donation today,
  • Cutting a rug at the local rent party,
  • Spreading the word through social media and normal conversation, and
  • Reading work by the Cave Canem community!

story:
(Check out book excerpts under the Gallery tab.)

In the past few years I became exhausted.  This was not the exhaustion you experience from working too hard or failing to get enough sleep. I became tired of being a chronic procrastinator who will “do it tomorrow” or “some other time.” 

I became tired of squandering life on the couch watching travel shows about other people’s world adventures but never going to those places myself. I became tired of being overweight, not obese, but out of shape enough to demonstrate that I lacked discipline. I became tired of being constrained by debt and missing fantastic opportunities because of it. I became tired of watching other people achieve far more success with what appeared to be less talent and far less resources. I wondered why they succeeded, but yet I didn’t. I was 40 years old with a beautiful Bond Girl and three wonderful Little Bond Girl daughters, but something was grossly missing in my life.

Then, I wrote this book to remind myself and all Men what it means to be a Man of Action!  The goal of this book is to inspire and mentor you to become a Man of Action and achieve more, enjoy life more and live out your greatest Adventures.

The writing is finished, but there is more work to do.  I put this book on indiegogo to fund the following action items:

  • I have secured the help of a professional editor, and she is ready to begin as soon as this book funds.
  • I have secured the services of professional cover artist, and she is ready to begin as soon as the book funds.
  • The funding of this project will allow me to print enough books to reduce total printing cost.
  • My website is sub par, and I am going to hire outside resources to finish it.
  • There are some marketing projects for the book that will require funding.  

If you are not ready to fund the project but think its a great idea, please like us on Facebook, twitter and LinkedIn


Here is a little preview of the book chapters:

Chapter 1:    Getting started on your Bond Transformation 

Chapter 2:    Bond’s Life Principles 

Chapter 3:    The Bond Values 

Chapter 4:    Dossier of Bond Villains (Villains we all face) 

Chapter 5:    The Eight Bullets of Bond’s Fitness Program 

Chapter 6:    Bond’s Money & Finances 

Chapter 7:    The Bond Image & Style Guide (Look like Bond)

Chapter 8:    The Bond Presence (Portray a commanding Bond Presence) 

Chapter 9:    Travel on Missions (Not where, but how you travel) 

Chapter 10:   Bond’s Education (Study & Learn like Bond)  

Chapter 11:   Bond Girls (How to treat the Bond Girls in your life) 

Chapter 12:   Sports & Activities (Competition, Camaraderie, & Adventure) 

Chapter 13:   Gambling (More importantly, Risk Taking) 

Chapter 14:   Leisure (A Man of Action must be able to relax like Bond)

Chapter 15:   The Spiritual Side of Bond

Chapter 16:   Planning & Executing Your Missions 

Chapter 17:   Implementing your Bond Lifestyle Plan

Short Summary

Hi. My name is Jessica. I'm 18 and live in a somewhat small town in Texas.

Since I was a kid, I've loved to write. I've written a million short stories, and one novel. (None published yet. boo :<)

I'm fascinated about death and suicide, but don't get me wrong. I'm interested on why people do kill themselves, the pressures that society puts on people, and how we see life as a whole. How we value life once it has slipped away.

In Japan, there is a forest called Aokigahara. The suicide forest. Hundreds of people go there each year to kill themselves. It pulls at my soul to know that it exists, but not know why. 

I'd love more than anything to go and visit the forest, and see the society for myself to see how we value life differently. Writing a book about how we consider life is a dream to me, and I hope I can get to fulfill it. I have been studying Japanese for a few months now so that way I won't be so lost when I get there.

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is going to be for $3,000 or $4,000 since I will be staying for the full 3 months that I will have on a visa. The funding will go to everything I will need. It will cover all food, transportation, everything I would need while I am there.

But please don't feel as if I'm taking your money and running off with it.

If you donate, I will write you a letter, thanking you for your time and money, and would send a trinket from Japan if you'd like. If you're comfortable with that, I mean.

If I cannot get the amount I need by my goal, every single penny of it will still go towards my $3-4,000 that I need. I won't rip anyone off, I promise.

I will still keep the names and will, eventually when I get there in November, buy the trinkets and send them out when I get back to my home around March.

The Impact

I would very much like to be able to go while I still can. This is important to me, as odd as it sounds.

For years, I have been so invested in questioning why suicide is looked upon differently in other cultures, how in my state it is such a frowned upon thing, but yet across the world there is a forest dedicated to the deaths of those willing to die before their time.

I have a job as a secretary but I don't earn very much. I have been looking for a second job around me but with the way things are, it's getting difficult to pin a job down. I used to teach English, but my student lost his job and couldn't afford to continue, so I lost mine as well. I understand that money is tight with everyone else, and I'm not expecting so much. I understand if you can't give anything at all.

Other Ways You Can Help

Again, I understand if you cannot help with money, but if you could please send this out, maybe someone could help.

Thank you very much if you've read through all of this, and haven't run off yet.

story:
What's Up?

Welcome to the first public book signing for Lisa Gytri's debut novel, Into the Darkness of Daylight.

 

What's the Deal?

Into the Darkness of Daylight is Lisa Gytri's first novel, and she needs your help to make it go big.  The novel is finished, and is available in both Kindle and paperback formats, but Lisa wants to let as many potential readers as possible know about it!  She's excited about holding live book signings to get the word out and meet readers.

Funding is needed to purchase materials for these live book signings such as paperbacks, advertising material, and shiny silver pens to autograph the ebon covers of Into the Darkness of Daylight paperbacks.  Lisa is seeking $1000.00 to get material for three live book signings/meet and greets.  Any funds contributed will go toward the purchase of books for signings I'm planning in Portland, OR and Big Bear, CA.  More funding equals more materials, and possibly more signing locations and dates.

While Lisa would be honored if you purchased Into the Darkness of Daylight on Kindle, she'd like the opportunity to sign a paperback especially for you, or give you a shout out on her Writing and Adventures website, www.lisagytri.com

 

Ready to Go!

Here's the back cover text of Into the Darkness of Daylight:

Jim Wells has always been haunted by telepathic messages from alien beings. When these beings attempt to come to Earth to harvest humans and process them into a special form of narcotics made from human emotions, Jim hijacks a ballistic missile to take them down. After escaping into a network of caverns, Jim hides quietly away from humanity until he learns of another alien ship's impending arrival. On the Korean Peninsula, Jim will risk sparking a global war to thwart the imperialistic plans of his cosmic enemy.


Whet your appetite for adventure?  There's more at www.lisagytri.com

Curious about what other readers' perceptions of Into the Darkness of Daylight are?  Here's some reviews:

"Wow! From rural Montana to the bustling streets of Seoul, Lisa Gytri weaves a compelling yarn! A brilliant blend of science fiction and post-cold war thriller, Lisa's style is unpredictable, humorous and thought provoking. Think Stephen King's "Langoliers" collide with "Independence Day" and "War of the Worlds" seasoned with a dash of Chuck Palahniuk. Lisa's unlikely hero is the essence of perseverance and personal redemption capable of motivating "old men" to "gytter done." Thoroughly enjoyable! I look forward to further offerings by this gifted new author!"

"Beautifully and brilliantly written. Couldn't put it down. Very thought provoking in the most entertaining way. Absolutely recommend for anyone looking for a thriller in any genre."

"I purchased this book this morning, and with the exception of grabbing a quick breakfast, I did not put it down until I had completed it!!! Riveting, engrossing, original, horrifying, as well as a fun ride through familiar events that define this time period! Great first book!! It successfully kept me from a day of work around my house! A welcome diversion!"

What's your review going to be?  What mystery personal touch will Lisa add to a uniquely embellished Into the Darkness of Daylight paperback?
 
***U.S. shipping only for all perks in this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help Lisa get the word out, you know the social media call to action.  Facebook (Lisa Gytri), Instagram (#intothedarknessofdaylight), Twitter (@lisagytri).  Like, tweet, and share, to add spacecraft propulsion acceleration to the campaign!

story:
What is {Young}ist?

{Young}ist is a young people-powered website devoted to storytelling, artistic projects, and news analysis with staff and contributors all under the age of 26. We’re bringing artists and activists together to cross-pollinate and give voice to the stories of our generation.

We will publish multimedia content, written features, expressive long-form journalism, and innovative art forms that will provide a wide range of perspectives on culture and politics—all through the eyes and hands of youth.

Check us out on Tumblr, Facebook and Twitter

Why make a site like this?

Around the globe, our generation is coming to terms with extreme economic and climate crises. In the midst of these crises, we are connecting the online internet buzz of social media with offline action--and doing it better than mainstream media ever could. It’s about time we had our own space; a platform to allow us to speak for ourselves. To one another.

Our generation is sharing information rapidly and the way that we produce our own information is constantly shifting. And so are the power dynamics. Entire movements—from the Arab Spring to Occupy Wall Street—have been catalyzed through the perfect chemistry of face-to-face organizing, branded aesthetics, and social media communication.

It is young people who are the ones at the forefront of these movements while simultaneously deciphering the most effective and efficient strategies to get our stories out to greater audiences. However, there are few platforms that facilitate the ascension of youth into the roles of: strategist, designer, or author. Herein lies the problem: there is no website that is run entirely for youth. And so, we need a home of our own—for us and by us—on the internet.

Who is making this site happen?

Our core staff includes student organizers from New York City, Los Angeles, and Atlanta, techy designer folk, multimedia artists, slam poets, a Montreal transplant whose journalistic coverage of the Quebec student strike received international attention, marketing and social media gurus who have worked with New York Students Rising, 18 Million Rising and 99Rise (lots of rising!), and some online media folks who have written for and worked at publications like Salon.com, Alternet, and The Nation--and our combined age is 138!

Though we have a range of interests, our common vision is found in seeing young artists and activists work together to tell the stories of our generation—and together we're developing a way to do just that.

Start-up and launch

We’ve gathered a team of incredible 30 contributors from all over the globe. We will let their accomplishments speak for themselves: a DJ who is the youngest person ever to select music for a major network TV show, the person responsible for putting together The Nation’s biweekly Dispatches from the US Student Movement, 1 of the Georgia 8 of the undocumented student movement, the project coordinator for the 2013 National Student Power Convergence, a young artist who is apart of the #YoSoy132 movement in Mexico City, a Pakistani writer who previously has written for VICE, and many, many more!

Over the next month, our contributors and editors will be publishing on Tumblr while we work with some very dedicated designers to build a site that’s designed to be interactive and super customizable—getting the news you want, the way you want it, and looking good doing it.

How much do you need to launch?

We’ve got to hit $12,000. It’s the bare-bones budget for launching this project but the more you give, the more we will be able to do!

Where is the money going?

  • Web design and development
  • Stipends for our hard-working team (both staff and regular contributors!)
 

Clockwise From Top: Prize Level $50 (Front); Prize Level $50 (Back); Prize Level $300

Testimonies

I'm supporting {young}ist because I owe it to another generation of activists, artists, and writers who are striving to create a critical online space that reflects a vibrant youth movement, and because we'll all benefit once they're able to do so. Your donation reflects your commitment to a more just world—one where youth deliberately carve out a space for their voices, and where the rest of us deliberately listen."

~ Aura Bogado, Reporter for The Nation and Colorlines.com

"People north of forty years old, speak in blanket terms about "younger generations" as if they are inactive sleepwalkers. When in fact, older generations have polluted our food, medicated our nation, removed arts, robbed our banking system, profitized prisons, controlled education and slight of hand--sullied the playing field, toward an unspoken oligarchy. {Young}ist, is a force~filled way for discussions, mandates, missions and humans--to potentially evolve."

~ Victoria Mahoney, Director and Producer of Yelling to the Sky, award-winning independent film

"I'm supporting {young}ist because the radical voices of our generation are silenced. You won’t hear from marginalized youth on television. You won’t see the art they create on the walls of a gallery. {young}ist will amplify these voices: it will also connect them. Spaces of creation and reflection are often lacking from our shared experience of activism. May a fresh, young perspective on media fill that void? {young}ist is proof of a resounding yes."

~ Jérémie Bernard-Wien, Spokesperson for Quebec student union, ASSE

FAQs

Can we exceed the goal?

Of course! The more of your funding we receive, the more we will be able to do in terms of making our start-up as smooth as possible!

Who will be writing for {Young}ist?

Well, it’s not just writing. But you can see the bios of our contributors here.

Are you including global voices as a part of {Young}ist?

Our team is very dedicated to building a global contributor base and is currently recruiting writers, musicians, artists, movers and shakers from around the world who are involved in innovative work in their communities.  

What kind of content will be published on {Young}ist?

Good question! You can check out the Tumblr that we’ve started where you can find the first pieces of content our contributors have put together with the support of our editorial team. 

I know an awesome young person. How can I get them involved?

Great! We are accepting applications for contributors. Please send an inquiry to isabelle.nastasia (at) gmail (dot) com for more information about this process!

story:
Who am I? And what are Girls I’ve Run Away With and Moonshine Press?

My name is Rhiannon Argo and I have been an avid writer of fiction for 25 years. I embarked on my first book project when I was an 8 yr old with a mullet. I have come a long way since then, not only do I have a more flattering haircut, but I also have a published novel under my belt, The Creamsickle, which won a Lambda Literary Award and was translated into German by a European press. I've been published in many anthologies and magazines, have self-published handmade chapbooks, had a short story inspire a film adaptation, and have toured my work across the United States, Canada and Europe with The Sister Spit Literary Performance Tour (a feminist writing collective) three times. I have read my work from universities in Lincoln, Nebraska, to radical art spaces as far away as Ljubljana, Slovenia!

Recently I finished my second novel, Girl’s I’ve Run Away With, and while seeking a publisher found my prospects to be bleak. The publishing world has been changing rapidly and options for edgy, queer, feminist writers are more limited than ever before. There are only a few small presses that I feel match my works’ aesthetic and they’re so bogged down that I’d have to wait a loooong time for actual publication. I thought, “YOLO! I don’t have that kind of patience!” By that point my books will be stacking up waiting to be dog eared by readers, so I decided to Do-It-Myself. I will launch my own  micro-press called Moonshine Press and Girls I’ve Run Away With will be the first publication.

                           

Moonshine Press will grow to publish other writers of the feminist, queer and trans* persuasion, with a mission to strengthen the power of such voices in the literary world at large. There will be anthologies, and there are fellow writers who are already interested in working on future projects. Why the name Moonshine Press?

Two reasons:

1). The moon is associated with rhythms, memories and moods, and is identified with the feminine principle.

2). I was born in a tipi my hippie mom made by hand in a magical place called Moonshine Meadow on Moonshine Road.

                             

This Indiegogo campaign will procure funding to launch Moonshine Press and publish its debut novel Girls I’ve Run Away With. Let me tell you more about this novel. Written with queer youth readers in mind, I’ve written a novel I wish I could have read in high school, or in my early twenties. The options were seriously lacking when it came to entertaining feminist, or LGBTQ lit, with strong female protagonists. Girls I’ve Run Away With is a fun story of love on the run, but it also touches on heavy topics that are pertinent to the lives of today’s gay youth, such as; coming out, dysfunctional families, being kicked out of your house because you’re gay, the clash of religious beliefs vs. sexual orientation, mental health, suicide of gay teens, notions of queer family, ect, and all of this, while still being an enjoyable read, with a fast-paced plot, and well-drawn characters.

 

Funding Breakdown & Fun Perks

Below are my cost estimates based on information I've gleaned from other folks who run small presses, folks that have self published, and professionals who quoted me for various services. So far everyone I am working with is queer community :) 

ISBNs: $275 (Bulk is cheaper and can be used for future Moonshine Press works)

LLC incorporation: $300 or so

Copy Editor:  $600

Typesetter/Layout: $800-1000 (I still need to hire this person! Is this you?)

ARC's: $500 

Website Design: $900

Graphic Designer: $300+

Fundraising fees: $300-500 (This is the % indiegogo and Paypal take)

Book printing: $3,000 (Initial print run of 500 books)

Total: $6,975.00 - 7,375.00 

* I am asking for less than I actually need with my campaign to make sure I reach my goal. Ideally, I would like to raise more than than the 4,500 asked. The cost estimate above is only how much it will cost to publish only the first Moonshine Press book and not any future books. I was very lucky to get some services for free from awesome friends, such as Amos Mac, who will shoot the cover, and Jaye Fishel, who did free substantive editing. Thanks friends :) Any overage raised, beyond paying people and start-up costs, will go to publicity, touring, and future press publications.

 

The Impact of this Campaign!

As a contributor to this campaign you will be investing in numerous things; the career of a hardworking emerging writer, the publication of a novel that will contribute to the LGBTQ literary canon, AND the start up costs of an exciting new micro-press that will expand the publishing opportunities for marginalized writers! 

                         

I have an excellent track record so you don’t have to worry about this project not taking off with the force of a bottle rocket! Here are some examples of my artistic and professional follow through:

  • I finished my debut novel, The Creamsickle, when I was only 27.
  • I currently have one finished novel, its over half done sequel, and a fourth novel in the works. That’s a whole lot of motivated writing, people.  
  • I have self-published novella length chapbooks, all by hand. IE: taught myself In designt, hand spray painted covers, organized release parties and promo. I am experienced in the art of producing and publishing but I have been totally DIY until now. I am asking for help now so I can turn my art into an actual business with the professional quality it deserves!
  • I have an undergraduate degree in Creative Writing and a master’s degree in Library and Information Sciences. My education informs my knowledge of the publishing industry, literary, marketing and technological skills, and much more.
  • I have a strong network of friends, and advisors, in the literary and publishing fields that are offering me great support and advice with these projects.

I've invested way more monetarily in my writing than I’ve ever made. It's a labor of love! I've relied on passion, luck, craftiness, and opportunity to fuel my career thus far.

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

You can also help me by sharing this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Tweet it!, or yell about it from the mountain tops. Also, like Moonshine Press on Facebook. www.facebook.com/moonshinepress. :)

Thank You, Thank you, Thank You,

Rhiannon Argo

There are only a few small presses that I feel match my works’ aesthetic and they’re so bogged down that I’d have to wait a loooong time for actual publication. I thought, “YOLO! I don’t have that kind of patience!” By that point my books will be stacking up waiting to be dog eared by readers, so I decided to Do-It-Myself. I will launch my own  micro-press called Moonshine Press and Girls I’ve Run Away With will be the first publication.
                           
Moonshine Press will grow to publish other writers of the feminist, queer and trans* persuasion, with a mission to strengthen the power of such voices in the literary world at large. There will be anthologies, and there are fellow writers who are already interested in working on future projects. Why the name Moonshine Press?
Two reasons:
1). The moon is associated with rhythms, memories and moods, and is identified with the feminine principle.
2). I was born in a tipi my hippie mom made by hand in a magical place called Moonshine Meadow on Moonshine Road.
                             
This Indiegogo campaign will procure funding to launch Moonshine Press and publish its debut novel Girls I’ve Run Away With. Let me tell you more about this novel. Written with queer youth readers in mind, I’ve written a novel I wish I could have read in high school, or in my early twenties. The options were seriously lacking when it came to entertaining feminist, or LGBTQ lit, with strong female protagonists. Girls I’ve Run Away With is a fun story of love on the run, but it also touches on heavy topics that are pertinent to the lives of today’s gay youth, such as; coming out, dysfunctional families, being kicked out of your house because you’re gay, the clash of religious beliefs vs. sexual orientation, mental health, suicide of gay teens, notions of queer family, ect, and all of this, while still being an enjoyable read, with a fast-paced plot, and well-drawn characters.
 


Funding Breakdown & Fun Perks
Below are my cost estimates based on information I've gleaned from other folks who run small presses, folks that have self published, and professionals who quoted me for various services. So far everyone I am working with is queer community :) 
ISBNs: $275 (Bulk is cheaper and can be used for future Moonshine Press works)
LLC incorporation: $300 or so
Copy Editor:  $600
Typesetter/Layout: $800-1000 (I still need to hire this person! Is this you?)
ARC's: $500 
Website Design: $900
Graphic Designer: $300+
Fundraising fees: $300-500 (This is the % indiegogo and Paypal take)
Book printing: $3,000 (Initial print run of 500 books)
Total: $6,975.00 - 7,375.00 
* I am asking for less than I actually need with my campaign to make sure I reach my goal. Ideally, I would like to raise more than than the 4,500 asked. The cost estimate above is only how much it will cost to publish only the first Moonshine Press book and not any future books. I was very lucky to get some services for free from awesome friends, such as Amos Mac, who will shoot the cover, and Jaye Fishel, who did free substantive editing. Thanks friends :) Any overage raised, beyond paying people and start-up costs, will go to publicity, touring, and future press publications.
 

The Impact of this Campaign!




As a contributor to this campaign you will be investing in numerous things; the career of a hardworking emerging writer, the publication of a novel that will contribute to the LGBTQ literary canon, AND the start up costs of an exciting new micro-press that will expand the publishing opportunities for marginalized writers! 
                         
I have an excellent track record so you don’t have to worry about this project not taking off with the force of a bottle rocket! Here are some examples of my artistic and professional follow through:

I finished my debut novel, The Creamsickle, when I was only 27.
I currently have one finished novel, its over half done sequel, and a fourth novel in the works. That’s a whole lot of motivated writing, people.  
I have self-published novella length chapbooks, all by hand. IE: taught myself In designt, hand spray painted covers, organized release parties and promo. I am experienced in the art of producing and publishing but I have been totally DIY until now. I am asking for help now so I can turn my art into an actual business with the professional quality it deserves!
I have an undergraduate degree in Creative Writing and a master’s degree in Library and Information Sciences. My education informs my knowledge of the publishing industry, literary, marketing and technological skills, and much more.
I have a strong network of friends, and advisors, in the literary and publishing fields that are offering me great support and advice with these projects.

I've invested way more monetarily in my writing than I’ve ever made. It's a labor of love! I've relied on passion, luck, craftiness, and opportunity to fuel my career thus far.
 
Other Ways You Can Help!



You can also help me by sharing this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Tweet it!, or yell about it from the mountain tops. Also, like Moonshine Press on Facebook. www.facebook.com/moonshinepress. :)

Thank You, Thank you, Thank You,
Rhiannon Argo

story:
A New World - book one: First Contact 

The story

Set before the formation of the first Egyptian Kingdom, First Contact sets the foundation of the utopian society that Albert, Carrie, Doc and Dorian hope to create.

From the edge of the Sahara, to the delta of the Nile, First Contact will tell of the birth of an empire that would soon rise to challenge both western and southern Europe and even the mighty East.

An empire that would work only to the creation of a new timeline at the end of which humanking would emerge as a better and more advanced civilization.

Can mankind achieve more given better chances and healthier principles or will it just end up destroying itself in some other way? A New World is a 6000-year long scenario of just one answer to that question.

The author

I am a 30-year old journalist, from Romania, who has been writing creatively for several years, always poking around this project but never quite making it to the point where it would amount to a cohesive concept.

Ever since my early teens I’ve been a passionate science-fiction reader with a special interest for those titles that proposed dystopian futures for mankind, such as Herbert & Ransom’s Void or Simmons’ Hyperion. Faced through literature and cinema with questions regarding the benefits of time-travel I figured that a different approach could be presented if much of early human history could be changed. 

It took me several years to reach the point where I had the confidence of being able to picture such an alternative and that is how I started writing this book. I am happy that I have managed to cross the ominous one hundred page step stone and I am very much looking forward to see where this book leads me next.

Between life and book

I feel compelled to refrain from calling writing this book my life’s dream, but after beginning a dozen or more projects and seeing how only this one has actually led somewhere I must admit that it is exactly that, my dream project.

Alas, at this stag my dream does not pay for the bills so I am asking for your help to keep writing. Part of the funding will go into covering expenses during the next six months, which is how long I predict will take me to finish the first volume: First Contact.

Another part will go into covering expenses for about a month in London, where I need to undertake the last part of the work on the book; said expenses include fees for such services as editing by a native English speaker, a historical fact-check and other steps I feel are necessary before the manuscript can be submitted to publishing-houses. A smaller amount will be invested into developing the online New World Community.

Together for A New World

You might have already noticed that I am not working the usual approach, and I will not use the funding received here to actually publish the book. That is why, as far as perks go, much of the whole system is based on the assumption that donors consider this project worthwhile, where worthwhile means it will actually be picked up by a major publishing-house and become part of the libraries of like-minded people all over the world.

Donating will also make you part of the New World Community about which you can find out more in the perks category.

 Excerpt from Chapter 1 - Tactics 

"We don’t know what’s going on but we have to stay alert. Who knows, maybe the time for First Contact is now”, Dorian said as he was packing his gear.

“I’ll go scout, I’ll be back in ten”, said Carrie and proceeded to go around in order to get a better vantage point.

“Careful, if there are attackers, they might be circling the site themselves”.

The yells didn’t stop, and it became clearer now that they were hearing taunts and protest, but not yet anything that would sound like people getting hurt or dying.

“Maybe it’s only a showdown”.

“You really think they do showdowns in this age? Nah, these people get down to it when they do, I’m sure”; Doc grinned, but with an anxious look, he didn’t want conflict either, no matter how ready he would be for it..

Albert was now in full-battle mode, crossbow holstered at his hip and his most fearsome weapon and tool, a harpoon, strapped to his back. Not an usual fishing harpoon it was either. Its hook longer and thinner, yet deadly sharp, it could clear the neck off a foe; if its teeth sank in, no bone or flesh would stay in place when he’d retract that weapon. Over half a meter long, the harpoon had a small grip, like a French duel sword; it helped its owner climb with it too, if necessary.

Dorian was quite distraught when he first saw him use his weapon, not five months after they started their training. Their base had been attacked by Christian zealots. Unprecedented in the history of mankind, both the Roman Pope and the Iranian Ayatollah had dubbed their mission a direct attack at God, and many all over the world sought to destroy what they were working for.

They were awoken at night by the explosion that led the way for a holy commando. None of them were hurt, but several guards died defending the premises before Albert, Doc and Carrie joined the fight.

Dorian was still no fighter, not that he was now, but that night determined him to pay more attention to close-quarters combat and swordplay. Albert slew five zealots before the dreadful attack was over, ripping with his harpoon from victim to victim.

He saved Dorian with one of those kills, beheading a slender albino youth who was cursing at him in Latin while preparing to sink his blade into his chest. He closed his eyes in terror than he heard no more curses, just a helpless growl, as he felt his attacker falling on top of him. When he opened his eyes blood was gushing from a neck that held a head no longer, as Albert was resting his harpoon on the floor to help him out from beneath the dead fanatic. He couldn’t help but look at his head rolled over on the floor meters away; the zealot’s eyes where still open, enough to see the hate frozen in his gaze. That hate was what they were fighting against, he had yet to realize until that night how bloody, gruesome and up-close that fight would be.

story:
"Todos Unidos" Project

Hello , my name is Daniel Edgardo Mena and since 2010 , my family and I have worked to help people in need and we have created a ministry called "Todos Unidos " . We help with food or money to people living on the streets or poor people and while, we spoke of God's love as it is a Christian ministry .

In our country , El Salvador , crime and poverty are serious problems that affect the entire country and we want to provide a solution for some people helping from our ministry. My parents help me doing this work , their names are Daniel ( father) and my mother Zoila and some people that sometimes help us too .

Unfortunately we need money to continue to help others, but we have devised a way to get it, through a Christian magazine that I want to create because I own skills as a graphic designer and I have worked previously as creating journals but I don’t have a camera.

I want to create a magazine with interesting content to fund the project and help many people.

Those are magazines that I had previously created for the university because I am still student: 

http://issuu.com/danymena88/docs/turismo_cro_3

http://issuu.com/danymena88/docs/descubre_occidente_version_2013

In our society it is very important to talk about moral values ​​and Christian , that's why we want to create the magazine and it can raise money all the time to finance the project, we only need a professional camera for this project , and that is the help we are requesting , to raise funds to purchase a professional camera.

We also want to create postcards with photographs where we are helping people so they can be sent as a souvenir.

 This campaign is not only important for me but for the people who we will help in the future because we will not stop helping as many people as we can, to me and my family is a responsibility and a target we want to achieve with your contribution to this campaign , your help is very important.



We Need a professional camera

I have knowledge in graphic design and that gives us an advantage, so we just need a professional camera to create a Christian magazine so we will fund our project to help people in need.

We need your help to realize this campaign and to continue helping people.

Professional cameras in El Salvador are worth about $1,500 - $1,900.

For this reason, we have set the amount of this campaign fund at $1,800 USD.

If we do not reach the goal of this campaign, the money raised will be used to continue helping the poor churches with food aid packages as seen in the video.

When we reach the goal you may contact me to give an example of the result of this campaign, or to contact me may do so by email danymena88@gmail.com


you will cause an impact in many people

Our desire is to move forward with our project so, send your support to this campaign is very important, because with your help we can bring help to many more people who are homeless or have no food for their children. You can see pictures of how we help people when we collect the money from this campaign.

You can make a difference for some people such as those shown in the video, they live a life of poverty and we all together can do much to help.


Other Ways You Can Help

Contact me at the email address danymena88@gmail.com

story:
Watch live masses, testimonies religious programs, listen to hymns, check the daily bible, prayers, and the holy rosary, and many more upcoming features on Sancta Maria Radio’s app.
It is the generosity of you, our listeners, and supporters that enables Sancta Maria Radio to stay on air.
Nowadays, many churches are adopting various digital technologies to spread their teachings and faith, rather than spreading the word through traditional media.
Technology is only valuable when used to highlight the Word of God.
Then why not help us share God's love to the world?
A flashback of Sancta Maria Radio’s Foundation
Sancta Maria Radio shed light in June 2013 with a mission to spread God's word all over the world using today's mobile technology. It is the ultimate praying tool for all Christians. There’s an app and a website for all our digital listeners and an FM and online radio broadcasting hymns and other religious programs. 24/7/365

The 300,000+ active listeners and the 100,000+ active users are the ones who motivate us and keep us going.
Your financial support is needed to continue Sancta Maria Radio’s mission. This money will cover the app’s support costs on multiple platforms, along with its new website.

Thank you for your generosity. We wouldn’t have done it without you!
God bless you!

story:
About Eva and Her Book

Eva recently re-acquired the rights to her historical WWI-era novel, The War in Our Hearts, and she wants to re-release it. It's getting a fresh edit, a new cover, and a new audio version.

Here's what the book is about.

France, 1916: Estelle Graham faces a nightmare. Expecting to be met by her beloved husband and their newly-adopted daughter, she instead finds him gravely injured and unconscious in a casualty clearing station. Taking solace in his journals and letters, she fights for his care—and his life.

In a farmhouse near the Somme, Captain Jamie Graham is forever changed when he meets young Aveline Perrault. Damaged by the cold, cruel world around them—made even colder by the war—the pair form an unlikely bond. Aveline finds in her capitaine the father she never had, and with her help, Graham faces the pain from his own childhood that even his loving marriage could not heal.

Discover the depth of love and faith in the face of brutality as they learn to live while surviving the Great War.

What Eva Needs to Make This Happen

  • Eva needs $295 to cover the cost of purchasing ISBNs for the various formats of this book. Each ISBN costs $29.50. She will have an e-book, a paperback, and an audio version, with the remaining ISBNs in reserve for the future. Novellas? Collections of short stories? Maybe both? (The reason for purchasing a batch of 10 is that purchasing 3 individual ones would cost $375...)
  • $25 for the barcode for the paperback edition.
  • $320 of this campaign will go to the audiobook production.
  • $65 for copyright registration.
  • Any additional funds raised will go toward getting my book into libraries. I'm estimating that my cost per book will be about $8, and I have ten libraries in my general area on my list ($80). But I'd be thrilled to be able to expand beyond my immediate area and donate copies to libraries further afield. Not everyone can afford to buy their own copies of books, and libraries are a way to make The War in Our Hearts accessible to everyone.

 

If You Can't Donate:

  • Share this campaign on social media! The more it's shared, the more likely Eva will be to succeed in meeting her goals!
  • Ask your library to consider purchasing The War in Our Hearts, as a paperback, as audio, as ebook, or all three!
