story:
Ex marine Zimmery Mac returns home; just in time before the season of winter arrives. He reunites with his wife, his two teenage sons and his little daughter Lane. But things go horribly wrong when Lane turns up missing. Zimmery now must embark on a epic journey to find her. But during the season of winter, the snow comes to life and devours any human that disturbs it. Zimmery must watch his step and watch his back in this exciting but bone chilling novel.

That is the synopsis of the story. As a first time author, I'm looking to self publish and promote my novel through Indiegogo. The Winter Series is a three part saga, with six books in total. 

Part One: Winter

Part Two: Winter February: Vol 1-2

Part Three: Winter March: Vol 1-3

The first draft to all six books are complete. And my editor is close to finishing part one. My goal is to raise enough money not only to promote part one, but to finish editing part two and three, and use the funds to edited those books as well. They're very long, ranging from ninety thousand to two hundred thousand words, for each book. 

The Mission

My goal is to tell stories that revolve around ordinary people, living in extraordinary worlds, and "Winter" is the first book out of a finite number of stories that will illustrate that. I have a head start on many of my stories and the extra funds you contribute to this book will be used to edit and promote those projects. As an new and independent author, I understand how important it is to keep your readers close, not just to the story, but through the entire process. A author is nothing without a reader, just as a provider is nothing without a consumer. That is my philosophy. You don't need me. I need you.

That is why I decided to self publish my stories because even with a publisher, a book is still nothing without the readers. You decide the fate of my story, my future and the future of every author and story out there. Some authors forget that, I won't. I will gladly take any constructive criticism and suggestions you may have for me.

 All I ask for is one chance, one chance to prove myself to you, the readers. I can be the author who gives you the stories you want to read.

On December 20th, the novel will go live on Amazon Kindle, Paperback and I-books. It will be made available for you for free to download. You must have an account with Amazon or Apple to download and a account with Amazon, I-books and or Comixology to redeem your books or comics.

Contact me: officalranreece.com

Thank you,

Reece Ran: Real World, Real Fiction

story:
Hello, there! My name is Ariel and I am a nerd. No, this is not a confession. Anyone who knows/has seen me on the Internet knows that I am very proud of my nerdiness. I even blog, tweet, tumbl, and sing regularly about just how much of a nerd I am. What you may not know, is that in addition to writing blogs, songs, and tweets, I am also a poet. In my upcoming short chapbook called NERD!VERSE, I endeavor to combine my love for verse with my love for all things nerdy. 

Here are some nerdy topics I address in NERD!VERSE:

  • Reading
  • Writing
  • Classic literature
  • Fandoms (Harry Potter, Hunger Games, Doctor Who, and more!)
Because I will be printing this book, instead of publishing it, I am trying to raise at least $600 dollars to pay for both printing and shipping costs. To help convince you to assist me monetarily, I have listed some fun perks over there -->.

If you cannot contribute, please share my campaign with your friends! Every little bit helps! 


STRETCH GOAL - $750 - If I hit $750, I will hire the brilliant Jennifer Drucker to design my cover! Help me give work to a fellow nerd and artist!

story:
Who am I?

Hi, I am Annemiek Steur, I am 18 years old, I am Dutch and I am a published fantasy author.

When I was 15 years old I realised my big dream, by publishing my first book Vitya Malonti in Dutch. I love fantasy and I love writing and my current big dream is to have my two books published in English.


Why?

I realize that my generation of teenagers and young adults are growing up in a world of endless opportunities. That is why I intend to live my life to the fullest and to fulfill my greatest potential. I believe that everyone deserves the chance to escape reality for a while, and enter the world of fantasy whenever they wish. This is why I publish my books, inviting you to enter the fantasy world of Jonas Dubelaar, the 11 year old boy who is the main character in my book series.

More importantly, I truly hope to inspire and empower many other children and youngsters to go after their dreams, to never give up and, in turn, to inspire their next generation.


My milestones

At the age of 10, I started writing stories for my little brother and sister, to entertain them during long car trips. When I was thirteen I first started the idea of writing a real book and turning fantasy writing into my passion. In 2011, when I was just 15, I went to the Business Bootcamp and met Nisandeh Neta. This is change my life, made me set up my own fantasy business and this video shows what happened when I presented Nisandeh Neta with my first published book.



Why do I need your help?

To have a bigger impact and to be able to inspire other children and teenagers to chase their biggest dreams, is my reason for starting this campaign.  I cannot do this by myself, so I really need your help.

You can help me make more impact by supporting me in producing and publishing my books in English. Help me to reach, please and enchant all those millions of English fantasy readers, who I will never be able to reach with my books in Dutch.


How can you help?

By contributing to this campaign you become my fantasy partner in sharing my stories and inspiring others. To thank you I created six special fantasy gifts for you. You can choose the one that you like the most.


Special Fantasy Gifts - PERKS

Each choice of contribution comes with a special fantasy gift. Ranging from a single story to audio files, two published books (in Dutch or in English), or even a personalised story with you as one of the characters (which I would love to write for many of you!)


Let’s inspire and empower teenagers together!

Together we can help, inspire and empower the current and future generations of teenagers chase their dreams and make this world a better place. Yes, we can! Thank you for believing in my generation, for spreading the word and for making this happen!

May the dragons give you courage
Annemiek Steur

story:
The Project

Hello all! My name is Bill Petrosky, a mid-twenty something regular joe from Pittsburgh, PA, who happens to be writing his very own book. The book is set to be released in the spring of 2016...with your help that is! I've wanted to undertake a project like this for quite some time and I believe it's something I can easily accomplish with your support.

There is no "hard" deadline on the book's release but I have a personal deadline of May 1st being the first week the book is available everywhere. I don't want you guys waiting forever on the release.

Allow me to tell you a little about what I hope to accomplish with "Wet Cement: The Journey of a Finite Heart" so you can have a better understanding of the project. Why support a book you don't like or don't know much about, right?

With this book I hope to accomplish the following things:

  • Provide a personal testimonial of my heart's own journey in the world of love & relationships. You'll get to know me better and maybe we will relate!
  • Answering the questions teens, young adults and grown adults alike share, such as "how do we end up in certain relationships?" or "why me?"
  • Connect scholarly references to the content concerning the psychology of love & relationships. Let us further explore the studies behind these topics to provide them with a little more merit. 
  • Interviews/external sources from others about their experiences.
  • Provide a comprehensive self-help guide to understanding your choices—thus promoting better stronger relationship decisions in the future. Hopefully you learn something.

If this is something that interests you, or more importantly, something you might want to be a part of then please continue reading.

What I Need & What You Get

How I arrived at $1600.00 USD for the goal:

  • My cat spilled a glass of water on my Macbook Pro during the process of writing the book. You can imagine how costly it will be to replace one of those. No? About $1300, plus a sled to transfer book material from the old hard drive onto the new machine.
  • I am self-publishing the book and the cost of production will easily total up to about $500 up front, maybe even $650 depending on demand. This does not include sellers fees, credits, shipping costs etc. 
  • Additional media promotion costs including audio recording and additional photography. Roughly $300-$500.
  • Pumping out a full length book is like a second full time job. It takes hundreds of man hours and even if it were a minimum wage job it would pay, well, something. By monetarily contributing to the project you will receive my work and my sincere gratitude as repayment.
As you can see I'm asking for less than what I really need up front. I already have about $300 rolled into this project as well as dozens of hours laboring over it. And you know, I'm confident I will be spending much more of both my money and my time over the next 45 days. With your help we can make this a real life thing though guys.

Also, I've found most writing projects listed on crowd funding project sites average about a 30%-40% higher fund total than my ask here. This is merely what I need to keep the ship afloat—nothing more, nothing less.

All donors receive a copy of the book in either digital or physical form+tons of other rewards. Please see list of perks for complete details. Don't forget to claim your perk for donations $10.00 USD and above.

The Impact

By donating to this campaign you are making me actualize my true dreams and that is quite a surreal experience. For that you will have my eternal gratitude. You know, one way or another I'll find a way to this goal. But! I think it would be fantastic if we all did it together. 

I really think this project is going to be something incredible and I am really excited to have you all become a part of it with me. Let us all prepare for a wild and exciting ride, the journey of a finite heart.

Enjoy!

-BP

story:
UPDATE 8/9: Letters to Congress

For every donation received from now until the end of the campaign, Poetic Matrix Press will send a postcard/letter to a US lawmaker on behalf of the donor, expressing support for refugee children and a demand for their humane treatment and acceptance.

We believe poets are not only artists, but important voices in the debates and politics of the world. BORDERLESS BUTTERFLIES / MARIPOSAS SIN FRONTERAS is a beautiful work of art, but the poet and the press also have a commitment to building a more humane world.

Now is a chance to let us amplify your voice. Donations which include an address will have a postcard sent to the representative from that district. Those without addresses will be sent to the President and Congressional leadership. Additional donations will be sent to senators of border states and then beyond. If we build enough momentum, we may also telephone the representatives on your behalf. Stay involved!

Please, donate now, and support a wonderful book of poetry, while we will help spread our joint message of acceptance, humanity, and a world without borders.


SAGUAROS

en Mesa, Arizona
los saguaros apuntando

al cielo del desierto
le dicen a todos:

“abran los brazos,
extiendan las manos;

no se vuelvan duros
puños sin corazón”

8 de noviembre de 2011
SAGUAROS

in Mesa, Arizona
saguaros pointing

to the desert sky
tell all around:

“open your arms,
extend your hands

don’t become some
hard heartless fists”

November 8, 2011












A Poet Without Borders


The current crisis of unaccompanied child refugees from Central America is part of a familiar history – the continual unwillingness of people of the Americas to stay within and behind the borders drawn between them. The upcoming title from Poetic Matrix Press, Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras, is a book of poems for the earth and the people, crafted by a poet at the peak of his power. It speaks to the porousness of our boundaries, and the futility of all attempts to separate people and regions so intimately intertwined.

Francisco X. Alarcón is a man who, like the monarch butterfly he eulogizes, lives in and migrates between many worlds. From Los Angeles to Guadalajara, from the Mission barrio in San Francisco to Stanford and UC Davis, Francisco has lived fully immersed in the diverse cultural landscape of California and Mexico. Part of a small but remarkable group of gay Chicano poets, his language is lean and brief; his poems puncture the skin and pierce the heart.

This is a work of rare beauty and intelligence. Through tierra, fuego, agua, and aire Francisco takes us on a journey into our own psyche and through the concerns of our world – immigration and identity, the fragility and strength of our natural environment, the many faces of love, and the politics of a world in great need of illumination. Through everything he gives voice to our own unspoken feelings, and does so with delicate yet powerful language. These poems are a constant source of wisdom and grace.


A Campaign of Many Voices


Why is an award-winning poet with a Stanford MA and unimpeachable credentials publishing with a small press, and using IndieGoGo to fund production? While many publishing houses would happily produce his new manuscript, Francisco chose Poetic Matrix Press – a small, independent press with roots in the Sierra Nevada and the Central Valley. We have always published books that reflect the diverse voices of California and beyond, and which help bring the full richness of life into focus. The advent of crowdfunding platforms has allowed us to go a step further – we can directly address the people of our community and society to help spread their voices through our books.


Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras is a book of poetry, but it is also a declaration of unity with the earth – and with all the varied cultures, languages, and beliefs that interweave to create the unimaginable vastness of our lives. It arose out of poems written for Poets Responding to SB 1070, a Facebook community started by Francisco which stands in opposition to a racist, dehumanizing law in Arizona aimed at undocumented migrants. Now every day thousands of people share poetry, videos, and articles of resistance.

 We would like to invite you to add your voice by donating to our campaign and sharing these poems with your friends and family – on Facebook, over email, on the phone, wherever.  Ask them to join you in helping us publish a poetic vision of a world without borders. This book cannot be produced without the direct support of you, our friends and community. Join us to celebrate the monarch butterfly, the desert, the children of Guatemala and El Salvador, and our shared, indivisible humanity. We need your help.


Directly from the Poet


Supporters who donate to produce this book will be thanked by name in the final book, and also on the book's page on our website. We are also offering a small number of very special perks to our donors at various levels.

  • A $5 donation comes with our thanks, online and in print. We truly appreciate donations at any level.
  • For support of $15 you will receive an e-book of Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras in .pdf format, suitable for Kindle, iPad, and other tablets. This will be available as soon as the manuscript is fully laid out, edited, and proofed.
  • At $25 you will receive one of the first printed copies of Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras delivered to you directly. We estimate a shipping date somewhere in mid-autumn of 2014.
  • With $40 of support your copy of the book will be signed, dated, and numbered by Francisco himself. This is an opportunity to own one of only a handful of special campaign-designated copies.
  • A donation of $50 gets you an early-access e-book as well as a signed copy of Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras.
  • We are offering something very special for a $100 donation. You may choose one of the 4 haikus below (which open each of the 4 sections of the book) to be handwritten by Francisco on fine art paper, dated, and signed. You will also receive everything at the $50 level of support. This is a rare opportunity to receive a unique and very personal piece of art directly from the poet himself. Only 10 of each poem available!
  • Finally, if you are able to support us with a gift of $400 you will receive all four of the poems below, as well as the haiku Francisco is using to close his manuscript. This omnibus perk also includes everything at the $50 level, and will make for a wonderful vignette to display at home or at work. Only 5 are available.

I  Tierra / Earth


poemas y mariposas
con alas sobrevuelan
cualquier frontera
poems and butterflies
have wings to fly over any
border and divide





II Fuego / Fire


batiendo oscuras
piedras-palabras poetas
dan fuego-poesía
striking dark
word-stones poets
draw fire-poetry






III  Agua / Water


gotas en nubes
de la mano se dejan
caer como lluvia
droplets in clouds
join hands and let go
falling as rain





IV  Aire / Air


el aleteo
de mariposas puede
causar un huracán

the wing flapping
of butterflies can cause
a hurricane






A Press For Poets


Poetic Matrix Press was founded in 1997 in the high mountain beauty of Yosemite National Park. Originally a periodic poetry newsletter, we began publishing full-length volumes of poetry in 2003. We take pride in publishing books by poets with something to say and the skill to say it well. Most of our authors live in California, but we've published poets from all over America and the world. Several of our titles have won the San Diego Book Award for poetry, most recently KOHL & CHALK, by Shadab Zeest Hashmi.

We take advantage of our small size and independence to support daring poets and exciting, surprising manuscripts. Francisco X. Alarcón is a very welcome addition to our community of writers.

If poets and lovers of poetry don't write, publish, read, and purchase poetry books then we will have no say in the quality of our contemporary culture and no excuse for the abuses of language, ideas, truth, beauty, and love in our cultural life.


Fundraising Details


Our fundraising goal of $5000 will pay for all aspects of publication, from campaign setup, design costs, print costs, and new release marketing. The cost breakdown below is rough, but a reasonable estimate.

  • 27% will go towards the design, editing, and proofing of the manuscript
  • 30% will be used to print the first run of books
  • 20% will be used for distribution, marketing, and prize contest submission in support of the book during the first year after publication
  • 23% IndieGoGo fees, campaign setup costs, and perk fulfillment


Thanks and credits


Thanks are first off due to James Downs, who introduced us to Francisco and made this whole campaign possible. Without James's support through the years and his uncanny knack for meeting amazing poets there would be no Poetix Matrix Press today.

Thanks also to Manuela Vargas Fernández for her work shooting and producing our delightful video material. Thanks to Kiirsti Peterson for help with recording and promotion

Thanks to Francisco for sharing his manuscript, his home, and his enthusiasm for our project. Thanks to Javier for the hospitality and laughs.


And thank you for your donations.


- John Peterson, publisher
- Devon Peterson, campaign lead

UPDATE 8/9: Letters to Congress
For every donation received from now until the end of the campaign, Poetic Matrix Press will send a postcard/letter to a US lawmaker on behalf of the donor, expressing support for refugee children and a demand for their humane treatment and acceptance.We believe poets are not only artists, but important voices in the debates and politics of the world. BORDERLESS BUTTERFLIES / MARIPOSAS SIN FRONTERAS is a beautiful work of art, but the poet and the press also have a commitment to building a more humane world.Now is a chance to let us amplify your voice. Donations which include an address will have a postcard sent to the representative from that district. Those without addresses will be sent to the President and Congressional leadership. Additional donations will be sent to senators of border states and then beyond. If we build enough momentum, we may also telephone the representatives on your behalf. Stay involved!Please, donate now, and support a wonderful book of poetry, while we will help spread our joint message of acceptance, humanity, and a world without borders.




SAGUAROS
     en Mesa, Arizona
los saguaros apuntando
al cielo del desierto
le dicen a todos:
“abran los brazos,
extiendan las manos;
no se vuelvan duros
puños sin corazón”8 de noviembre de 2011


SAGUAROS
in Mesa, Arizona
saguaros pointing
to the desert sky
tell all around:
“open your arms,
extend your hands
don’t become some
hard heartless fists”

November 8, 2011




A Poet Without Borders
The current crisis of unaccompanied child refugees from Central America is part of a familiar history – the continual unwillingness of people of the Americas to stay within and behind the borders drawn between them. The upcoming title from Poetic Matrix Press, Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras, is a book of poems for the earth and the people, crafted by a poet at the peak of his power. It speaks to the porousness of our boundaries, and the futility of all attempts to separate people and regions so intimately intertwined. Francisco X. Alarcón is a man who, like the monarch butterfly he eulogizes, lives in and migrates between many worlds. From Los Angeles to Guadalajara, from the Mission barrio in San Francisco to Stanford and UC Davis, Francisco has lived fully immersed in the diverse cultural landscape of California and Mexico. Part of a small but remarkable group of gay Chicano poets, his language is lean and brief; his poems puncture the skin and pierce the heart.This is a work of rare beauty and intelligence. Through tierra, fuego, agua, and aire Francisco takes us on a journey into our own psyche and through the concerns of our world –  immigration and identity, the fragility and strength of our natural environment, the many faces of love, and the politics of a world in great need of illumination. Through everything he gives voice to our own unspoken feelings, and does so with delicate yet powerful language. These poems are a constant source of wisdom and grace.

A Campaign of Many Voices

Why is an award-winning poet with a Stanford MA and unimpeachable credentials publishing with a small press, and using IndieGoGo to fund production? While many publishing houses would happily produce his new manuscript, Francisco chose Poetic Matrix Press – a small, independent press with roots in the Sierra Nevada and the Central Valley. We have always published books that reflect the diverse voices of California and beyond, and which help bring the full richness of life into focus. The advent of crowdfunding platforms has allowed us to go a step further – we can directly address the people of our community and society to help spread their voices through our books. Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras is a book of poetry, but it is also a declaration of unity with the earth – and with all the varied cultures, languages, and beliefs that interweave to create the unimaginable vastness of our lives. It arose out of poems written for Poets Responding to SB 1070, a Facebook community started by Francisco which stands in opposition to a racist, dehumanizing law in Arizona aimed at undocumented migrants. Now every day thousands of people share poetry, videos, and articles of resistance. We would like to invite you to add your voice by donating to our campaign and sharing these poems with your friends and family – on Facebook, over email, on the phone, wherever.  Ask them to join you in helping us publish a poetic vision of a world without borders. This book cannot be produced without the direct support of you, our friends and community. Join us to celebrate the monarch butterfly, the desert, the children of Guatemala and El Salvador, and our shared, indivisible humanity. We need your help.Directly from the PoetSupporters who donate to produce this book will be thanked by name in the final book, and also on the book's page on our website. We are also offering a small number of very special perks to our donors at various levels.
A $5 donation comes with our thanks, online and in print. We truly appreciate donations at any level.

For support of $15 you will receive an e-book of Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras in .pdf format, suitable for Kindle, iPad, and other tablets. This will be available as soon as the manuscript is fully laid out, edited, and proofed. 

At $25 you will receive one of the first printed copies of Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras delivered to you directly. We estimate a shipping date somewhere in mid-autumn of 2014.
With $40 of support your copy of the book will be signed, dated, and numbered by Francisco himself. This is an opportunity to own one of only a handful of special campaign-designated copies.
A donation of $50 gets you an early-access e-book as well as a signed copy of Borderless Butterflies / Mariposas sin fronteras.
We are offering something very special for a $100 donation. You may choose one of the 4 haikus below (which open each of the 4 sections of the book) to be handwritten by Francisco on fine art paper, dated, and signed. You will also receive everything at the $50 level of support. This is a rare opportunity to receive a unique and very personal piece of art directly from the poet himself. Only 10 of each poem available!
Finally, if you are able to support us with a gift of $400 you will receive all four of the poems below, as well as the haiku Francisco is using to close his manuscript. This omnibus perk also includes everything at the $50 level, and will make for a wonderful vignette to display at home or at work. Only 5 are available.

I  Tierra / Earth




poemas y mariposas
con alas sobrevuelan
cualquier frontera 


poems and butterflies
have wings to fly over any
border and divide


II Fuego / Fire




batiendo oscuras
piedras-palabras poetas
dan fuego-poesía


striking dark
word-stones poets
draw fire-poetry


III  Agua / Water



gotas en nubes
de la mano se dejan
caer como lluvia


droplets in clouds
join hands and let go
falling as rain


IV  Aire / Air



el aleteo
de mariposas puede
causar un huracán


the wing flapping
of butterflies can cause
a hurricane



A Press For Poets

(English follows)


Soutenez la prochaine parution de .dpi, le no. 28, sur le thème Cultures genrées sur Internet, qui sera publiée le 7 décembre ! 

À la suite de coupures gouvernementales dans plusieurs domaines dont celui de la culture, la revue .dpi cherche des alternatives afin de financer ses activités, dont les cachets destinés à ses contributeurs-trices. Leur participation fondamentale permet d'assurer la diffusion d'idées nouvelles ainsi qu'une précieuse visibilité de l'art produit par une riche communauté d'artistes.


Support the next edition of .dpi #28, on the theme of Gender(ed) Cultures on the Internet, to be published on December 7.

Because of government funding cuts to arts and culture, our online feminist journal .dpi is seeking alternatives in order to pay our editors, writers and artists who are critical to  ensure the dissemination of new ideas and provide visibility for a rich community of artists.



La revue .dpi est réalisée de manière indépendante par une équipe de bénévoles composée d'une rédactrice en chef, Sophie Le-Phat Ho, et d'un comité de rédaction constitué de Julie Alary Lavallée, Amber Berson, Esther Bourdages, Christina Haralanova, Corina MacDonald, Katja Melzer, Candace Mooers et Deanna Radford.

Le Studio XX, centre d’artistes autogéré et organisme à but non lucratif, héberge et soutient la revue sur le plan technique et administratif depuis sa création en 2004.

La revue .dpi compte 27 numéros publiés à ce jour, à raison de 3 parutions par année, disponibles en ligne gratuitement.


.dpi is an independent project run by a team of passionate volunteers with Sophie Le-Phat Ho as the editor in chief, and an editorial committee consisting of Julie Lavallée Alary, Amber Berson, Esther Bourdages, Christina Haralanova, Corina MacDonald, Katja Melzer, Candace Mooers and Deanna Radford.

Montreal-based Studio XX, a bilingual feminist artist-run centre for technological exploration, creation and critique, has been hosting and providing technical support for the journal since its inception in 2004.

To date, 27 issues of .dpi, at the rate of 3 issues a year, have been published - online and always free.



Pourquoi nous avons besoin de vous ?

Ayant perdu sa principale source de financement gouvernemental au cours de l’été 2013, le comité de rédaction a pris la décision de procéder à une levée de fonds. Cette action temporaire permettra de stabiliser la situation et de poursuivre les activités au programme en l'attente d'un financement récurrent.

Le comité croit en la pertinence et la nécessité d'une telle revue, car elle réunie une riche communauté, à la fois locale et internationale, composée d'artistes féministes et de leurs allié-e-s.

Le comité de rédaction et le Studio XX ont pour objectif d’amasser 8000$ d’ici juin 2014 à travers différentes activités et démarches, dont cette campagne.


Why do we need your support?

After losing its main source of government funding in 2013, the .dpi committee needs to raise funds so that we can keep publishing this essential feminist journal, while at the same time trying to establish long term assistance.

We profoundly believe in the relevance and necessity of this journal because it provides a platform that bridges local and international feminists, activists, writers and artists.

We want to raise $8000 between now and June 2014 using a number of different strategies, including this one.



À quoi serviront les contributions ?

Les contributions à cette campagne serviront à financer la prochaine édition de .dpi, le no. 28, qui sera publiée en novembre.

Dans le cadre du dossier no. 28, intitulé Cultures genrées sur Internet, .dpi examine Internet en tant que site hétérogène permettant la délibération et la mise au défi d’idéaux de genre. Coordonnatrice de dossier invitée : l'artiste Jennifer Chan

Les contributions serviront à payer des cachets :

  • rédacteur-rice invité-e : 300$
  • traducteur-e : 150$
  • coordonnateur-rice de blogue : 150$
  • auteur-e-s et artistes : 1400$

Pour un total de 2000$.

Les frais d’hébergement, de mise en ligne et de  développement Web sont assurés par le Studio XX.


Where the funds go ?

Contributions to this campaign will finance .dpi 28, Gender(ed) Cultures on the Internet,  which looks at the internet as a heterogenous space that allows for the deliberation and challenging of gender ideals. Due to be published in November, artist Jennifer Chan is the guest editor.

The contributions will go directly to pay honorariums for:

  • guest editor: 300$
  • translator: 150$
  • blog coordinator: 150$
  • writers and artists: 1400$

For a total of $2000.

Hosting, uploading and web development provided by Studio XX.

Your Perks / Merci !

LIQUIDATION : Party Lunch .dpi 28

story:
The third draft for my debut contemporary romance Will They? has been completed and beta readers have done all they can. Now it's up to me to raise funds for professional editing, formatting and cover design.

A Little On The Story

A pendant, left to Jennifer in her aunt's will, finally gives up quite the secret. One that has her up and leaving work for a holiday with little notice, flying across the Pacific to see an old friend. She is no longer safe behind her keyboard, coming face to face with the man she has flirted shamelessly with online for the past two years. She meets his subtle advances with retreats that only fan his desire for her in to flames. Will they give in to temptation or keep the friendship they value safe from the potential dangers a physical relationship might bring?

The Manuscript

I've spent nine months writing, revising and polishing this manuscript. Reviews from beta readers have been favourable, especially where the sexual tension is concerned. I'm a fan of the slow build up to the nail-biting extremes where you're aching for the lead characters to get together, as tormented as they are when obstacles present themselves, throwing spanners willy-nilly in to the works.
 
Writing has been a passion of mine since I can remember. Now, after experiencing enough of life and love I'm ready to pursue my dream of writing for a living.

Romance novels allow us to fall in love over and over again, something I enjoy creating very much. To capture those anxious moments leading up to the first kiss, the first touch and the scorching scenes that follow is what I yearn to do most!

Needs & Perks

Currently, the manuscript stands at 97,000 words. I envision the final edit I'm raising funds for will bring the count to sit around 85,000. Professional editing is the top priority now for my debut romance novel. I want to release the best product possible for my readers, one that will set a quality standard for future releases, including a standalone sequel focusing on a secondary character who was just too hot not to write about. This sequel, titled Redemption, is now in the second draft stage which I plan to release just before Christmas.

All up, with professional editing, formatting and cover design I'm looking at $900, not including advertising/marketing. Releasing a sub-standard product is something I wouldn't do and so I'm hoping fellow romance lovers will chip in to get me started in the world of publishing. Any excess fundsraised will be used to offset the costs of editing the sequel.

As a thanks to those who donate, there are several perks to choose from:

Perk #1
A personal email to thank you for chipping in plus a follow/shout out on Twitter.
 
Perk #2
An ebook version of the finished product, formatted for your e-reader, along with a thank you email and follow/shout out on Twitter.
 
Perk #3
Fellow romance authors: Choose your best novel to be featured at the end of Will They? I'll devote a page featuring your cover, blurb and direct purchase link. Also, a post on your chosen featured novel on my blog, an ebook copy of Will They and a thank you email plus a follow/shout out on Twitter.

Perk #4
Special edition ebook version, featuring saucy yet tasteful shots of the men from Will They? And a thank you email and follow/shout out on Twitter of course!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Romance lovers, please share this campaign around and feel free to get in contact with me via my website: http://jademiddleton.com
 
I'm also on:
 
Twitter
Facebook
Kiva

story:
Larissa Horlis-Horsky

This project is a tribute to the memory of my father Yuri Horlis-Horsky, who wrote the beautiful novel Cold Canyon about the Ukrainian Kozaks defending their country from the enemy in the year 1920.

When I was 2 days old my father disappeared.  We were living in a refugee camp in Germany after the war in 1946. Apparently he was murdered for his beliefs.

Cold Canyon was published in 1934 in Ukraine and became an instant best seller.  When the Soviets occupied Ukraine after WWII, the book was banned.  A special agent was assigned to hunt down copies. and anyone found with the book was arrested, to be shot or sent to Siberia.

After Ukraine became independent in 1991, the book resurfaced.  The new generation of Ukrainians were amazed to read about a part of their history they knew nothing about.  The book became a best seller again.

Cold Canyon (Kholodniy Yar) is written in Ukrainian.  A whole segment of the population is missing out on reading this important classic. It is not only a story of war, it is also a tragic love story.  Although written as a novel, the characters and events are real.

Millions of Ukrainians emigrated to all parts of the English speaking world. My daughters and I would like to have the book translated into English for the benefit of those of Ukrainian heritage and others.

Funds are necessary to pay the translator and publication costs.  We have found a translator and an editor in Ukraine who is willing to publish in English.  We have already translated the first chapter.  Here is an excerpt:

                                                  Chapter One

During the February 1920 partisan march, our cavalry unit of the Ukrainian National Army fought its way through the Bolshevik fronts and crossed into the town of Chehrin.

The sprawling landscape of the barren steppes give way to large forests, amid which are scattered small villages.

Our group passes the seemingly endless Black Forest. 

The neat white thatched houses surrounded by orchards create a pleasant impression.

We are met with lovely dark eyed women wearing corsets and coral beads.  The men wear home spun tunics.  They are of classic Ukrainian type.

During our stay in one of the villages the farmers tell us of the unapproachable Motrin Monastery.  Chief Ataman Chuchupaka has settled there, and he is not afraid of anyone, especially the Bolsheviks.

We glance at each other.  Wouldn't it be interesting to see this fortress?  We argue amongst ourselves whether we should go to Cold Canyon, or pass it by.....

During our stay in one of the villages the farmers tell us of the unapproachable Motrin Monastery.  Chief Ataman Chuchupaka has settled there, and he is not afraid of anyone, especially the Bolsheviks.
We glance at each other.  Wouldn't it be interesting to see this fortress?  We argue amongst ourselves whether we should go to Cold Canyon, or pass it by.....

story:
Long story short

I started writing Pho for Three, a memoir of our adventures, soon after we returned from our first trip to Vietnam in 2007. I was slightly misguided on why we should be going and how much money it might actually require, but on Christmas 2006 we said goodbye to family and took off for Southeast Asia with $13 in my pocket and no return tickets.

We left and didn't look back, spending two months volunteering in Tam Ky. We met children whose disabilities exiled them from their families, others who'd lost their fathers in the all-too-frequent typhoons, and some with single mothers who could not keep them.I learned to love the orphans more than I would have thought possible. I learned, too, just how much I love my own children.

We went on to live in a hotel in Hanoi while I searched for work and at the last possible moment, found work teaching Engish in Thanh Hoa. Over the seven months in Vietnam, everything I'd ever thought, believed and expected completely changed and our lives haven't been the same since.

READ A SNIPPET FROM OUR STORY HERE 


The Big Idea

What kicked off this idea to do a crowdfunding campaign was the need to get my book finished, edited and published. I'm on the second revision now and have lined up editing with two capable editors (one a developmental editor, the other is a copyeditor).

I work with a kick-ass writers group and they've helped me through more drafts than I'd like to admit. But through it all, they and the friends around me have supported this book project and encourage me to share our story of single parenting, traveling abroad and the dilemma of orphanages and international adoptions. I'm finally getting around to making it happen.

It's more than just my book, it's about people I love

There is no way I could do this if I didn't have a bigger reason--the people I love in Vietnam.

We will be donating 10% to each of two causes that are incredibly dear to me. The first is the Children of Vietnam, a non-profit based in South Carolina, USA. They are the organization who provides formula and supplies for the orphanages we worked with in Tam Ky. It was through their efforts that the physically disabled kids got medical care and that the babies were fed well. You can donate directly through their website or via this campaign.

The other is Mrs. Hanh's dream to open a restaurant, something I cannot be more proud of. Mrs. Hanh was our lovely cook in Tam Ky and she has served up the best Vietnamese and fusion dishes to hundreds of GVN volunteers over the years. I love this woman and want to do whatever I can to help her acheive her goal. She is currently at about $20k of her $50k goal and the building of her restaurant has started.

These two projects that will be simultaneously funded through this campaign.

But wait, there's more!

If you know me, you know I can't seem to sit still for more than a few minutes and while I'm busily writing and sewing perks for you guys (yes, really) I'm also figuring out other ways to help out there and spread the word about the help that is needed.

I'm organizing a sew-along to make clothes for the kids there, and hoping that somehow we can raise the funds to not just mail the clothes through DHL, but to deliver them in person once again. It would be our fourth return trip to the orphanages and this time we've recruited help with the videography and photography. If (and I know it's a big if) we can make it happen, we'll tag along with Children of Vietnam to deliver the goods and return to make a short documentary focusing on the effects of closing Vietnam to international adoptions by most coutries in the world. [Soon after we returned to the States in late 2007, Vietnamese adoptions were shut down for all but a few countries.]

Many of the orphans that were there with us in 2007 and when we returned to Vietnam in 2009 are still in the orphanages today.

There are benefits for you, as well!

Not only do you get that lovely I-did-something-good-today feeling, you will get a little bit of Vietnam with all the perks. Just some of the things we'll be giving you in return:

  • no surprise here--a copy of my book, Pho for Three, available in ebook and print. I'll even sign it if you want me to. 
  • a copy of Audrey's book, "A Trip to the Market" that she wrote and illustrated, translated by Man and Ha, former students.
  • handmade thank-you cards
  • a limited-edition handbound Pho for Three cookbook with 15+ Vietnamese recipes that I learned and loved while living there.
  • one of four mini-quilts featuring scenes of Vietnam.
  • recycled rice bag totes 
  • a dinner made by me for you
  • and for you high rollers, a chance to come with us to Vietnam.

Don't want the book but still wanna help? 

So, maybe you're not into memoirs. Or you just don't care about the big story. I totally get it and can't take offense that you still want to help out our little buddies in Vietnam. Here are a few ways:

  • Head over to our website at phoforthree.com and donate via Paypal.
  • Spread the word about our campaign on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Buy either book through our site.
  • Donate directly to Children of Vietnam through their site.
  • Or specifically for Mrs. Hanh's project (be sure to leave a comment to tell us what you want the money to go to!)

story:
I am partnered with Indiegogo's International Women's Day because I am a woman entrepreneur and there is so much more to having the fairy tale than being a princess. (But that's fun, too.)

Once upon a time,

when people were weary of the outdated social ideals portrayed in fairy tales but not quite ready to give up on magic and wonder, I had other plans.

  • My name is Rose Jermusyk and I am in the business of Wonder Tales, fairy tales for today, fairy tales without the lame-ism.
  • I'm looking to raise $8000 so I can jump into my new business full-time making free storytelling videos and selling their related story quilts/cloth books on Etsy (with 50% of profits being donated to First Book).
  • That's 26 Wonder Tales videos online and free for all to enjoy; an Etsy shop full of story quilts and cloth books so folks can take a piece of the story with them wherever they go; and, being able to support an organization that gets books into the hands of children who have never had a book of their own before.

A journey does not begin with a single step, but with knowing where you stand. 

This chart was up-to-date March 5th. I have since come up with many more seeds.

The Call To Adventure

Everybody needs a little help sometimes, even those freakishly perfect heroes in fairy tales.

  • The funding provided will afford me the time and resources necessary to getting the stories written, props made, and storytelling videos completed while things are still just getting started over in the Etsy shop.
  • For perks there are exclusive first looks at the first 26 Wonder Tales, plus early-runs of Waltzing Mathilde the dance-along doll AND the poppets from the teaser videos for The Question & The Answer and The Lion in Love. These poppets will never be made again! 
  • Without the funds to jump into this full-time, I can only start with 10% of profits being donated with the rest of profits going to trying to grow the shop while only actually being able to devote odd hours. Happy to do it, but it would take for. ev. er. to get any new stories up online.

The Ultimate Boon

When fairy tales aren't being bogged down by outdated social values, they teach us the importance of intelligence, kindness, and hard work; telling us these three core values can bring good into our lives and those around us.

  • Wonder Tales keep these core values as well as the magic we all know and love while providing children other lessons in navigating the world around them today.
  • I've spent a little over a decade working as a babysitter/nanny, often coming up with little stories and songs to calm a child or keep them engaged in an activity.
  • Hans Christian Anderson wrote: Life is the very best fairy tale of all because one is always in it oneself. How many heroes have we tried to model ourselves after? What stories have we wished would unfold in our own lives?

Wonder Tales may be of my own making, but with this project you are just as much a part of the story as I am.

Traveling Companions, ALL

With Wonder Tales it's All for Stories & Stories for All. Can't contribute funds? Contribute friends!

  • Log in to IndieGoGo with an account or Facebook and use the tools in the Share box to get in touch with everyone you can.

Let's have a happily ever out there, shall we?

story:
Destructive Battles Rage Between Hellish Kaiju and Giant Mech Protectors

A desperate father must rescue his son when a deadly kaiju rampages across his city.

When opportunists lurk and buildings crumble around him, the battle might be the least of his worries.  Each minute means more destruction, and the clock is ticking.

The first in a new kaiju series where the ordinary collides with the oversized, Collateral Damage is based on a short story of the same title originally published in Broadswords & Blasters Magazine.  Experience the first taste of this series with a punch to the gut.  Mind the shadows -- you could be crushed.

What We Need & What You Get

Being an indie author, the costs associated with producing a quality work of fiction such as this is my responsibility.  Collateral Damage currently stands at around 57,000 words prior to professional editing.  Any part of the $500 goal shall be used for professional expenses, such as editing and cover art.  The professional editor has worked on a wide range of successful novels and is an award winning novelist as well.

Each Pledger will receive a digital copy of the book, with progressive perks available.  Digital copies will be mailed out prior to it being published.  Special Perks unlock when stretch goals are met.  Those that pledge in the beginning also have some input into future events in the series:

30% Funded ($150) - Current Pledgers help name a Star Force pilot for the series
60% Funded ($300) - Current Pledgers help create a kaiju for the second novel, Ground Zero

See What People Are Saying About the Short Story

Before the transformation to a high-octane novel, Collateral Damage started as a 3,000 word scramble to safety in the Summer 2018 Issue of Broadswords & Blasters Magazine:

"Reversing the old trope of giant robots and monsters tearing apart a city, we have a  jarring narrative told with as much frenetic energy as Cloverfield. The intimate connection of father and son is front and center throughout this thrilling story. You can’t put this one down and Furman does everything he can to ensure it’s not a simple paint by numbers short of search and rescue."
-Pyles of Books, Alexander Pyles, May 2019

"Both Editors read the story multiple times...and every.  single.  time.  BAM!  Right in the feels."
-Broadswords & Blasters, July 2018

"Some of my favorites in this issue include...the man on the streets view of a kaiju/mecha showdown of 'Collateral Damage'...5 star entertainment to be sure."
-Amazon Review, Anthony P., June 2019

Stretch Goals

We are just getting started.  I wasn't kidding about taking the ordinary to the oversized, the mundane to the massive.  The entire series will be funded through the following stretch goals, complete with diverse and unique perks progressively unlocked:

$1,250 Ground Zero Fully Funded
    Digital Copy of Ground Zero to All Supporters
    Ground Zero Hidden Perks Unlocked

$2,000 Exclusion Zone Fully Funded
    Digital Copy of Exclusion Zone to All Supporters
    Exclusion Zone Hidden Perks Unlocked

$3,000 State of Emergency Fully Funded
    Digital Copy of State of Emergency to All Supporters
    State of Emergency Hidden Perks Unlocked

A Short Appetizer

To give you a sense of what the book is about, I am including an unedited excerpt from an early chapter:

I stand from my desk.  I have to blink several times because the white background of my computer terminal burns my eyes.  Or at least it feels like it.  Every so often, I need to take a lap around the office.  I've got a hard time sitting still.  Ever since I was a kid, and it just sticks with me.

A happy blond man waves at me.  “Hey, DeShawn.  How are you doing?”

I muster a smile.  “Good, Dan.  I've just gotta--”  The floor goes out from under me.  My heart pounds, my vision narrows.  I gasp and look down.  The floor is there, unmoved.  “Did you...?”

“I almost...fell,” he says.

“Tremors.”  I glance around.  Everyone's glued to their computers.

“What?  What'd you say?” Dan asks me.  He's starting to look worried.

I clear my throat.  “I thought...I thought there were tremors.”

“Star Force engaged!” a shrill voice yells over the cubicles.

Everyone stops typing and a low rumble resounds through the office as people talk over each other.

“You're right, DeShawn,” Dan says.  He points at me and yells for everyone to hear.  “DeShawn called it like five minutes ago.”

“Five seconds,” I mumble.

“Here it is!”  And the visual footage of the fight is projected on our office wall.

A giant multicolored combination mech stands at the outskirts of Jefferson, crouched behind a building.  It's dubbed FRIEND by Star Force and the government.  The combo mech stands opposite of a giant horned monster that looks like a bipedal wildebeest.  About as hairy as one, too.

“Look at that f***in' thing.”

“Good thing we have Star Force.”

“How would we deal with monsters without Star Force?”

“They're really a blessing.”

Dan nudges me.  “Wonder where ALLY is, huh?”

I shrug.  “Probably has to pick up his suit from the dry cleaner.”

Dan doesn't reply and after a few seconds I glance at him.  His eyes are narrowed and brow scrunched to his nose, hatred directed at me.

“What's your problem, dude?”

My eyes go wide.  I didn't expect the retort.  “It's just...a joke.”

Dan points at the screen.  “Look at that monstrosity.  It's not a joke.  Our survival as a human race isn't funny.”

“I didn't mean--”

“Then what did you mean, DeShawn, huh?”

S**t.  “He's probably waiting to surprise the monster.”

Dan looks at me for another few seconds before his face relaxes.  “Yeah, ALLY does that some times.”  He chuckles.  “I remember a few years back there was this two-headed f***er that really beat on FRIEND.  They got to a bridge or something and ALLY jumps out of the water, rockets at full burn.  And he just takes his sword and cuts off both heads in one action.”

I nod.  “Yeah, I remember that one.”  It's still one of the most viewed Star Force engagements on the Internet.

“Like...you didn't even see ALLY coming, DeShawn.  It was just a flash of orange and then blood.  Blood everywhere.”

“Yeah, man.  I remember,” I say.  “The people in the nearby Star Shelter drowned from the blood.”

Dan leans back, rubs his chin.  “Oh, yeah.”  He frowns.  “That's when they added water pumps in the Shelters.”

“That's the reason,” I say.  “These things are dangerous.  Good thing we have Star Force.”  I add that last part for good measure.  Patriotism is alive and well.  While it's changed over the years, certain crowds still frown on you if you aren't pro-Star Force, like that's the only legitimate stance.

Dan claps my shoulder.  “Yes.  DeShawn, it's a good thing we have Star Force.  They protect you and me.  And no matter how you feel about me, I'd hate to see you gone.”

His last sentence takes me aback.  I'm not sure if it's because of the vulnerability or the truthfulness of his statement, but it makes me smile.  Especially when I just offended his ultra-Star Force views.

“Thanks, Dan.”  I point back towards my cubicle.  No need to take a lap around the office after I just wasted the time speaking with Dan.  My boss would hate any more dormant activity on my terminal.

I sit down and type, programming the next thing for a customer that might not exist tomorrow, their building and everyone in it obliterated by Star Force and a giant monster.

It's so hard to focus.  Everyone in the office turns to their favorite news station to hear the battle.  They're all pro-Star Force.  They have to be.  Why would Star Force fight for us if we condemned them?

A man reports the battle from a helicopter.  Independent journalists use a drone to record with their voices dubbed over.  A daring woman drives her van as close to the battle, chasing the fight as best she can.  Another reports the aftermath, telling the battle from the past tense as he walks through carnage, debris everywhere and people screaming for help.  One sick news agency reports the battle as an adventurous boxing match between Star Force and the monster.  And I watch as downtown Jefferson is leveled.

Risks & Challenges

I've had several action-packed works accepted in various #NewPulp magazines.  Collateral Damage is my fifth novel that I have written.  The draft is complete and is in the hands of the editor.  The second book is over halfway complete.  I tend to stay ahead of schedule, especially towards those who place their trust in me.  Barring any major unforeseen events, I don't see a problem with fulfilling this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. If you know someone who would love this, let them know.  I routinely do that in my life for works I can't invest in (time or money...usually time).  People are thirsty for punchy, virtuous fiction.  I'd love to hear from you all.  Thank you for your support and all that you do.

“Yeah, man.  I remember,” I say.  “The people in the nearby Star Shelter drowned from the blood.”
Dan leans back, rubs his chin.  “Oh, yeah.”  He frowns.  “That's when they added water pumps in the Shelters.”
“That's the reason,” I say.  “These things are dangerous.  Good thing we have Star Force.”  I add that last part for good measure.  Patriotism is alive and well.  While it's changed over the years, certain crowds still frown on you if you aren't pro-Star Force, like that's the only legitimate stance.
Dan claps my shoulder.  “Yes.  DeShawn, it's a good thing we have Star Force.  They protect you and me.  And no matter how you feel about me, I'd hate to see you gone.”
His last sentence takes me aback.  I'm not sure if it's because of the vulnerability or the truthfulness of his statement, but it makes me smile.  Especially when I just offended his ultra-Star Force views.
“Thanks, Dan.”  I point back towards my cubicle.  No need to take a lap around the office after I just wasted the time speaking with Dan.  My boss would hate any more dormant activity on my terminal.
I sit down and type, programming the next thing for a customer that might not exist tomorrow, their building and everyone in it obliterated by Star Force and a giant monster.
It's so hard to focus.  Everyone in the office turns to their favorite news station to hear the battle.  They're all pro-Star Force.  They have to be.  Why would Star Force fight for us if we condemned them?
A man reports the battle from a helicopter.  Independent journalists use a drone to record with their voices dubbed over.  A daring woman drives her van as close to the battle, chasing the fight as best she can.  Another reports the aftermath, telling the battle from the past tense as he walks through carnage, debris everywhere and people screaming for help.  One sick news agency reports the battle as an adventurous boxing match between Star Force and the monster.  And I watch as downtown Jefferson is leveled.
Risks & Challenges

I've had several action-packed works accepted in various #NewPulp magazines.  Collateral Damage is my fifth novel that I have written.  The draft is complete and is in the hands of the editor.  The second book is over halfway complete.  I tend to stay ahead of schedule, especially towards those who place their trust in me.  Barring any major unforeseen events, I don't see a problem with fulfilling this campaign.
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word. If you know someone who would love this, let them know.  I routinely do that in my life for works I can't invest in (time or money...usually time).  People are thirsty for punchy, virtuous fiction.  I'd love to hear from you all.  Thank you for your support and all that you do.

story:
Story of My Book

Spread Your Wings and FLI is a tool-kit for and by first-generation low-income (FLI) college students sharing insights and resources that are imperative to be successful in the world of higher education.

My name is Jessica Ilayalith Mora and I am the author of Spread Your Wings and FLI. I wrote this book because as a first-generation low-income college student myself, I experienced first-hand many of the challenges that come from learning to navigate the collegiate space. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover some of the areas and gaps that first-generation low-income students most struggle with when it comes to navigating collegiate spaces. Whether you are a FLI advisor, professor, faculty member, or a FLI student yourself, I hope this book will shed light on some of the similarities and nuances among the FLI student population. Ultimately, I want this book to show current FLI undergraduates that they are not alone in their college experience and to share tools, insights, and resources to help them make the best out of their undergraduate career.

In this book, you'll learn about networking—what it is, how to start, and how to be successful in the classroom, including how to read a syllabus and build a relationship with your professors. You'll hear stories such as...
  • How Ana McCullough navigated Stanford’s college campus as a first-generation low-income college student to then co-found Questbridge, one of the nations largest network of FLI college students.
  • Dr. Vijay Pendakur and the tools he considers to be most valuable for FLI students, particularly after years of working with minority college students across the country.
  • How Michelle Obama overcame the culture shock and imposter syndrome she felt as a freshman at Princeton University.
You will love this book if you’ve been so focused on getting in to college that you haven’t really considered what you’ll do once you get to campus, if you’re not sure what professors expect of you in college, or if you don’t know how to begin preparing for life after college.

Spread Your Wings and FLI is a nonfiction book that speaks to both FLI students on how to make the best out of their college experience, as well as advisors, professors, and staff members who want to understand the challenges FLI students face in higher education and how they can best help those students navigate through them.
 

The Book -Spread Your Wings and FLI

The book is written in 5 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1-4. In Part 1 you’ll learn about what being a first-generation low-income student means and which students we are leaving behind as we focus on FLI students in college. Through Michelle Obama’s own story as a FLI student, as well as research on the history of predominantly white institutions and diversity and inclusion initiatives, Part 1 sets the foundation and groundwork for the rest of the book.

Part 2 contains chapters 5-7. Part 2 focuses on the “unspoken truths” for being successful during freshman and sophomore years of college. Some of these unspoken truths involve learning to be successful inside a classroom, developing personal relationships with professors and peers, as well as finding a community on campus.

Part 3 contains chapters 8-9. Part 3 emphasizes building and maintain a personal network, particularly as you enter your junior and senior years of college. This section also includes stories from two FLI professionals on how they began finding their professional path during the early years of their college career.

Part 4 contains chapters 10-11. Part 4 is about developing financial literacy skills and social media marketing skills to help set you up for success in the professional world. This section includes a step-by-step process on how to build a budget that works for you, as well as how to use social networks to land professional opportunities. 

Part 5 contains chapters 12-13. In Part 5 you’ll learn how to start planning for life after graduation whether that means going into the workforce or pursuing another degree. This section includes stories from two former FLI students turned FLI professionals and provides insights into how they navigated the transition to adulting as a FLI graduate.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Jessica Ilayalith Mora is a young professional currently working in the marketing and finance space. She is a recent college graduate from The University of Chicago with a major in Public Policy. At UChicago she was heavily involved in the first-generation low-income student community through leadership and mentorship roles.

After writing her BA thesis on how first-generation low-income students experience elite institutions, Jess decided to write this book to build off of her thesis findings and give FLI students the resources they need to be successful in college and prepare for life after their undergraduate experience. She hopes that this book will help FLI students feel less isolated in their undergraduate experience and instead feel empowered to take advantage of the resources available to them.

When she is not writing or journaling, Jess loves to perform. Jess has been involved in theatre since she was eight years old performing in a variety of productions like Alice in Wonderland, Macbeth, as well as Conference of the Birds. She has also been in a circus for seven years doing silks, acrobatics, salsa dancing, and juggling. Outside of the circus, Jess is heavily involved in educational equality. She currently sits on the Alumni Council of High Jump Chicago, an organization aimed at equalizing educational opportunity for middle school students across the Chicago area.

For more information, you can connect with Jessica Ilayalith Mora at Jessica.mora1219@gmail.com and at on Instagram at ilayalith_jess. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SpreadYourWingsAndFLI and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jessica Ilayalith Mora

story:
¿Qué?

Paisaje de Malva es un viaje al pasado para sobrellevar el presente, para comprenderlo, acompañando a dos personajes en su trayectoria vital en común.

Manuel está condenado a una sentencia de olvido. Pronto no recordará su nombre ni su edad. Su única tabla de salvación pasa por continuar escribiendo. De ese ejercicio de supervivencia nace la historia de Malva y Andrés, dos jóvenes llamados a encontrarse en una ciudad de provincias de la España de la transición. Intercalada con su relato, Manuel construye también la memoria de su vida,  una vida que pasa por su participación en la Guerra Civil, su posterior estancia en Tetuán y por un secreto que siempre le acompañará.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Luisa Ruiz Chacón.

La culpa de mi antojo por desgranar palabras la comparten, a partes iguales, la biblioteca de mi padre, una rosa y una mano rozando un cristal; los tres elementos se confabularon en mi infancia para desvelarme que lo que yo creía un mundo real, horrible e injusto podría metamorfosearse en lo que quisiera si sabía usar los vocablos adecuados. Pero hube de hacerlo a salto de mata de una vida que me fue llevando por otros caminos. Entre tanta cabriola, he escrito dos poemarios A vueltas de esquina y Trayectos,  la novela que os presento y  algún que otro relato. Como tengo que alimentarme, trabajo como profesora de Lengua y Literatura castellana en un Instituto de Secundaria en Córdoba, España.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Las palabras, aquellas que nos dijimos cuando oíamos las ráfagas a lo lejos sabiendo que no teníamos nada con que repelerlas. Yo soy de Denia, yo de Cartagena, yo de Valencia.  Pues, buen sitio ese, ¿no? Buenas chavalas, pero serias, ¿eh? Y nos mirábamos a veces con la convicción tácita de que aquello era un error como otro cualquiera y de que ese frío que nos calaba los huesos no era el nuestro sino el de otro que debiera estar allí en nuestro lugar.  Mi lugar estaba en casa, junto a mis hermanas, al calor de Marcela, en la universidad a la que debería haber ido y que se me negó como tantas otras cosas. Y me decía mi padre: ¿y qué harías tú si estuvieras ahora en Madrid, con lo que se ha liado?  Y luego, cuando llegó el maldito papel: acaso, si te hubieras ido... »

«Porque yo creo que si perdí algo de mí mismo en aquellos cuatro años fue la carne que rodeaba mi boca, la membrana turgente y sonrosada que me había acompañado desde que nací. Se fue adelgazando poco a poco sin sentirlo. Cada segundo que pasaba, cada milésima de segundo, cada millonésima de segundo, iba perdiendo un poco de solidez, desinflándose hasta convertirse en las dos líneas casi rectas de pellejo que es hoy mi boca. Marcela fue la primera en no reconocerlos. A ti te pasa algo, estás enfermo y no son las ojeras, que siempre has tenido ni lo flaco que estás, ni siquiera los piojos o esa brecha que te parte el vientre. Es tu boca vieja, más vieja que tus piernas o tus manos, que son las mismas con cuatro años más.»

«Esa tarde, al llegar a la Facultad, estaba cerrada. Por un momento pensé que era el Patrón o alguna fiesta académica que a mí, como siempre, se me había olvidado. Pero no. Allí estaba Claudio, esperándome, con su sonrisa semicerrada en la comisura de los labios.
          ―Nada, tío, que la han cerrado. Esta mañana se debe haber montado un follón muy gordo. Han detenido a gente.
         ―¿Al de las gafas? ¿Han detenido al de las gafas?
         ―No, hombre, no, si tú no los conoces. Ni yo. Son de Historia. De quinto. Vamos, hala, que tenemos que ir a la manifestación, que es a las ocho.
         ―Ni lo sueñes. Yo me voy a mi casa, que bastante tengo con lo que tengo para meterme en líos. Vas tú y mañana me lo cuentas.»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Paisaje de Malva que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Luisa Ruiz Chacón vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Luisa Ruiz Chacón vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
Política de Privacidad

story:
"There are some people you meet, that just the way they are, is a lesson that will last you the rest of your life." - excerpt from Outside With Elephants.


Outside With Elephants is a love story that follows three young people as they navigate young adulthood. We travel with them as they explore the new faces, places and experiences that condition them as they look to live lives of great impact.

My name is Martin Angus Jr. and I am the author of Outside With Elephants. I wrote this book to help me make sense of my complicated past. Historically, I have been terrible at love. I’ve always wanted it, desperately, but could never define it, so it was impossible to know whether I was getting what I so desperately longed for. Or even more so, how I was impacting the lives of others in my ignorance to it. 

What is “Love” anyway? Like so many of us, I grew up adopting what those around me defined love as. What my mother thought it was (or wasn't) or what my grandparents would say. "Love is a verb!" or "Love is unconditional!" Conceptually, I get it, but I never stopped to ask what it meant to me so I could never truly own it. I could never truly be it. Is it a noun? A verb? Both? Is it only romantic? How many different types of love are there?

It was on the morning of Day 3, of a 10-day silent mediation retreat at a small meditation center in the foothills of Napa Valley, California, that something shifted in me. I had an epiphany as to what “Love” meant, to me. Ever since then, I have been on a quest to understand what happened that day, and how to tell its story. With this novel and its characters, I look to tell the story of “Love” in the best way I can - by telling my own.

My hope is that, in reading this book, somewhere in the stories of these three young people, you will explore what love means to you and begin to define it for yourself. My purpose isn’t to give you any answers, but to inspire you to ask yourself more questions. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a guide to inspire your path to more truly loving yourself, and the world around us.

In this book, we'll explore:
  • The development on one's character
  • The definition of ‘true love’
  • The difference between self-care and selfishness

 

What I Need & What You Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • My Editors - who have so gracefully put up with my procrastination an have begrudgingly been helping me revise and publish my manuscript for July 2020
  • The Cover Design - (The mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder)
  • The Layout Design for the Interior - (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copy-editing - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts - when I ultimately publish this summer

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book NOW:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering 
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of the book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of Outside With Elephants and the entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give feedback and be involved in selecting the cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share intimate details of the experience writing Outside With Elephants
  • And more...

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of Outside With Elephants is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as the book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that sometimes, we cannot contribute financially in support of a friend, or artist but I have some ideas for others ways you can show your support!

  • Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. 
  • Use #OutsideWithElephants and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  •  Share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of this page

 

I totally welcome any ideas you have. Reach out to me below and let's figure something out!

  • Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/martinangusjr
  • Twitter: www.twitter.com/martinangusjr
  • Instagram: www.instagram.com/followmartinjr
  • Email: Martin.AngusJr@gmail.com

 

I am so looking forward to sharing this story with you. Thank you for showing up.

Love,
Marty
