story:
The Posterchildren is a YA superhero novel that focuses on LGBTQ themes, female empowerment, POCs, and minority issues. The Posterchildren project's goal is to generate the funding needed for a print run of the first novel. With your support, we will be able to get this book into the hands of people who have been looking for a hero like them. 

Growing up, YA fiction was how I made sense of myself and the world around me. It was my ethics, my sex ed, and my escape. I was a voracious reader, and I truly believe that the stories I absorbed when I was young shaped who I am today. Finding myself in YA fiction wasn’t easy, though. LGBTQ fiction was hard to find, and most of the stuff I got my hands on were coming out stories. What I really needed were stories grounded in hope - stories that reflected the fact that I wasn’t alone, that there was no right answer for who I was supposed to be (or who I should/shouldn’t love), and that being feminine or sensitive was not something to be ashamed of. I wanted stories where queer characters were given the same depth and life as their heterosexual counterparts - where they didn’t exist solely to “be” queer. I wanted to see someone like myself as more than a plot point. I wanted to know that the definition of family does not begin and end with biological connections.

With your help, I aim to publish and print that kind of story. The Posterchildren revolves heavily around the training of an Arab American posterchild named Malek Underwood. A top-ranking student at Maillardet's Academy for the Future of Humanity, the leading school in training posterchildren to control their abilities and shape their future, Mal finds himself suddenly knocked from his pedestal at the top of his class and thrown to the bottom. Paired with an almost-failing lesbian speedster named Zipporah Chance, the two of them discover that the world is far more complex than grades and tests - or even "good guys" and "bad guys". Fortunately, it isn't a world that they have to brave alone. 

 

READ THE FIRST CHAPTER HERE!

 

  

 

The project is pretty simple: I want to make physical copies of this novel available. The $3500 goal is the funding needed for the initial print run. If we don't reach our entire goal, we will be printing as many copies as we can with the funds we raised here. If we exceed the goal, I will be able to focus on writing and releasing the second novel, as well as an anthology of short stories set in this universe. 

 

BACKER PERKS:

  • Digital Hero: A digital download of The Posterchildren. It would look just darling on your preferred e-book-reading device. $5
  • Not-as-Hard Copy: A paperback copy of The Posterchildren. $15
  • This is a Thing That I Wrote: A paperback copy of The Posterchildren, signed by Kitty. Glitter, doodles, and personal messages will vary. $25
  • Better With Pictures: A signed paperback copy of The Posterchildren + a print from one of the very VERY talented artists. $40
  • Graphic Content: A signed paperback copy of The Posterchildren + 3 prints of your choice. $55
  • I Just Really Like Art, Okay?: A signed paperback copy of The Posterchildren + 5 prints of your choice. $65
  • Superheroes Plus a Side of Plush: A signed paperback copy of The Posterchildren, five prints, and one of the limited-run hand-made plushies of the main characters. $150 
  • The Vicarious Superhero: In addition to getting a signed paperback copy of the Posterchildren and five art prints, this backer gets to create their own superhero. This character's name, age, and powers will be determined by the backer, and they will appear in this - and future - stories in this universe. $250

 

STRETCH GOALS

5k: TIMELY TALES OF THE POSTHUMANS: VOL. 1. Every month, I will be digitally releasing a new short story that takes place in the Posterchildren universe. Each one-shot will be treated as a separate issue, much like the comic book serial format. The issues will focus on side stories and secondary characters, allowing me to explore a wider variety of backgrounds. All backers at the $15+ mark will get a year's subscription! GOAL MET!

7k: POSTERCHILDREN SECRET FILES: VOL. 1. Compiling concept art, character art, world information, and as many super-secret-super-details as your heart desires. Additionally, we will be offering silicone color bands, based on the posterchildren classification system (as described in this post)! The bands will be embossed with the different category names, and you will be able to choose which one you'd like. All backers at the $55+ mark will get this perk! GOAL MET! 

10k: So you're saying to yourself, gosh, a digital artbook/infobook sounds neat, but I wish I could hold it in my hands. Well, lucky for you, we have plans to make the Secret Files: Vol. 1 into a physical book. If we hit this stretch goal, we will be able to commission our artists for more material - meaning we will be able to have a longer, meatier, info-ier book. If we hit this stretch goal, you will be getting two physical books and three digitial ones. Talk about some bang for your buck! GOAL MET!

15k: As funding increases, the bigger and better everything will get. We're going to be able to increase the size of the art book, bringing in more artists to generate content for the book. Also, we'll be donating 10 copies of the novel to libraries! GOAL MET! 

20k: If we hit our 20k goal, we will be able to offer official Maillardet's Academy raglan training t-shirts, as shown in many of the prints.

Even if we don't hit this goal, know that it is one of the first big ones that we have in mind post-campaign. Your donations would just make them available sooner rather than later!

 

 

So maybe you're saying to yourself hey, yeah, okay, this sounds like something that I'd like to read, but I don't have two pennies to rub together. HOW DO I MAKE SURE THAT MY FUTURE HAS MORE YOUNG ADULT NOVELS FULL OF QUEER KIDS WITH SUPERPOWERS?

Well, there are several ways that you can help make this thing a reality! If you can't donate, but still want to see The Posterchildren make it to print, please shout your support from the proverbial e-hills. You can do this by hitting us up on our various social media outlets (such as Twitter and Tumblr). Reblog like the wind, heroes.  

 

 

A twenty-five year old resident of Portland, I spend most of my time enjoying the rain from a respectable distance (re: indoors). As a fan of comic books, I'm overly invested in people who wear spandex and habitually take bites out of crime. When I'm not reading or critiquing comics, I'm writing my own. This project has been the culmination of several years of work - my work, as well as the talent of the artists that have created character designs for The Posterchildren - so thank you so much for your time and consideration!

story:
To contact Mark Sevillano Jr.  E-mail him at:  MarkSevillanoJr@gmail.com  

 

Hi,  I'm Mark, 

I just finished writing a very personal book.  Its not my ideal way I would like to be introduced to the world BUT I feel the need to get this book published and released publicly.  6 years ago I found myself alone, stuck and confused about my belief in God and confused about my sexuality.  

I remember feeling so alone.  I searched online to see if there was anyone who was also confused about their sexuality or confused about their belife in God and I couldn't find anyone that I could relate to.  I was left feeling hopeless.

Later that year I decided I that would talk about it.  I would be the face of people who are going though what I went though.  If I could help one other person who was in the same shoes as I would then I would be satisfyed.

In short, I was at a place in my iife where I really needed help, God helped me and so I wrote a book about it. 

What I Need & What You Get

I need the money to get this book published and as you donate you get some perks!

I'm doing everything myself.  I felt it would be best to self-publish my 1st book.  But to do that I need funding.  It takes a lot of time and money to write a book.  I need to raise $9,000 by July 31st.  Once I pay for the services "Believer's Press" offers my book will then go into production.  My target date to release my book is January 2014!!!  

With your help I will be able to be the voice and leader to so many poeple who share a simliar story like mine.  And YOU can be a part of that.

LET ME MAKE IT CLEAR, I'M NOT SAYING THAT HOMOSEXUALITY IS A CHOICE, I'M SAYING THAT CHOSING GOD IS A CHOICE.  

My story is for EVERYONE especially the open-minded, those that are struggling with their sexuality, and those who love God and want to fight againts sin in general.  

The Impact

I know this book will impact the world.  It is a much needed book.  God and Gay are two major topics in America.  It's time we face God and we face Gay and actually talk about it.  Without being biased.  Without having a hidden agenda.  Lets be honest, real and face what we really think about God and Gays.

In 2010 I went public about my story by releasing a YouTube video though a non-profit called SoulCareTV and since then I have had the chance to reach over 11,000 people and council/befriend over 45 guys around the world who struggle with same-sex atrraction.

PEPOPLE THERE IS A NEED FOR A STORY LIKE MINE.

This book is for gays, straight people, family and freinds who know gay people.  We need to hear this side of the story.  A story about how God helped me get though one of the hardest times in my life.  I'm not trying to change gay people.  I'm simply sharing my life experiences with others.  I touch on topics such as childhood, religion, identiy, and sexuality. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I uderstand some people can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Here are some easy ways you can help out:

Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.  

Reffer your friends & family to this Indiegogo web-page and share my campaign on all your social media sites.  Get on the phone and tell someone about my book.

I've always dreamed of becoming an author and I hope this book opens the door to my dream of becoming an author and speaker for a living.  I have many other stories I would like to share but I want to begin with this one.  

PLEASE BE A PART OF MY VERY 1ST BOOK.

THANK YOU!!  I know that with your help and support and prayers AND WITH GOD ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE!

 

Follow him on Twitter:  @Markizchozen

This book is for gays, straight people, family and freinds who know gay people.  We need to hear this side of the story.  A story about how God helped me get though one of the hardest times in my life.  I'm not trying to change gay people.  I'm simply sharing my life experiences with others.  I touch on topics such as childhood, religion, identiy, and sexuality. 


Other Ways You Can Help
I uderstand some people can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Here are some easy ways you can help out:
Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.  
Reffer your friends & family to this Indiegogo web-page and share my campaign on all your social media sites.  Get on the phone and tell someone about my book.

I've always dreamed of becoming an author and I hope this book opens the door to my dream of becoming an author and speaker for a living.  I have many other stories I would like to share but I want to begin with this one.  
PLEASE BE A PART OF MY VERY 1ST BOOK.
THANK YOU!!  I know that with your help and support and prayers AND WITH GOD ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE!
 
Follow him on Twitter:  @Markizchozen

story:
About the Author 

Michael Bach is a speaker, author, and subject matter expert in the field of inclusion, diversity, equity, accessibility (IDEA) and brings a vast knowledge of leading practices in a live setting to his work. He works as a consultant, advising clients on how to do IDEA right!

About Alphabet Soup 

In his first book, Birds of All Feathers: Doing Diversity and Inclusion Right, he argues that creating diverse, inclusive workplaces is not just the right thing to do―it is the smart thing to do. Now, he’s back with his second book, Alphabet Soup: The Quintessential Guide to LGBTQ2+ Inclusion and he hopes to capture the support of contributors who can help publish this book, that will take readers on a journey of discovery with the objective of creative active allies to help achieve the elusive goal of true inclusion. 

Covering chapters such as Breaking Down the Alphabet and The Importance of Safe Space, Michael shows allyship is a critical component in creating LGBTQ2+ inclusive spaces, and the various ways to engage with LGBTQ2+ employees, volunteers, students, parishioners, or just everyday people on the street.

Why Contribute

Michael came out as gay in 1987, when he was just 17. It was a scary time to be openly LGBTQ2+ but Michael’s journey around his sexuality and gender had started years earlier, as growing up he faced endless bullying for being “different”. This book is dedicated to every 9-year old lesbian, gay, bisexual, Trans*, queer and two-spirit kids out there, struggling to figure out who they are, in the hopes that it will help make a world where you can be your fabulous self and not feel any shame. 

Michael’s goal in writing this book is to work toward a world where homophobia, transphobia and biphobia are things of the past. Where everyone can be themselves. Your contribution will help make Alphabet Soup possible.

To get Alphabet Soup in the hands of active allies everywhere, we hope to raise enough funds to publish this inclusion book. We’re so excited to offer you fabulous perks in exchange for your support. 

We hope you’ll consider joining Michael Bach on his mission to help spread inclusivity and the creation of LGBTQ2+ safe spaces. If you’re unable to contribute, we hope you’ll help spread the word by sharing this campaign on social media and beyond.

story:
Four days! Four elements! 500 words! The Iron Writer, the flash fiction competition where sharp-witted lads and silver-penned ladies are invited to test the metal in their mettle, is ready to expand. This competition was started a year ago by B.Y. Rogers and features both a website and an active Facebook group in which competitors can choose to enter a weekly competition wherein they are given 4 days to write a 500 word story that contains 4 required elements and/or engage in the Weekend Quickie - a non-competitive challenge.  Participants have the benefit of improving their writing skills, gaining greater exposure, and exploring the craft with a variety of writers from novices to seasoned veterans in a supportive, fun-loving, and incredibly active environment.  This competition has recently hit several amazing milestones; we now have over 100 competitors in the pool, we have just completed the first annual open to determine the 2013-2014 Iron Writer, we have just surpassed 1 million unique hits on the website, and that's just the beginning. We are now looking to grow even more with better prizes, faster hosting, and a promotional tour.

Better Prizes

Currently, The Iron Writer features a free e-copy of a book from the TIW library as the prize for winning a weekly competition, and a free e-cover as the prize for winning the open. We want to be able to provide cash prizes for each. Also, we want to be able to provide a welcome gift to anyone who joins. 

Faster Hosting

With our unique visit numbers exploding, we want to be able to both meet the needs of the visitors and provide ample advertising opportunities as a means to make the site self-sufficient. 

A Promotional Tour

Line By Lion Publications and 3 Fates Press, owned by Iron Writer K.A. DaVur, has been kindly hosting us at the events that she attends.  We regularly gain 500-2000 unique visitors to the site and 5-10 new writers after each event.  She is preparing to go on the road full-time, and we would like to offset her travel costs and provide her with promotional materials to distribute.

story:
Although pre-orders on IndieGogo have concluded, you may visit www.saranshdc.com and fill out the form at the bottom of the page to reserve your copy of Soundstorm before it is out in early December!

 

*Update: Future Profits Will Go to the New Orleans Musicians Clinic*

Thanks to your help and support, we met our publishing goal of $5000 in one week!  I will be donating 75% of all profits above my publishing goal to the New Orleans Musicians Clinic, which provides medical care to musicians and performing artists in New Orleans. The city’s cultural community is being hit particularly hard by the COVID-19 pandemic, and since New Orleans' artistic spirit has deeply inspired me in the writing of this book, I want to do my part and give back! The remaining 25% will assist me with future marketing materials, book talks, and other opportunities related to sharing my story!

To everyone who has supported me thus far, thank you so much for making my dream come true!

 

Story of My Book

Much has been written about trends and patterns in music, but such work is almost always done within entirely distinct silos. Through a collection of interdisciplinary essays, I aim to bridge the gap between these different factions that don’t always communicate, exploring the syntheses and frictions between the business-oriented, creative, and cultural worlds as the music ecosystem experiences unprecedented growth and unprecedented challenges.

My name is Saransh Desai-Chowdhry, and I am the author of Soundstorm: Musings on the Madness of the Modern Music Ecosystem, set for publication in December 2020. Across twenty essays, I draw from my personal and professional experiences and the insight of artistic and commercial trailblazers in music. Music has always been the lens through which I see the world, and as a young, multicultural product of the digital age, I want to consider potential futures for the music ecosystem.

According to a June 2019 Goldman Sachs report, the recorded music market will hit $45 billion by 2030; however, in the wake of the coronavirus crisis, tours have been postponed indefinitely, executives have been furloughed, and many artists have lost their instruments, their jobs, and even their homes. As such, the music ecosystem is at a crossroads. The decisions we make as a collective, today, could have long standing impacts on the future of all individuals and entities who exist in this space. With creative disruption inevitably around the corner, I consider the following question—don’t we owe it to ourselves to do our best to establish a system that works well—or at least better—for listeners, artists, and artist advocates alike?

In Soundstorm, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the world of music in you. In reading this book, you will discover the cultural patterns and phenomena that underline many of the ways you engage with music. Ultimately, I hope this book can be clarifying, a tool for you to appreciate not just the music business but also many of the adjacent communities enveloping it—criticism, education, technology and several other fields—that are equally as important in determining how music is made and how it ends up penetrating the soundscape and our eardrums.

You will love reading this book if you love music or are a fan of personal essays and nonfiction storytelling. Moreover, if you are a music business student, a music executive, or another member of the music industry, you can use this book to gauge a young, multicultural perspective on the ecosystem.

The Book - Soundstorm: Musings on the Madness of the Modern Music Ecosystem

The book is comprised of twenty essays, including but not limited to...

  • A narration of my demystifying experience as a seat filler at the Grammys and the evolving role of award shows
  • A personal reflection on the emotional power of revisiting albums and tapping into musical nostalgia during crises
  • A profile on Blu DeTiger, a buzzworthy rising star and former classmate of mine at NYU, and the possibilities and limitations of TikTok as a marketing tool
  • An exploration of the cultural significance of pop music as a historically degraded and institutionally driven art-form
  • A consideration of K-Pop's ubiquity and and the diffusion of a global genres as a means for cultural and commercial exchange
  • A diagnosis of problems within the live music apparatus as fans because disillusioned with rising ticket prices and consolidation

—and more!

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

Now that I have raised $5000 for my book, I will officially be publishing! As I mentioned above, 75% of profits above my publishing goal will be allocated to the New Orleans Musicians Clinic.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book.

—and more!

About the Author

Saransh Desai-Chowdhry is a critical writer, creative marketer, and classically-trained musician based in New York City. He is currently a Marketing Representative for The Orchard of Sony Music and the manager of Sanjana, a rising independent artist.

Earlier this year, Saransh graduated summa cum laude from New York University’s Gallatin School of Individualized Study, where he crafted an individualized concentration in Cultural Entrepreneurship, receiving the Interdisciplinary Academic Excellence Award and Dean’s Award for Graduating Seniors. During his time at NYU, he interned at leading companies across the music industry, co-managed independent artists, and honed his craft in advanced courses in creative nonfiction, cultural criticism and musicology. Saransh studied away in Paris as a French minor and was a leader on campus as an Admissions Ambassador, LinkedIn Campus Editor, and a member of a variety of business, music, and writing-oriented student organizations.

Originally from Los Angeles, Saransh attended Harvard-Westlake School and received his Sangeet Visharad (Bachelor of Music) with Distinction from Raga Ranjani School of Music after completing eleven years of Hindustani Vocal Classical curriculum.

Outside of writing, you can find Saransh curating playlists, running, hiking, hanging out with his best friends and seeking out the spiciest food imaginable.

For more information you can connect with Saransh at saransh@nyu.edu and on LinkedIn. You can also join in on the book journey on the @SoundstormBook Instagram!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that some people just can't contribute, particularly during these challenging times. However, I would so appreciate your help in a variety of other ways:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram with your friends, family and network. Please use #Soundstorm and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts. On Instagram, please tag @SoundstormBook.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Feel free to do this as a text message, direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support—it means the world to me!

Sincerely,
Saransh Desai-Chowdhry

story:
Bullying and Child Suicide

Suicide is the third leading cause of death among young people. For every suicide among young people, there are at least 100 suicide attempts. Over 14 percent of high school students have considered suicide, and almost 7 percent have attempted it. 

Bully victims are between 2 to 9 times more likely to consider suicide than non-victims, according to studies by Yale University


Hi,  My name is Joey Eida, and I am hoping I have seen the last child suicide due to bullying.
For the past 17 years I have been working with children teaching them sports, healthy lifestyles, and motivating them to be the best they can be in anything they want to be. My greatest gift is when a teenager tells me they made the right decision because I had an affect on them.  
Right now my goal is to bring down bullying, but in a different way. By empowering the victims AS WELL as the bullies. 
As a child I was bullied. I was picked on because I was different. It showed  in all of my expressions. Within the year I was able to beat bullying, and didn’t have to throw one punch or resort to violence to do it either! I found multiple ways to empower myself which not only stopped the bullying but all of a sudden I was friends with the same kids that picked on me. What is the most important part of this is that I learned that bullies themselves have very difficult lives which is part of why they pick on other children. 
I will be writing a book with my expertise and knowledge that can ultimately empower the victims and bullies, to give them the confidence they need and self-esteem they need to get through any tough time in their lives. I will be writing this book with a Psychotherapist (who I will be introducing in one of the update videos) who will go deep into the minds of these children and what they are experiencing, as well as exercises and tools to help these children accomplish the goals of increasing their life value and self-esteem to where bullies don't bother them anymore and where bullies don't have to put others down to make themselves feel better! This book will help save lives. So I ask you one question... Are you with me?!!

Where is the money going?

The funding from the generosity or your heart will go to;

Ghost writer (as I am not a writer, I am an athlete!!!)

Psychotherapist

Book Editing and Copies

Website (Which will be a support site for victims of being a bully or being bullied)

Book-release/ launch event in South Florida

Any extra funding will go to marketing (which will be nationwide) and go to the support website as we believe will be increasing in numbers 

How can this book impact our children?

Imagine children having more self esteem than now, more confidence in themselves where they don't worry about what other people say about them or children that are strong enough to say no to drugs, or alcohol, or fighting!  We will have less suicides, less drugs, less fighting! A world with more confident people can be the difference between lower class and middle income, or middle class and upper class! With your help we can change the world! 
I have been working to help children since I can remember. I run a youth sports company called Fired Up Youth Sports which has a big goal of bringing down youth obesity, I ran free educational events for other organizations such as Big Brothers Big Sisters of Greater Miami to educate children on health and affordable nutrition.  But this book can educate so many children at once, as well as parents and teachers which will help guide them!

No hurdles for publishing this book!

This book already has the information from myself as well as the research for the psychologist. So far the only thing in our way is funding, and with your help we can LEAP over this bump!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Folks lets get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! The more people know about it, the more awareness our book gets, so we can get the funding as well as get books out to these people!
    • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

  No hurdles for publishing this book!
This book already has the information from myself as well as the research for the psychologist. So far the only thing in our way is funding, and with your help we can LEAP over this bump!

  Other Ways You Can Help 
Folks lets get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! The more people know about it, the more awareness our book gets, so we can get the funding as well as get books out to these people! Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
SUMMARY

We have just published the fifth issue of Contemporary Lynx Magazine in print. We are looking to raise  £3,500. One of the most challenging tasks in running an indie magazine is the cost and logistics of a worldwide distribution. We want to give a voice to Polish artists and build a platform for experts to report on them. Reaching out to new readers from across the globe is the most exciting part of publishing a print magazine. However, the cost of shipping, logistics and transportation sometimes threaten to overwhelm our budget, and restrict us from crossing the oceans and going further. Your help is vital in making this happen! 

We offer: unique curated content / cutting edge commentary / quality print / fresh thinking / each cover is a unique artwork painted acrylic on PVC/ Illustrations made by acclaimed artists

 

LYNX STORY

We — Dobromiła and Sylwia — are Editors-in-Chief and founders of Contemporary Lynx Magazine. We are excited to share our project with you, one that we have been working with our team extremely hard on for the past six months. We hope that this campaign will help us finance and distribute the fifth edition of Contemporary Lynx Magazine. We look to raise £3,500.00, which will cover a big part of the costs of distribution of this issue. Come and join us!

Our friendship started at university where we studied the history of art. Surprised by a lack of information about Polish artists in English and their successes abroad, we set up a blog in 2013. The idea was simple — to spread the news across the world of talented Polish artists who practice internationally, their successes, and to celebrate Polish visual culture. Month after month we have become stronger by gaining the trust of the artistic community, and an expanding reader base. After two years of online reporting we decided to go print! In 2015, we published the first printed issue. Meanwhile, our team has grown from two founders to more than 30 contributors from across the globe, who are based in Beijing, Hong Kong, Poland, Germany, France, UK, Sweden, Spain and the US.

Today, Contemporary Lynx is the only independent, English-language magazine, devoted to visual culture with a strong focus on Polish art. We aim to showcase talented Polish artists while placing them firmly in the global art scene, and at the centre of current trends and global affairs. The magazine is distributed worldwide; across Europe, in the USA and Asia and is available in selected galleries, museums, bookstores and cultural centres, as well as, on our website. The additional distribution includes international art fairs and art events promoted by Polish Cultural Institutes across the globe. 

Contemporary Lynx is the fruit of our friendship, and our team’s hard work and passion for Polish art. Join us in supporting independent arts from Poland — we need your help to make Lynx happen!

 

WHY IS THE FIFTH ISSUE OF CONTEMPORARY LYNX SO SPECIAL?

  • Each issue has a unique hand-painted cover by Zbiok (check out the video of how he did it)!
  • Fascinating interviews with street artists Zbiok and Invader
  • A signature mix of reporting and essays on street art, urban design, photography in public space, street art and the Internet, and city reports on the artistic scenes of Lisbon and Łódź
  • All the content in the Magazine is available exclusively offline
  • Printed on a mix of beautiful offset and glossy papers
  • 164 pages, 2964 copies, each stamped and signed

 

CONTENT

From protest art to anti-surveillance art, in this issue, we bring engaging reviews on art in the public space, exploring how urban art shapes societies and cityscapes. As Magdalena Abakanowicz once pointed out: Art does not solve problems but makes us aware of their existence. It opens our eyes to see and our brain to imagine. Contemporary art, similarly to philosophy, constantly asks us questions, which are often inconvenient, annoying or occur at an unexpected time and place. It draws us into a conversation, but on its own terms. The most sensitive and at the same time most brutal place in this respect, is the ’street’. It is in this place that artists express their views in the most direct way and communicate with passers-by. We ask what is the public space today, we discuss the relations between street art and the net, and present how artists engage directly in current political events, supporting protests, manifestations or simply discussing the shape of the surrounding reality.

Contemporary Lynx Magazine is the ultimate foreigner’s guide to contemporary art, design photography and visual culture from Poland.

 

 

 

HOW WE MADE OUR HAND-PAINTED COVER

Contemporary Lynx invited street artist Sławek ZBIOK Czajkowski to participate in a project unlike any other before — to hand paint 2,964 magazine covers, which will comprise the fifth print issue of our magazine. At the TRAFO Centre for Contemporary Art in Szczecin, ZBIOK transformed rows of blank white PVC sheets into striking works of colour. Every sheet is part of a larger collective image — a 16 x 11-metre painting titled, ‘The World Is A Mess’, depicting a luminous sea harbour clad in glaring shades of lime green, azure and cobalt blue. In this way, every magazine cover is its own work of art, an inimitable mark and trace left by the artist himself, unlike the ‘reproduction’ covers that are seen in the traditional format of printing and publishing.

 

 

The title ‘The World Is A Mess’ is a quote from one of Donald Trump’s speeches, someone who is clearing the way for a dark wave of conservatism, nationalism, racism and the sinister cult of force to sweep in. — explains the artist Zbiok, adding” I'm interested in the idea of privilege, and the resulting ease of judging others in the context of economics, skin colour, sexual orientation, or place of birth.

 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

 

We are on the way to print and publish the fifth issue of Contemporary Lynx Magazine. We are looking to raise £3,500. This will cover a big part of the costs of distribution this issue and promotion of Polish contemporary art in the world — Come and join us!

 

OUR PERKS

 

To say thank you for you support, we prepared great perks. Some of them are truly unique and only available here.

 

Cover of your choice

Copy of the latest issue of the magazine with a cover of your choice from fifty of the most beautiful ones choosen by the editors.

see below 25 covers for your to choose.

Copy signed by the artist

Only 20 copies signed by the artist of our cover - Sławek Zbiok Czajkowski (see perks for details)

 

NEW!

Three paintings by Zbiok. All in the technique oil on canvas, all available exclusively on Indiegogo. 

1. 'Existence'

2. 'Overdose'

3. 'Open-minded'

1. Slawek 'Zbiok' Czajkowski, 'Existence', oil on canvas, 40 x 50 cm, 2017

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

2. Slawek 'Zbiok' Czajkowski, 'Overdose', oil on canvas, 40 x 50 cm, 2017

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

3. Slawek 'Zbiok' Czajkowski, 'Open-minded', oil on canvas, 40 x 50 cm, 2017

3 x tote bags

Set of three Lynx's tote bags in grey, navy blue and beige colours (see perks for details)

 

One issue

Copy of the latest issue of the magazine, signed by one of the editors in chief, thank you note on our website and one tote bag (colour of your choice). Each magazine is stamped and numbered.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

See more in the perks sections.

 

THE IMPACT

Donating to Contemporary Lynx Magazine will help us continue promoting Polish artists, designers, and photographers. It will help us continue with producing a print magazine to showcase their works and place Polish art in the global context.

International distribution is one of the biggest challenges for our team. International circulation is a costly process. On the forefront of Contemporary Lynx Magazine’s team are the artists and our readers, and we trust that your support will help us to increase our circulation and popularise information about Polish contemporary art.

Contemporary Lynx is a grass-roots initiative run on pure enthusiasm, hard work and stubbornness, with a small measure of frustration with the lack of sufficient information on - and opportunity for — Polish artists to reach out to an international audience. We want to give a voice to Polish artists and build a platform for experts to report on them. Your help is vital in making this happen!

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Contemporary Lynx Magazine is published biannually, in April and October, since 2015. The biggest challenge for us is the cost of print and fees for the writers, translators, designers we managed to cover every issue. The costs are high because we only use the highest quality papers, pay a fair share to our contributors, and focus on delivering the best quality content. We will never compromise on these, because this is precisely what makes us an important (and beautiful) source of information about what’s best in Polish art. This is also why we could use your help!

One of the most challenging tasks in running an indie magazine, is the cost and logistics of a worldwide distribution. At the same time, the possibility of reaching out to new readers from across the globe is the most exciting part of publishing a print magazine. However, the cost of shipping, logistics and transportation sometimes threaten to overwhelm our budget and restrict us from crossing the oceans and going further. Your donation will be directed towards helping us cover these costs related to international distribution.

For us, it is crucial to reach readers and Polish communities spread across the globe. We believe that talented Polish artists deserve international exposure, and Contemporary Lynx is a unique place to showcase their work to an English-speaking audience.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 

Can’t contribute financially or want to do more?

  • Tell your friends about Contemporary Lynx and this campaign.
  • Post the campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or wherever you share cool things online.
  • Reach us at media@contemporarylynx.com for inquiries or just to say hello

story:
¿Qué?

Agonía y Esperanza es una historia llena de sentimiento con un escenario incomparable, como homenaje a la obra Persuasión de Jane Austen en este 2017 que es, a la postre, su bicentenario.

Frédéric Heywood y Anna Wellesley eran dos jóvenes alegres, ingeniosos y con ganas de comerse el mundo cuando se conocieron. Reconociéndose como hechos el uno para el otro, vivieron su amor incondicional durante unos meses de felicidad sin límite. Pero los condicionantes sociales de ella, perteneciente a una familia acaudalada y aristocrática, la llevaron a romper su relación con un simple aspirante a escritor de clase media.

Varios años después, las circunstancias han cambiado. Frédéric se ha convertido en un escritor de éxito y prestigioso. Por su parte, los Wellesley, cuyas empresas han quebrado por efecto de la crisis financiera, se encuentran arruinados y viviendo más de su nombre que de sus escasos ingresos. Al reencontrarse a las puertas de Venecia, donde ambos van a residir durante algún tiempo, Frédéric se debate entre el resentimiento que ha sentido durante todo ese tiempo de separación y un sentimiento que remueve su interior y no sabe interpretar.

Basada en el argumento de la íntima y conmovedora Persuasión, de Jane Austen, y manteniendo ese mismo tono y estilo cuidado y elegante, Agonía y esperanza es una historia romántica de elegancia emocional, de madurez anímica y segundas oportunidades.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Fernando García Pañeda.

Nacido en Bilbao en 1964, aterrizó en el mundo de la literatura en 2002 con una novela de aventuras ambientada en el marco de la última guerra carlista, Viento de Guerra, reeditada en 2007 con el título Las lágrimas de Eurídice. Después vinieron de su mano la novela de intriga contemporánea Kismet, y las intimistas Tres Gymnopedias y Sueño y azar, ganando con esta última el Premio Alhóndiga de Narrativa Breve 2014. Con Operación Black Death retornó al género histórico en el marco de la España de la posguerra. También ha publicado el libro de relatos de humor british-style Gentes del Club.

También fue colaborador durante varios años del semanario turco Shalom, de Estambul, en cuyo suplemento cultural El Amaneser publicó diversos artículos sobre historia y cultura en idioma judeo-español, así como prologuista de varias novelas. Por otra parte, ha sido director y coordinador de varios talleres y clubes de lectura en bibliotecas públicas, y es socio de número de la Jane Austen Society España.

Las obras de Fernando García Pañeda se encuadran en lo que podría llamarse literatura en blanco y negro: una escritura blanca, que busca elegancia y poesía, con algunos brochazos y retoques mayores o menores de negro que ofrece la vida real.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Agonía y Esperanza que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Fernando García Pañeda vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Update 8-13-17

Hey Everyone I need your help. I really want to go out on tour this fall to promote Road Dog. Honestly I believe it’s the best thing I’ve done, so far. I am so proud of this book and I want to put it out in front of as many people as possible. I know this may not be as important to you as it is to me, but I really need to do this. I need to buy books, fix the van, and cover my expenses. Please donate what you can. $5, $10, $15, whatever. It all helps.
Thanks.

And now back to our longer pitch...

I walked away from a successful career as a sound designer on films like My Own Private Idaho and Good Will Hunting to tell my own stories and make my own films. For me it was never about the money it was always about the story.

I write because I have to. Something burns deep inside me that needs to create. I wrote Road Dog because I had to. I have stories to tell. What’s the good of having a story to tell when there’s no one around to listen?

I’m going out on tour this fall to promote my book, Road Dog, and I need your help.

"A man and his dog hit the road and discover America. What more do you need to know? Road Dog joins the annals of great travelogues." - Don Campbell, Writer, musician, road dog

I started touring in 2005 when no distributors showed interest in my independent films. I tore a page out of the punk rock handbook, burned a thousand DVD’s (one at a time) and traveled the country in a borrowed pickup truck. The following spring I bought a used van and hit the road with my 120-pound Chocolate Lab, Moses.

We toured the US twice a year for seven years. Over the years we had some harrowing adventures and met a lot of interesting people. I gave an audio workshop for employees of a porn channel, was asked to leave the Prayer Tower at Oral Roberts University, drove 2400 miles in three days so I wouldn’t miss my daughter’s choir recital, and met a way overzealous drug sniffing border patrol dog outside El Paso, Texas.

We logged over 200,000 miles as I showed my films at universities, media art centers, independent theaters, even bars.

Moses passed away in 2009 and for health reasons I stopped touring in 2012. Since then I’ve had two open-heart surgeries and today I feel great.

“A much-needed Travels With Charley for today... Road Dog is a cure for the blues, a lot of laughs, and a delightful lesson in being alive.” - - William M. Akers, author, Your Screenplay Sucks!, Mrs. Ravenbach's Way

Independent publishing is like independent filmmaking. You have to be driven to do whatever it takes to get your work in front of an audience. And you have to engage with them one on one.  

I need your help because touring is expensive especially with no publisher behind me. I have to pay for everything, most of it up front. I need to order books, get the van fixed, upgrade my laptop, get a new hard drive and some memory cards, pay for gas, food, lodging, and other expenses while we’re out on the road.

“Kelley Baker is a storyteller par excellence - on film and now in prose. In Road Dog we have the pleasure of journeying with "the Angry Filmmaker" as he careens across the American landscape with his dog Moses. Awesome fun and also quite touching. A love poem to a special canine and to the open road.” – Beth Harrington, Independent Filmmaker

It’s been over six years since I’ve done a full-blown tour. This time I’m traveling with my daughter, Fiona, and our dog Mickey, (aka, The Dog Face Boy). We’ll be on the road from September 14th through November 5th and already have bookings in Nashville, Chicago, Kansas City, Wichita, Dallas, Fort Worth, and Houston, among others.

This is not my first rodeo. Road Dog is my third book. I wrote The Angry Filmmaker Survival Guide Parts One and Part Two and took them on the road with my films. One thing I know is, it’s scary to stand up in front of an audience and read from a very personal work. But I have to do it. I need to do it!

We’re going to be taking lots of photos and video which we’ll upload as we travel. We’ll do live updates from some of our stops and we’ll do meetups along the way so that our supporters can drop by, meet us, and even pet the Dog Face Boy.

Many of my filmmaker friends are going to shoot additional footage at our stops, for which they will be paid a small honorarium. At the end of the tour we’ll put all of this together as a documentary film.

"Kelley's book allows us to live vicariously through his adventures. I'm not gonna lie to you, this is one of the very few books that brought me to tears. I think it could be the best work that Baker has done. Worth the read!" - - Scott McMahon, The Film Trooper Podcast

My total budget for this tour is $19,000 and I’m hoping all of you can help me raise half of that. I’m looking for sponsors to raise the other half.

I spent 7 years living this book and 3 years writing it. I think it’s important to tell people about it so that maybe they’ll spend a couple hours reading it. And who knows, maybe this book will cause them to leave home, see this country, and have their own adventures.

Please support this project so I can take Road Dog back out on the road where it belongs.

“I simply could not put this book down. It made me laugh out loud, cry out loud, share passages with my kids, want to be a better filmmaker, parent and person.” - - Ian Fowler, Artist.

We will be adding MORE PERKS as this campaign progresses so please check back often. And don’t forget to share.

For more excerpts and information please check out www.angryfilmmaker.com

story:
Hi! 
If you're reading this, you most likely know me personally in some way. Just to give you a fair warning, this will only really make sense to you if you know me. 
There are many causes and individuals more worthy of support and you are in no way required to do anything. Go make a cup of tea or support somebody or something more awesome - I will absolutely not be offended!

You might know that I write. Mostly poetry with occasional flash fiction thrown into the mix. 
Here's my writer's bio to spare me the embarrassment of writing about my personal achievements:


Bio: E.V. McLoughlin's poems were published in Making Memories (CAP 2015), Connections (CAP 2016), Between light and half light (Shalom/Crescent writers 2015) anthologies as well as in Panning for Poems, Bangor Literary Journal and Rat's Ass Review. Her poems were longlisted for Seamus Heaney Award for New Writing 2016 and shortlisted for the Fresher Writing Prize 2017. E.V. loves coffee, books, and city lights and lives in Co. Down, Northern Ireland with her husband and son. 

I was also awarded Support for  Individual Artists Award by  Arts Council of Northern Ireland in 2017 and John Hewitt International Summer School Bursary in 2016 (you can read about my experience here: https://evcouldbeawriter.wordpress.com/2016/08/...).
You might have met me through readings and classes at the Crescent Arts Centre, Women Aloud NI event or, perhaps, at the Dead Shy Poets Society's meeting :-)

Still reading? Yay :-)  The thing is...I have been selected to participate in the Seamus Heaney Poetry Centre Summer School 2018. Which is amazing! I have also been lucky enough to be awarded a partial bursary. However, even with the bursary, the fee is still £250 which is a considerable kick to my family's budget. 

If you fancy being a "patron of the arts" or you are feeling like you want to buy me a coffee or a late birthday present, please consider supporting me in going to the Summer School. :-)

But if you don't feel like it that's totally fine too. I won't love you any less, I promise! ;)

story:
About this project

Why is it important?

It's important for young emerging Cambodian writers to see their work in print. It validates creativity and the significance of the written word;

It's important for young Cambodians to develop a literature that represents their own experience in modernizing Cambodia.

Background

This project supports the publication of the only literary journal in Cambodia: The Nou Hach Literary Journal.  After a hiatus of three years, we would like to publish Volume 7, which contains  award winning poetry and short fiction from the 2011 and 2013 literary contests sponsored by the  Nou Hach Literary Association (NHLA) in Phnom Penh. 

NHLA is an NGO established in 2002 with the intent to support the development of  younger creative writers in Cambodia and to provide a venue for them to publish.  It also fosters an emerging modern literary tradition for Cambodia, which was disrupted during the Khmer Rouge era.  Since the 1990s writers still struggle to establish a new tradition due to high publication costs, and a unregulated market of pirated books.   

Some of our writers associated with the Nou Hach Literary Association have achieved literary fame: Sok Chanphal was recently awarded the SEA WRITE AWARD for Cambodia.   Writers associated with NHLA produce both socially critical and imaginative fiction and poetry.  They are at the cutting edge of developing new literature for the younger generation of college educated Khmer.  A strong literary tradition influences literacy, an area where Cambodia lags behind other Asian countries. 

         We support young Cambodian writers to develop a new literary tradition of their own with free workshops lead by talented American, European, and Australian poets and fiction writers  volunteering their time while we provide the venue. There are no creative writing programs in Cambodian universities.

     Poetry Workshop with Greg Bem, "Writing Your Environment" (Fall 2013)

American Film-maker Greg Cahill at Short Film Workshop, Ministry of Information (summer 2007)

                Zine workshop with Ryan  (summer 2012)    

      Some Highlights in English for Vol. 7


"Strobe Lights"  by Yeng Cheangly (Second Place Award for Poetry, 2013)

                                Awesome!  This nightclub in the city

                                     Its strobe lights  brightly flashing

                                     Light swirling everywhere

                                     Shimmering in every color...

                                Colorful light fills the inside,

                                      Outside, pitch black darkness.

                                      Hungry lives walking, exploring

                                      Without the same clarifying light.

"Starlight"  by Chieh Kim Heang

Steung Mean Chey, my wonderland...The pile of garbage is my property; the property that never drains dry.

My name is Chey.  I do not know why I ended up living here or even when I arrived. Nor do I know my age.  My background is also a mystery.  Everyday I compete with others to pick up things that were thrown away on the stinking garbage pile.

Many people run after the garbage truck.  Garbage is our money; I and others run after the money. Some people say that I have done this job even in my previous life. How could they know about my previous life?  I don't even know about my own background now.  I don't even know my parents.

One day, there is an accident.  A monk falls into a fetid water channel with a dead dog in it. The people don't dare to help the monk; they just stand and watch as I save him from the smelly water. The awful odor is easy for me. Still it doesn't mean I don't like the fragrance of flowers.  I know that rotting things attract flies; flowers attract butterflies.  There is no butterfly on the garbage heap.  It has only flies, blue and grey headed flies.

Gold is still gold even when it has fallen into the mud.  The monk has fallen into smelly water; no one dares to approach him since he is not gold. The value of a person is based on the situation.  I help him to his home in the pagoda.....

      Workshop with poets Yin Luoth and Chin Meas, with editor Akhaing Khem 


What We Need & What You Get

The publication and distribution of 1,000 copies of the 150-page Nou Hach Literary Journal, Vol. 7.  is $1, 400  for publication and distribution; $500 for layout and editing; $200 for cover art.  

     Pledge $5 or more and we will include your name in appreciation on the Nou Hach Literary Journal website as a supporter of the Journal and in our next publication.

      

     Pledge $50 and we will include your name on the Nou Hach Literary Journal website as a supporter and send you a copy of our latest publication "'Just a Human Being' and Other Tales from Contemporary Cambodia"  just in time for a holiday present.

       Pledge $75 or more and we will include your name in appreciation on the Nou Hach Literary Journal website as a supporter of the Journal  and send you a copy of the Nou Hach Literary Journal, Vol. 7.

        Pledge $175 or more and we will include your name  in appreciation on the Nou Hach Literary Journal website as a supporter of the Journal, send you the Nou Hach Literary Journal, Vol. 7 and a copy of the forthcoming fiction/poetry collection in English from the Nou Hach LIterary Association: Transnational Cambodia.


The Impact

Cambodia lags behind the rest of Asia in the development of a modern literature.  This impacts literacy in the country since without interesting literature there is not much incentive to read.  The young writers in Vol. 7 are not only the most promising creative writers in Cambodia today, they are also associated with a clarity of Khmer writing and editing.  Being published is the best incentive for young writers to keep mastering their craft.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends and colleagues about our campaign. It means a lot to writers in Cambodia to have their work translated in English and read by an international audience.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!!

FUTURE PUBLICATION:  "TRANSNATIONAL CAMBODIA" 

Fiction, essays, poetry and a play in English by Cambodians at home and abroad

story:
About Me/My Project

Ever since my freshman year of college, way back in the year 2000, I have been composing poetry on many different kinds of subjects. 

Back in 2009, I published a short, inexpensive poetry book of these early poems, just to give out to my family and friends. Since then, my style has changed and matured as I have been composing poems on numerous topics and in several different styles. For a few years, I have been saying that I was going to publish these in another book "someday", but was never motivated enough to actually save money or seriously pursue this goal.

Recently, after attending a conference by author Donald Miller, I have been inspired to take action and pursue my dream of truly being a published author. 

This book is a collection of free verse poetry on topics such as love and its difficulties and victories, solitude/loneliness, God and his love/grace/power to change lives, and the desire for change/security/significance. 

I want to publish this book so I can share the words and the gifts God has given me with the world, to fulfill the calling God has given me. I want the words contained in this book to inspire and encourage others and to show that it is possible, with God's power, to triumph over all of the difficulties and struggles that life brings. I am not doing it to get rich--I don't care at all how much money I make. I just want to get my poetry out there to more of the world, no matter what.

 

Costs

The money you contribute will cover my costs for publishing my book through CreateSpace (a division of Amazon). The least expensive package I can purchase costs $978, and includes the following:

- Custom cover design for the book

- Custom interior design for the book

- An ISBN and barcode

- Book Selling page on www.Amazon.com with free search-inside-the-book feature!

- Listings on Amazon.co.uk, Amazon.de, Amazon.fr, Amazon.it and Amazon.es

- Flexible book pricing and royalties

- Royalties paid monthly

Of the additional funds I am requesting, roughly $100 of it will cover the purchase of 50 author's copies of the book (basically books that I would order from Amazon to sell to people in person). 

I would also, ideally, like to raise between $139 and $200 more, to purchase either promotional business cards (to hand out to people I meet  at writers' groups/professional meetings/other social events) or for the promotional text creation service (where a professional copywriter shapes the book's key messages into marketing copy designed to suit a variety of purposes). These are not essentials, but I believe they would greatly enhance the saleability of my book.

If I don't meet my complete funding goal, any money I receive will be put in a special savings fund for the book, and I will continue to save my own money to add to it until I reach my goal.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends and family (or just anyone who likes poetry) about this project via Facebook, Twitter, or any other means you would like!

story:
Cindy Sheehan and others are in the beginning stages of planning a bike ride from Casey Sheehan's grave in Vacaville, Ca  to Washington D.C. to demand true and positive change. The ride will begin on the day that Casey was KIA in Iraq (April 04) and end in DeCeit on July 3rd.

We are hoping that MANY riders will join us for all or part of the way, but especially join us for a convergence at Arlington Cemetery on July 3rd, to ride on the  White House to present our demands.

We are also hoping that activists and groups along the way will sponsor meetings, rallies (with vegetarian potlucks), comfy beds, and support, to help us organize for PEACE, to help us to raise money to help fund the tour AND raise money for good causes to help the devastated people of Iraq and Afghanistan.

The ride will begin on the day that Casey was KIA in Iraq (April 04) and end in DeCeit on July 3rd.We are hoping that MANY riders will join us for all or part of the way, but especially join us for a convergence at Arlington Cemetery on July 3rd, to ride on the  White House to present our demands.We are also hoping that activists and groups along the way will sponsor meetings, rallies (with vegetarian potlucks), comfy beds, and support, to help us organize for PEACE, to help us to raise money to help fund the tour AND raise money for good causes to help the devastated people of Iraq and Afghanistan.

story:
Me:

My name is Luke, I’ve been published multiple times though nothing too groundbreaking.  I’m an army vet with a tour to Afghanistan and a purple heart recipient,  I’ve had nonstop experiences with adversity and adventure. I have tactical knowledge with a touch of political prowess and solid understanding of legislature and the legal system, I feel drawn to cover this story because how these volatile moments in our nation’s history are handled can have reverberations felt for decades.  The increased militarization of police and their tactics may be unnecessary but who’s opinion do you want on that? Some CNN reporter who drove a new BMW at 16 and had an ivy league education handed to him  or the army vet who grew up anywhere from section 8 to middle class and has worked  for the knowledge he has.

Send me to Ferguson!

My Goal:

one of the most pivotal moments in our modern battle between the lack of balance in police power and citizen freedoms is taking place in the middle of our country. Every report and write up of the event that the mainstream media is embellishing  has race and political agenda at its heart which completely detracts from the fact that our rights are being disregarded along with the wellbeing of the protesters and populous of Ferguson. I'm not going to determine whether the shooting was justified or not, even if I could we have a legal system for that and those facts will eventually arise anyways. I'm asking you to help me go so that the acts committed during these protests turned riots aren't forgotten.  we have the right to peaceably gather and protest is this being infringed upon or is violence within the protests the cause for action, are the police instigating or just reacting? what's happening there? help me find out and write the most factual piece on Ferguson to be published thus far.

Needs.

Voice recorder $35

HD shock proof camera$ 250

Gas both ways 350$

Food 100$

Potential bail money $???

story:
La Silla Vacía

La Silla Vacía es un medio digital independiente que cuenta cómo se ejerce el poder en Colombia desde hace siete años. En un país donde los medios tradicionales están muy cerca de los poderosos ya sea porque son de propiedad de conglomerados económicos o porque tienen una filiación partidista, La Silla Vacía ha demostrado que es capaz de contar todo lo que sabe y de saber todo lo que cuenta.

www.lasillavacia.com 

 

La campaña de Súper Amigos

Desde hace cinco años arrancamos esta campaña de Súper Amigos que hacemos solo una vez al año y que nos ha permitido, a partir de las donaciones de nuestros usuarios, expandir nuestro trabajo y fortalecer nuestra independencia.

Hacer periodismo de calidad e independiente es mucho más fácil si contamos con el apoyo económico de nuestros usuarios. Dependiendo de qué tan generosos sean, reforzaremos tres líneas de trabajo con estos recursos.

Por un lado, reforzaremos nuestras investigaciones de largo aliento, comenzando por una grande sobre quiénes reciben subsidios y exenciones en Colombia y otras que someteremos a votación de los Súper Amigos antes de arrancar a hacerlas.

Y por el otro, fortaleceremos nuestro Detector de Mentiras y la línea de vídeo en La Silla.

Con los 76 millones que recibimos la vez pasada de 549 Súper Amigos, nos comprometimos a crear La Silla Pacífico como un nuevo medio regional que, como la Caribe y la Santandereana, cubra las movidas del poder en esa región del país.

También nos comprometimos a destinar parte de los recursos a mejorar la experiencia móvil.

La Silla cumplió. Su nueva pata vio la luz la semana pasada, con un equipo de dos periodistas dedicado tiempo completo a cubrir el Pacífico desde Cali. Y desde comienzos del año con nuestro nuevo rediseño que está pensado principalmente para ser consultado en el teléfono le cumplimos a nuestros donantes con la segunda parte del acuerdo.

Esta vez, y dado el crecimiento que hemos tenido, queremos superar nuestro récord histórico y alcanzar los 750 Súper Amigos.

En Colombia no existe una cultura de donaciones y tomar la decisión de hacer un aporte implica romper una inercia. Pero al hacerlo, nos están ayudando no solo a mantenernos vivos sino también a que en el futuro puedan surgir otros proyectos periodísticos como La Silla.

story:
Il Comitato Ventotene nasce dall'iniziativa di giovani universitari e lavoratori per offrire una nuova direzione alla vita culturale e politica del paese. La nostra motivazione arriva dal sogno di un’Europa unita e dall'amore per la libertà.

Stiamo organizzando una conferenza per iniziare una collaborazione fra tutte le persone de associazioni  che si riconoscono nell'Europeismo per diffondere sul territorio le idee che porteranno il continente ad affrontare le grandi sfide poste dal nostro tempo e  parlare di rappresentanza dei millennials nelle istituzioni.

I temi trattati saranno:

•Europeismo ed euroscetticismo: l'importanza di una Europa Unita

•TTIP: Opportunità o minaccia?

•Peso politico e rappresentanza dei Millennials in Italia e nel mondo

Il vostro contributo ci aiuterà a realizzare una conferenza a Milano con la migliore copertura social e un' esperienza più coinvolgente per i presenti. Superato l’obiettivo dei 200 euro concentreremo i fondi nell'organizzazione di eventi simili in tutta Italia, e – perché no? - Europa.

La politica è divisa in due schieramenti: europeisti ed antieuropeisti. Da una parte chi vuole essere libero di vedere avverarsi i propri sogni anche in un altro paese, di muoversi senza barriere in un continente di 500 milioni di persone e di sentirsi importante in un mondo sempre più multipolarizzato. Dall’altra chi vuole regredire alla forma ormai superata degli stati-nazione, che porteranno i paesi europei a sparire dallo scacchiere internazionale entro il 2025.

É la nostra generazione che deve affrontare queste sfide. Avremo l’onere di farci carico dell’enorme mole di debito creato dai nostri padri e il dovere di portare avanti il processo di integrazione europea per ritornare ad avere un peso nel mondo.

Se riusciremo a trovare dei punti in comune che possiamo portare avanti con le associazioni trattate, cominceremo da subito una serie di conferenze sul territorio per far conoscere alle persone i vantaggi di un’Europa unita e le opportunità per noi giovani.

Stretch goals:

·  € 100

Live coverage dell’evento sui social così che anche da casa ci si possa sentire coinvolti, attraverso il live Facebook;

·  € 175

Cento spille del nostro Comitato da consegnare ai presenti in sala;

·   > € 175

Fondi destinati ad un'altra conferenza con lo stesso format nelle altre città italiane.

story:
Who We Are

Printer's Devil Review is an independent, open access journal of fiction, poetry, essays, and visual art. We provide emerging writers and artists with access to publication, and inquisitive readers with new voices and visions.

PDR is not associated with any commercial publisher or university; we offer the magazine for free and the editors are practicing writers and artists who volunteer their time to bring work they admire to a wider audience.

What We Do

We're dedicated to providing a well-designed online publication, one that's full of new voices and visions and available for free as a PDF from our site and for the minimum cost possible ($1) as an ebook for the Kindle, Nook, and iBookstore

Why We Need Your Help

We don't have any outside sources of funding; it's all out-of-pocket. We had been getting by hosting the magazine on a budget server, but our readers were telling us they couldn't always get to the site--it took forever to load, or the server had crashed.  The service provider was the subject of a denial of service attack by a malicious hacker that disrupted our site for several days.

All the work we put into the magazine doesn't mean much if readers can't reach us, so we decided to pony up for a fast, reliable server; but those don't come cheap.

That's why we're asking for $500 to pay for approximately 20 months on a VPS server with a guaranteed 99% up-time. We put out an issue every six months, so that's three issues plus extra content we add to the site--like our recent interview with Miranda July.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially (we get it, we're starving artists, too), please spread the word about the magazine and our campaign. We'd be much obliged!

story:
One Way Ticket?

I have been writing and publishing zines for the last ten years. My main publication has been the zine One Way Ticket, of which I have released 7 issues. What began in 2002 as rants and polemics about punk rock and resistance has morphed into tall tales of the triumphs and tragedies of living an anarchist life: hitch-hiking, chance encounters, precarious jobs, student strikes and free food in all its forms. My most recent offering, One Way Ticket #7, was the chronicle of a year spent in Pittsburgh — renovating a collective house and finding adventure in the most unlikely of places. 

My zine has regularly received positive reviews from Broken Pencil (two times "zine of the month"), Maximum Rock 'n Roll, Give Me Back and other independent publications. There is an interview with me about writing a zine here. At the 2012 Kazoo Zine & Comic Expo in Guelph, Ontario I received the award for "best zine." Issue #7 of my zine had a letter-pressed cover that was printed by me on a hand-fed 100 year old printing press in Guelph, Ontario. I was also interviewed on the University of Guelph's campus radio station CFRU for a show called Books for Breakfast in the fall of 2011.

I have up to now photocopied all my zines myself, as well as cutting, assembling, stapling and folding each copy by hand. In many ways this has been a great joy, but spending 6 hours straight watching paper jam after paper jam no longer seems like the best use of my time. I'm putting forward this campaign to secure funds to reprint issue #7 of my zine and print a new issue that is in its final stages of production. I have set a deadline of mid-august for this next issue to be released at the Portland Zine Symposium. I would like to have these zines printed offset rather than photocopying them myself so that I have more time to work on the writing and editing of the new issue. I will also use funds secured for travel expenses associated with attending the Portland Zine Symposium and doing a tour of zine readings around coastal BC and Washington State.

Contributions to this project will help the zine achieve a higher and more consistent printed quality, and allow me to work much more on the writing and designing of it, rather than the details of print produciton. Even with a small donation you can help the zine succeed and help me develop as a writer.

What I Need and What You Get

Here is how I will use the funds secured:

  • $238 for reprinting One Way Ticket #7
  • $245 for printing the next issue of One Way Ticket
  • $275 for mini zine tour and postage expenses


Contributors will get a few exciting things from me in return for their donations.

Donate $10 or more to be a Sharpie and you will receive one copy of the new issue of One Way Ticket with a personal thank you note.

Donate $20 or more to be an X-Acto Knife and you will get a copy of the new issue of One Way Ticket and a copy of issue #7 with a personal thank you note.

Donate $50 or more to be a Photocopier and you will get a copy of the new issue of One Way Ticket, plus a full back catalogue of zines still available (#5, #6, #6.5, #7) a personal thank you note, and an extra copy of the new issue and #7 that I will send either to a friend of yours or to a political prisoner, your choice.  Plus I will add your name to the list of contributors on my upcoming website/blog (only if you want).

Donate $100 or more and be a 24 Hour Kinkos. You get everything mentioned above plus one of the following (your choice):

  • a custom cut & paste, beautifully designed poster thanking you
  • mention of contribution on the first page of my next zine
  • a portrait of you painted by me (my skill with painting is at an approximate 3rd grade level, but has also been described as "mesmerizing", see above photo)
  • if circumstances allow, a hitch-hiking trip with me

Why Tell Our Stories?

Zines are a way to tell stories that are left out, marginal and dangerous. Telling my stories and encouraging others to do so is why I keep publishing zines and being a part of the zine community. I have had the chance to read my writing in front of some friendly audiences over the past few years, and I always get a tremendous response. I feel that others are truly inspired to create things, to tell their own stories, or to find another outlet to express whatever can't be expressed within the dominant channels of our society. This funding will help me to focus full time on the new stories that can sustain and challenge a subversive community.

Are you as broke as me?

Word. If you can't give me any money that's cool, I know what it's like. If you like my zine and this idea, please tell anyone you know about it who might have some scrilla. Indiegogo has a number of ways to connect to social networks and get the word out. Share this page if you can!

story:
2 draft novels, 15ish poems, a couple of blogs, and 5-6 short stories later, I consider myself a writer. An unpublished writer, sure, but a writer nonetheless. 

At this point in my career, I want the satisfaction of seeing my words on paper in a book that I can hand out to my friends and can sell. But while I wait to be discovered, I cannot help but take things in my own hands and put my own work out there by publishing the damn thing myself. Guess it's the Scorpio in me! 

I've tried sitting down and writing butt in chair every day. But I need a fierce goal. I need to know that there will be something tangible at the end of the road. I figured that if I did not have worry about the "if" or "when" of publishing a novel, I can just focus on writing and editing the novel. 

TELL US MORE ABOUT THE NOVEL!

Right. So there's this ongoing joke with my friends that started when I began to live in one of the most "interestingly ghetto" neighborhoods of Montreal, Côte-des-Neiges. Strange things have happened to me here. Very strange people live here. In fact, I was even compelled to sleep on friends' couches for a little while because the thought of crawling back to my dingy hole was the last thing I wanted to do after a night out. Thus the bum chronicles began! 

My friends often tell me I should write about those crazy city-life stories. So I thought I would inspire myself from those experiences and write a Trainspotting-like novel.

We are all like flies trying to find any scrap of life to hang onto only to buzz around the same pile of shit as everyone else. And then we are shooed away and smacked across the room face and butt flat against the wall. Or we just keep flying until our wings can no longer carry the useless burden of flapping and flapping about.

 

That's where you come in! I took a long look at how much it would cost to self-publish and self-advertise my own book. And if I could raise at least $5,000, I'll be off to a really good start while I finish writing my novel and get it ready to be published. I am even going to try to coincide being done with the book at the same time as this fundraising campaign ends. Crazy? Yeah, I guess that's one way to describe how I attack personal projects.

Here's the rough breakdown:

Self-Publishing Package 4 000,00 $
Extra Writing/Editing/Publishing Fees 900,00 $
Costco boxes of ramen noodles to survive on for at least 3 months 100,00 $
150-book order to pimp out in the streets like a literate hooker 4 000,00 $
Amazing Book Launch Party 1 000,00 $

TOTAL 10 000,00 $

I know I set my goal to $5,000, but hopefully together we'll be able to raise even more!

For sure for sure for sure, anyone who donates gets their name printed on a special thank you page in my book. On the right-hand side, you will find even more interesting perks such as thank you cards, a poem, a short story, and more! Plus, it would be interesting if many of you order the poems or the short stories, because they could be a part of another self-publishing project! The Bum Poems. The Bum Short Stories.

My perks range from $5 - $1000, but every dollar helps.

CHALLENGE ME!

There are many ways to support my weird writing need:

- Back my campaign today with your dollars, and claim your rewards!
- Share my campaign with friends and family on Twitter, Facebook, websites, blogs, etc.
